loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, bread, sweets, juices, water, etc., and strengthen her store to offer new products to her customers.

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsy, administro muy bien el crédito que padecomsm y Kiva le confiaron anteriormente, el negocio ha tenido un efecto positivo, pues a estabilizad mejor la tienda y la venta de frutas y verduras, en su hogar todos gozan de muy buena salud y mejor alimentación.
Para cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes se ve en la necesidad de  solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir en bebidas, huevos, granos básicos, azúcar, sal, frutas, verduras, etc. abastecerá el negocio para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsy successfully managed the loan given to her previously by PADECOMSM and Kiva. It has had a positive effect, as it has stabilised the shop and the sale of fruit and vegetables. Everyone in her family enjoy excellent health and a better diet.

To cover her customers' new demands, she needs to request a new loan to invest in drinks, eggs, basic grains, sugar, salt, fruit, vegetables, etc. to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs, basic grains, sugar, salt, fruit, vegetables, etc. to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: This is Alfred who is a dairy farmer. He is married with two children. He has been keeping cows for 20 years and sales his milk into the nearby villages. He has been a long serving client of ECLOF Kenya. He is humble and a faithful man who owners his pleadge. Through His Milk produce he has managed to take care of his household and school his children. He wants to increase his income with a KIVA loan to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.en:
Tuliya is a group from the city of Uvira in the Democratic Republic Of Congo. Furaha is one of the five Mamas (the Swahili word for woman) from this group. She is 40  years old and married, the mother of with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
For several years Furaha has earned her living selling petrol. She has requested a loan of US 100 to purchase additional stocks to sell. This means purchasing bottles of fuel to sell on the roadside, mostly to motorbike taxi. Furaha has borrowed and repaid her first loan from Wezesha Project and with her second loan she hopes to earn more income to cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase petrol

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack, pictured above, is a hard-working entrepreneur who sells solar products to small businesses and households without reliable or affordable energy access. Jack is 30 years old, married, and has two children. 

Jack has been selling BrightBox, One Degree Solar’s solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios, for three years. Since he started his business, he has opened two additional shops and hired nine employees. His long-term goal is to grow his business to include three more shops and employ nine more employees (2 employees per shop).   

While happy with his initial success, Jack has realized that many of his customers cannot afford to pay upfront with cash. These same customers are often stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging. To break this cycle and provide renewable energy to these customers, Jack would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those customers who need it most, while also increasing his inventory on hand to serve more customers. He seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Jack will use funds for 100 units of BrightBox solar kits, which will energize and empower households across Kenya. Customers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them upfront or over several months. Since customers are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Jack will help families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: To purchase solar kits to supply and empower rural communities without energy access

loans.name: Manuel Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo, de 47 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, está casado y su pareja es comerciante en pequeño de productos de la canasta básicos; es padre de dos hijos y solo vive con su esposa y su hijo.

Arnoldo, se dedica desde 15 años a trabajar como motorista de transporte de carga pesada, aprendió este oficio en Estados Unidos, ya que estuvo 10 años en ese país, al venir al país nuevamente, compró su carro para trabajar, porque no encontró otra fuente de ingresos, antes solo trababa como jornalero.- El lugar a donde va hacer viajes es variable y casi siempre trabaja de las 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.

Arnoldo, con el dinero del crédito comprará cerdos y materiales para construir una galera para mantener resguardados, comprará estos cerdos para que se reproduzcan y poder venderlos.

Los sueños se Arnoldo son que su hija se supere academicamente, tambien sueña con ser un productor potencial de cerdos, con las ganancias que le genere este negocio, quiere ayudarle a su esposa, para que  aumente el inventario de su tienda.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is 47 years old and left education after the sixth grade. He is married and his wife is a a small-scale trader of basic goods. He has two children and lives with his wife and one of his children.

For 15 years, Arnold has made a living working as a heavy goods driver, a job he learned in the US, where he spent ten years. Upon returning to his home country, he bought a car to work, because he was unable to find other work. Before this, he used to work as a day labourer. The place he goes to work varies and he almost always works from 6:00 in the morning to 16:00 in the afternoon.

Arnoldo will use the loan to buy to buy pigs and the materials to build a pigsty to keep them in. He will buy the pigs to breed and sell on.

Arnoldo dreams of his daughter succeeding academically. He also dreams of being a pig farmer. With the earnings from this business, he wants to help his wife increase the stock in her shop.

loans.use: to buy pigs and the materials to build a pigsty to keep them in.

loans.name: Mungu Ni Mwema Group

texts.en: Suzana is a member of the Mungu Ni Mwema Group, part of Wezesha Project in Uvira in Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. She is a 45 years old married mother of 13 children. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital to run her business and make money for her family. She couldn't purchase 6 sacks of charcoal. However, when she joined Wezesha Project she used the funds from her first two loans to expand her business, and now her third loan will allow her to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal. This will greatly increase her ability to make money and support her 13 children.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Michal

texts.en: Michal is 28 a single man living in Mundri town in South Sudan. He operates a retail business where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a residential area, in a market next to the road. He requesting a loan of 1,500 SSP to expand the business.

loans.use: TO buy more goods spare parts  to the customers for sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvest rice.

loans.name: Ntambwe

texts.en:
Ntambwe is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perish ability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Carolina Suleyma

texts.es:
Carolina, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar cemento, arena, hierro y bloques, con estos materiales remodelara y reparara la cocina en la que elabora la venta de tortillas, pretende tener una mejor imagen de su negocio y evitar dificultades para trabajar en la época de invierno.
Con el financiamiento anterior Carolina ha podido contar con la materia prima para mantener la tortillería funcionando y generando ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carolina needs a new loan to buy to buy cement, sand, iron and blocks to remodel and repair the kitchen in which she prepares tortillas to sell. She wants to improve the image of her business and avoid any difficulties working over winter.

With her previous loan, Carolina was able to obtain the raw materials she needed to keep her tortilla business open and generating a profit to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and blocks to remodel and repair the kitchen in which she prepares tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Mama Tuliya Group

texts.en:
Margueritte is 32 years old and a member of Wezesha Project in Mama Tuliya Group from Uvira, Wastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. She studied until the 6th grade, then her economic situation did not allow her to continue with her studies. She got married at 23 years old, her husband earns a living doing agricultural jobs. Of the eight children she has, five study and the others are not yet old enough to do so. The family is made up of 10 people in total. 

Margueritte earns a living for sellig fish, work that she has done for about six years. Before she went to work her husband was the only one who earned an income and it was not sufficient. She is asking for this loan in order to buy more fish for sale and use the proceeds to pay rent on a plot of land for farming. She hopes that this year will be a good harvest so that she can make a large profit to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a Solar Home Solutions for better utilization of time and increase productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to progress in life, by buying a computer to facilitate her postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Zulma is 19 years old. She is single; she doesn't have children, and she lives with her parents.  Zulma loves her parents very much, and she helps them with the chores every day. Zulma learned with her mother how to make cheese. She has made cheese since she was a child. 

Zulma needs a loan to buy a milking cow; she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Daniel Alex

texts.es:
Daniel, es propietario de un taller electrónico para automóviles, atiende a sus clientes de 9:00 am. a  4:00 pm., lo hace con ayuda de empleados, vive con su familia y tiene dos hijas, hasta la fecha no presenta dificultades.
Invertirá el crédito en aceite, adictivos, cables, pastillas para frenos, luces, desatornilladores, entre otras herramientas y repuestos para vehículos, así realizará sus trabajos con mucha más calidad y atenderá mejor a sus clientes, su objetivo es lograr aumentar el número de clientes que visitan su negocio para que su situación financiera mejore.
Sueña con tener una fuente de ingresos permanente para cubrir las necesidades familiares y equipar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Daniel is the owner of an electrical car shop. He attends to his clients from 9 am until 4 pm. He does this with the help of employees. He lives with his family and has two children. Up to now this has not been a difficulty.

He will invest the loan in oil, additives, cables, brake pads, lights, screwdrivers amongst other tools and vehicle parts. Then he will be able to do his work with much higher quality and serve his customers better. His goal is to expand the number of clients who visit his business so that his financial situation improves. He dreams of having a sustainable source of income to cover the family's needs and to equip his business better.

loans.use: will invest the loan in oil, additives, cables, brake pads, lights, screwdrivers amongst other tools and vehicle parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be patient and honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soft drinks, flour and other items.She also runs an m-pesa business. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, and add m-pesa float. 

Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour and add m-pesa float

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is not married. She enrolled in 2011, and plans to graduate in the year 2015. She is requesting a school fee loan in order for her to be able to pay the whole sum of money at once, because she can only afford to pay it in installments.

In future, she plans to become a manager in a certain company in Rwanda.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Willian Ernesto

texts.es:
Willian, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y no tienen hijos y vive en casa de sus padres.

Willian, trabaja de electricista en una empresa de cables de televisión, tiene 3 años de trabajar en esa empresa, los cuales le han ayudado a superarse económicamente y ganar experiencia laboral para futuros empleos, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, tiene que viajar una hora en autobús y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado de 7:00 de la mañana a 5:00 de la tarde y cuando tiene mucho trabajo sale más tarde.

El financiamiento del crédito lo utilizara para comprar mil bloques, 15 bolsas de cemento, cuatro quintales de hierro y pago de mano de obra.- Willian, no tiene la capacidad económica para comprar una casa o construirla, porque su sueldo es relativamente bajo, es por eso que mejor decidió construir un cuarto en la casa de sus padres, para poder tener privacidad con su esposa. 

Los sueños de Willian son, seguir estudiando y en un futuro poder construir su propia casa, también desea tener hijos y poder encontrar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Willian is 23 years old, studied until high school, and is married. His wife takes care of the home; they do not have children, and they live with his parents.

Willian has been working as an electrician for a television cable company for three years, which has helped him get ahead economically and gain work experience for future employment. To get to work, he has to travel an hour by bus, and he works Monday to Saturday from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, and sometimes later when work requires it.

The loan will be used to buy a thousand bricks, 15 bags of cement, four quintals of iron, and to pay labor. Willian does not have the financial capacity to buy a house or build one, because his salary is relatively low. This is why he decided it would be better to build a room in his parents house, to have privacy with his wife.

Willian’s dreams are to keep studying, to be able to build his own home in the future, to have children, and to find a better job.

loans.use: to buy 1000 bricks, 15 bags of cement, four quintals of iron, and to pay labor to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home solution for her business.

loans.name: Jose Transito

texts.es:
José, de 68 años de edad, no estudio, está casado y su esposa se dedica a trabajos del hogar y en tiempos oportunos realiza actividades fuera de su hogar, para obtener un poco de dinero para los gastos familiares, tiene 4 hijos, pero ya son mayores de edad y no viven en su casa.

José, se ha dedicado a trabajos agrícolas, sembrando maíz, frijol y sorgo; además cultiva henequén, es por eso que ha obtenido gran experiencia a través de su vida.-  Los cultivos están a una distancia de 1 kilómetro y trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 3:00 de la tarde.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar alambre, grapas y madera para mejorar las cercas y también para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como, semilla y fertilizantes.

A pesar de sus 68 años de edad José, mantiene sus fuerzas para trabajar en la agricultura, pero sus sueños aún no terminan, porque el desea dejarles como herencia a sus hijos, los terrenos que actualmente tiene, para que continúen la tradición de la familia, la cual es la siembra.
texts.en:
José is 68 years old. He didn't go to school. He is married and his wife works mostly at home, although there are times when she works outside the home in order to make some extra money for their family's expenses. He has four children who are all grown and live on their own.

José works as a farmer, growing corn, beans, and sorghum. He also grows henequen (a species of agave). He has gained a lot of farming experience during his lifetime. His crops are located at a distance of 1 km. He works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.

José needs this loan to buy wire, staples, and wood to improve his fences, and also to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

In spite of his 68 years of age, José stays strong in order to keep farming. His dreams don't end here, because he wants his children to inherit the land he currently owns so that they may continue the family tradition, which is farming.

loans.use: to buy wire, staples, and wood to improve his fences and farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Solar Home Solution

loans.name: Jose Nery

texts.es:
José, es un carpintero que elabora muebles por encargo y para vender, esté oficio lo aprendió cuando por un tiempo estuvo viviendo en el extranjero,  posteriormente regreso al país y desde hace tres años tiene un negocio bien establecido, en los alrededores del mercado de la localidad, su producción  es constante y cuenta con clientes establecidos, su horario es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos, toda la familia depende de él.
Solicita un crédito para comprar madera, barniz, clavos, martillo y lijas, tendrá lo necesario en su carpintería para elaborar muebles para vender y entregar algunos pedidos con los que ya cuenta, espera tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia y cancelar su deuda.
José sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y que se mantenga en el mercado con capital propio.
texts.en:
José is a carpenter who makes furniture on order and to sell. He learned this trade when he lived abroad for some time. He later returned to his home country and has had a well-established business for three years, located on the outskirts of the local market. He is constantly producing furniture and has regular customers. He works from 7:00 to 17:00. He lives with his wife and two children, and he is the sole breadwinner. 

He is requesting a loan to buy wood, varnish, nails, a hammer and files so that he has everything he needs in his carpentry workshop to make furniture to sell and fulfil some orders he has. 

He hopes to boost his earnings to support his family and pay back his debt. He dreams of having a bigger business which sustains itself with its own capital.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, nails, a hammer and files so that he has everything he needs in his carpentry workshop to make furniture to sell and fulfil some orders he has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home solution for her stitching centre and increase her standard of living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Solar Solution

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 39 years old and has seven children. She is married and her three children are still in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

Teresita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for two years and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize

loans.name: Hector Arely

texts.es:
Héctor, está acompañado, vive en casa propia con su pareja y dos hijos, como actividad económica se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, trabaja en el campo con mucho placer debido que de esa manera subsiste con su familia, lo inicio hace 10 años con capital propio, trabaja de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Comprará abono, semilla, herbicidas e insecticidas, con los que podrá mejorar la productividad de su cosecha y evitara los problemas que puedan surgir con las plagas, espera tener granos básicos para alimentar  a su familia y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Sus sueños son trabajar constantemente para lograr tener un negocio más reconocido en su localidad y con mejor rentabilidad para cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Hector is married and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two children.  He raises basic grains and enjoys working in the field because he supports his family in this way.  He started doing this 10 years ago with his own capital and works daily from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.

He will use the money to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicide and insecticide so that he can improve his production and harvest.  This will also prevent any problems that can come because of infestations.  He hopes to have better grain so he can feed his family and better provide for his customers’ needs.

He wants to work constantly so he can have a better known and more profitable business so he can pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Napoleon Alberto

texts.es:
Napoleón, vive con su esposa de 32 años de edad y sus hijos de 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, él se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos además practica la crianza de ganado,  toda la familia colabora para que el negocio se mantenga funcionando, en su hogar tiene diferentes clases de animales tales como patos, gallinas y cerdos.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para tener todo listo al momento de realizar su próxima siembra de granos básicos, de esa manera espera que la cosecha sea abundante, para almacenarla y alimentar a su familia por un largo tiempo así mismo podrá vender otra parte para tener ingresos.
Sus sueños son darles a sus hijos estudios universitarios para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y disminuir el nivel de endeudamiento.
texts.en:
Napoleón lives with his 32 year-old wife and their children, ages 15, 10 and 7. He makes a living working in the field farming basic grains, and also raises livestock. The whole family works to keep the business running. They have different types of animals in their home such as ducks, chickens, and pigs.

Napoleón will invest in agricultural materials to have everything ready for his next harvest, and hopes this will make the harvest abundant, to store it and feed his family for a long time, and also sell some of it for income.

His dreams are to provide his children with a college education so they can have a better future, and to decrease his debt.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural goods to have everything ready for his next harvest of basic grains.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Sarim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sarim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sarim and her group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be loyal.

John operates a retail business where he sells eletronics. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area conducive to his business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of electriconics.

His business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of electronics.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She also operates an M-pesa business. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are individuals.

She will use the KES 65,000 loan to buy more stocks of cosmetics and open another M-pesa business. Her business goal is to have more business branches within 5 years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cosmetics and open another M-pesa business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Aileen is a mother of one and married to Charlito. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Aileen works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitches hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Aileen is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Aileen is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan as payment for the ATM card that she pawned.

Aileen hopes to give her family a better life in the future. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equip them with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring the skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Aileen before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Andi lives in Cianjur, located about three hours drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. Andi joined Ruma in 2014. He knew Ruma from one of the sales executives who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business as well as increase his savings and contribute more to his community. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Andi sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Kiva loan will be very useful to help Andi improve his business and accordingly his community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Andi is standing in his stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

loans.name: Rilda

texts.en: Rilda is 19 years old and she sells vegetables. She lives with her parents but she supports the family. Rilda needs a loan to buy more vegetables. She would like to offer more carrots and spinach to her customers because she wants to make more money and give her parents more facilities.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Sokkean

texts.en:
Sokkean, 31, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher and earns, on average, USD 5.00 a day. She has been in this profession for five years. She is married to Rang, 31, a rice farmer with an earning of USD 3.00 a day. This couple has only one child.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, improve their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer de 28 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es el comercio de artículos de limpieza. 
Ella es de piel morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, usa lentes de aumento, baja estatura, Complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, a la derecha, usa chompa blanca y blusa blanca a rayas lilas) sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sabanas, venta de artículos de cuero, técnico eléctrico, venta de frutos secos, vidriería, venta de verduras y llantería. Para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de productos de limpieza, como; escobas, estropajos, alza basuras, escobillones y otros. Actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, empujando un carrito de 2 ruedas cargados de todo tipo de productos de limpieza. “inicie mi negocio ayudando a mi tía y por la necesidad de trabajar para pagar los gastos de mi hijo, trabajo sola…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir una tienda distribuidora con todo tipo de productos, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de artículos de limpieza para vender por volumen y aumentar sus ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que Paola solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de artículos de limpieza para vender por volumen y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paola is a 28-year-old divorced woman. She has a 4-year-old son and works selling cleaning products.

She has olive skin, long black hair, dark eyes, wears glasses, has a medium build and her mother tongue is Quechua. She also speaks Spanish, which she uses in her business. In the photo, she is standing to the right, wearing a white jacket and a striped shirt. 

Her desire to improve her life made her decide to lead a communal bank with people working in different fields such as the sale of products (sheets, leather products, dried fruit, vegetables), electrical services, glasswork and tire repair. The goal of the bank is to request loans to improve their activities. 

Paola's business is the sale of cleaning products such as brooms, scrubbers, dustpans, and brushes. She sells her products on the street with a 2-wheel cart. She says, "I started my business with the help of my aunt because of the need to work to support my son...I work independently...". Her dream is to open a store with all types of products. She wishes to purchase a variety of cleaning products to sell in bulk and increase her earnings. That is why Paola is requesting a loan to buy various cleaning products to sell in bulk and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy various cleaning products to sell in bulk to increase their earnings.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 22 years old. She is married with three children, aged between one and eight years old. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for seven years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land for farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 150 chicks, concentrated feed, and feeders.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Petrona (es la que aparece en medio de la fotografía)  es madre de familia  de 24 años de edad, tiene una hijo de 2 años,  y viven en una comunidad llamada San Antonio Palopo. 
Petrona es una mujer que se dedica a su trabajo, para prosperar con su familia,  a pesar de que ella solo tiene un hijo, no es motivo de perder el tiempo, a Petrona su mamá le enseño buenos principios que para prosperar en la vida hay que trabajar para generar ingresos, pues con esa mentalidad Petrona desde hace seis años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica tales como: güipiles y cortes de difentes diseños , ella eligió esta actividad porque en la comunidad donde vive llegan compradores de lugares aledaños que utilizan estos trajes. Ella es vendedora  ambulante no cuenta  con un local formal. 
Petrona quiere agrandar su negocio pero con las ganancias no es suficiente esta nueva inversión entonces para poder lograr esta meta ella decidió mejor buscar un prestamo junto a un grupo de señoras para completar el capital ella  lo utilizaría para comprar más mercadería de ropa típica.
Los sueños de Petrona con la ampliación del negocio es generar más ganancias, para que más adelante pueda comprar un terreno donde pueda cultivar productos de su región
texts.en:
Petrona (the woman in the middle in the photograph) is a 24-year-old mother with a two-year-old child. They live in a town called San Antonio Palopo.  Patrona dedicates herself to her work in order to succeed with her family. Even though she only has one child, that's no reason to lose time. Petrona's mother taught her valuable principles, telling her that to prosper in life, you have to work to earn a living. 

With this mentality, six years ago Patrona began buying and selling traditional clothing such as colourful embroidered blouses and skirts in various designs. She chose this activity because in the community in which she lives, people who wear these outfits come from far and wide to buy them. She is a mobile seller and doesn't have her own official premises.

Petrona wants to expand her business but her earnings do not allow her to do this. Therefore, to achieve her goal she decided that it was better to get a loan with a group of women to secure the capital, which she will use to buy more traditional clothing.

Petrona dreams of expanding her business in order to boost her profits, so that in the future, she can buy a plot of land where she can grow regional produce.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Ramond

texts.en:
Ramond's prior loan helped him with his rice cultivation. He repaid his loan and earned profits, which helped him to save for his family's future.

Ramond is requesting another loan for 8,000 SRD, which he will use to buy more inputs for his rice production.  He wants to save money for a rice plot and has to expand his rice areas so he can earn more profits and save more.

loans.use: to purchase more inputs for his rice production

loans.name: Raban

texts.en:
Raban, a father of four, describes himself to be God-fearing. For two years he has operated a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, milk, soap and other items. His enterprise is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. His biggest challenge is inadequate working capital. 

Raban will use this Kes 20,000 loan, his second with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy more sugar, flour, bread, milk and other items. His goal is to have a large business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more  sugar, flour, bread, milk, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a married mother of two, describes herself as industrious. For seven years she has operated a retail business where she sells milk, flour, sugar and other items. Her enterprise is located in a viable area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

Elizabeth will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more milk to sell. Her previous loan repaid, this will be her second with SMEP Microfinance Bank. 

Elizabeth's goal is to have a stable business within five years, and she hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 37 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей школьного возраста. У Аиды неоконченное высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей ткани, стартовав в 2012 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Аиды, на сегодняшний день у нее развитый бизнес, наработаны постоянные покупатели. Ее ежемесячная прибыль - около 60,000 сом (KGS). Аида обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки ткани и расширения ассортимента. Она намерена свои доходы от кредита направить на обучение детей и дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aida is 37 years old, divorced, and the mother of two school-aged children. Aida did not finish her university studies. As a main source of income for her family, she sells fabric. Having begun in 2012, Aida thanks to perseverance, determination and hard work now has a developed business and regular customers. Her monthly income is about 60,000 som (KGS). Aida applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase fabrics to expand her assortment. She intends to use income from the loan for her children's education and further development of the business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale in order to increase her assortment.

loans.name: Amevi

texts.fr: Mariée et agée de 55 ans, Amevi est une femme qui vit à Nyékonakpoè avec ses trois enfants. Dans son domicile, Amevi vend des pagnes à ses clients en parcourant les quartiers et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Amevi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Amevi demande ce crédit pour commander des pagnes afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Married and 55 years old, Amevi is a woman who lives in Nyékonakpoè with her three children. In her home, Amevi sells pagnes (colorful West African fabric) to her customers by traveling throughout the neighborhood, and finds her income thanks to this business. In order to effectively meet her needs, Amevi gets her supplies twice per month at the market. Amevi asks for this loan to order pagnes in order to realize yet more income to help her husband with the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to by 6 lengths of pagnes

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул мужчина 55 лет, женат, счастливый отец и дедушка. Вот уже на протяжение сорока с лишним лет он не покладая рук трудится на поле. На своем участке земли в 10 гектаров Расул ухаживает за пятью коровами и десятью барашками. Также он с женой занимаются земледелием. Они выращивают фрукты и овощи. Урюк, черешня, арбуз, картошка, морковь, зелень - все эти овощи и фрукты растут у них на поле. Весь этот товар они продают на рынке. Расул несмотря на свой возраст также бодр и силен, как в свои 20 лет. В настоящее время он планирует расширить свой бизнес, закупить барашков и купить корм для скота. Но у него нет полной суммы денег для осуществления этого плана. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную ему сумму. Расул заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en:
Rasul is a married man of 55 and a happy father and grandfather. For the past forty years, he has been tirelessly working the fields. On his own plot of land measuring 10 hectares, Rasul tends to five cows and ten lambs. He and his wife also are involved in agriculture. They grow fruits and vegetables. Apricots, cherries, melons, potatoes, carrots, greens - all these vegetables and fruits are grown in their fields. They sell all these goods in the market. Despite his age, Rasul is as vigorous and strong as he was at 20.

Currently, he is planning to expand his business, to buy sheep and livestock feed. But he does not have the full sum he needs to fulfill his plan. Therefore, he applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. He hopes that MDO Arvand will fulfill his request for help and give him the needed sum. Rasul gives his thanks in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to expand his livestock count.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат женщина 40 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей. Она закончила 9 классов школы и пошла учиться на краткосрочные курсы швеи. В возрасте 17 лет она вышла замуж и дома работала швеёй. После она начала заниматься животноводством. Начала с одной коровы, сейчас у нее в стаде 3 коровы и 5 барашков. Она любит свое дело и работает не покладая рук. В настоящее время она хочет купить еще одну корову и корм для скота, но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Она надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на ее просьбу  о помощи и выделит нужную ей сумму.
texts.en:
Karomat is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She completed the ninth grade and went to study in a short-term sewing course. At the age of 17, she got married and worked from home as a seamstress. Later, she began raising livestock. Beginning with one cow, now she has in the herd three cows and five sheep. She loves her trade and works tirelessly.

Currently, she wants to purchase another cow and livestock feed, but she does not have the full sum. Therefore, she applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hopes that MDO Arvand will fulfill her request for help and give her the needed sum.

loans.use: to expand the number of livestock.

loans.name: Muchiri

texts.en:
Muchiri is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells motor vehicle spare parts. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a safe area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

His business goal is to be successful and prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 55-year-old widow. Out of her 6 children, only 1 is still living with her. 

To enjoy her life and meet up with people around her, Analyn engages herself in a direct-sales business. She offers shoes, clothing, undergarments, and cosmetics products. 

Analyn earns from 25% to 40% over the discounted purchase cost, depending on the volume she buys. By gaining regular customers, she will be able to purchase more items and take advantage of the greater discount. Along these lines, she requires more capital. 

Hence, Analyn is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will grow her business as much as she can manage.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers to harvest her maize crop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home solution so that she can open her bookstore in the evenings.

loans.name: Ahouefa

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Ahouefa est une femme qui vit à Nyékonakpoè avec ses deux enfants. Dans son domicile, Ahouefa vend des produits alimentaires à ses clients dans lesquartiers et gagne son profit grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins de ses clients, Ahouefa s’approvisionne au marché. Ahouefa demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons des bidons d’huile et des detergents afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: 33 years old, Ahouefa is a woman who lives in Nyékonakpoè with her two children. In her home, Ahouefa sells food products to her customers in the neighborhoods and earns her income thanks to this business. In order to effectively meet the needs of her customers, Ahouefa gets her supplies at the market. Ahouefa asks for this loan to order some cartons of cans of oil and some detergent, in order to realize yet more income to help her husband with the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy 1 can of oil and 1 bag of detergent

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Emilie vit à Ablogame et est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est une femme mariée et habite avec ses trois enfants. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Emilie fait le commerce de friperies afin d’avoir un revenu pouvant subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Emilie s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Emilie demande ce prêt pour acheter des draps et des serviettes pour équiper son étagère afin de tirer du bénéfice nécessaire pour relever ses défis et étendre son commerce.
texts.en: Emilie lives in Ablogame and is 35 years old. She is a married woman and lives with her three children. To better meet the daily needs that she experiences, Emilie conducts business in second-hand clothing in order to have an income that can meet the daily burden. Emilie buys her supplies one time per month at the market. Emilie asks for this loan to buy some sheets and some towels to equip her shelf, in order to draw the necessary profit to rise to her challenges and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheets and 20 towels

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be good.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to improve the business structure.

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to improve her business structure.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be innovative.

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

His business goal is to open another restaurant within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. She describes herself to be energetic.

She operates a farm where she grows bananas, maize, and other crops. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a profitable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in climate.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

Her business goal is to be able to produce in large scale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

Her business goal is to have a large business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, de33 años de edad, no estudio, no sabe leer ni escribir, porque tenía que trabajar para poder ayudar a sus padres y a sus hermanos menores, es madre soltera de tres hijos, de las edades de 10, 8, y 5 años, los cuales estudian en la escuela, los tres dependen de ella.

Reina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella se dedicó a esta actividad desde que era pequeña, debido a que sus padres la pusieron a trabajar en otras casas para ganar dinero para comprar su comida, vestuario y medicina.- Actualmente, con mucho esfuerzo pudo colocar una pequeña tienda, la cual le ayuda para generar ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, ya tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y que hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien con las ganancias.

Gracias al financiamiento anterior Reina, logró comprar lo necesario para sostener su negocio.- Hoy en día está solicitando este nuevo crédito, para comprar azúcar, arroz, aceite y verduras para la tienda,  de esta manera podrá continuar con el negocio y tendrá mejores ingresos económicos en su hogar.

Reina, sueña con construir una casa, porque la que tiene actualmente es de barro, también desea poder ayudarle en el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina, aged 33, doesn't know how to read or write. She didn't go to school because she had to work to help out her parents and younger siblings. She is a single mother of three children—aged 10, 8 and 5—who go to school and depend on her.

Reina takes care of the household chores. She has been doing housework since she was a young girl as her parents put her to work at other people's houses to earn money in order to buy food, clothes, and medicines. 

With a great deal of effort, she was able to set up a small grocery store, which currently helps her to generate income for her and her family. She has been running this business for three years now, and, so far, profits have been good.

Thanks to the previous loan, Reina was able to buy the necessary items to stay in business. Today, she is requesting a new loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables to stock up her grocery store. In this way, she will be able to continue with her business and improve her household income.

Reina dreams of building a house because the one she currently owns is made of adobe. She also wants to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married father of five children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and also keeps sheep. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en: Jumaa is a married father of six-children with ages ranging from 7 to 17. He describes himself as hard-working and innocent. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and expand his business. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 6 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de Quinua.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados y a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Lourdes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y en el comercio y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio, viven en una casa propia de la familia, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de Quinua; ella realiza viajes a comunidades campesinas del altiplano para buscas a sus proveedores de quinua, y compra por mayor para venderla al menudeo en las ferias y comercios. “inicie mi negocio por el impulso que me dio mi suegra que se dedica a los mismo, la única dificultad son los largos viajes y el transporte de la quinua…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de venta de quinua, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de Quinua por quintal para vender por mayor y generar mejores utilidades. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de Quinua por quintal para vender por mayor y mejorar sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 32 year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has two daughters, ages 6 and 3. Her business is the sale of quinoa.

She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, tenacious, responsible and hardworking. She conducts her ambulatory business by going to the different markets around the city. The climate there is cold and dry, with the temperature varying during the day between 2 and 14 degrees centigrade, and it is located at an altitude of 4000 meters above sea level [approximately 13,000 feet].

Lourdes is dark-skinned, and wears her black hair tied back. She has brown eyes, and is short and strongly built. Her native tongue is Aymara, which she speaks at home and for business, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture.

She shares her life with her spouse, who is a salesman. They live in a home belonging to the family, built of brick and cement with a tin roof. It has potable water, electricity, gas and a sewage system. 

She is in the business of selling quinoa. She travels to rural communities around the altiplano [high mountain plains] to find quinoa providers. She buys at wholesale to sell retail in markets and businesses. 

“I started my business encouraged by my mother in law, who does the same. The only hard part is the long trips and transporting the quinoa…” she says. 

Her dream is to have a quinoa store. She hopes to grow her business by buying quinoa by the quintal to sell wholesale, and in this way generate a better profit. This is her first loan cycle in 2 years she has been doing this independently. 

These are the reasons that Lourdes is seeking a loan to buy quinoa by the quintal to sell wholesale and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy quinoa in bulk to sell at wholesale and improve her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man with four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells fuel and has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of fuel. His business goal is to own a big fuel station within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fuel

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with 7 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 24 years old, married and has three children, ages 2 to 7, with two in school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for five years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers to harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, no cuenta con capital para invertir en su negocio, opta por un crédito para comprar gas propano, una plancha nueva y más grande para aumentar la productividad de la tortillería.
Con el préstamo anterior la Sra. Alma surtió el inventario de la venta de tortillas, teniendo así oportunidad de cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y generar un poco más de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Alma does not have the capital to invest in her business. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy propane gas, as well as a new and larger press, in order to increase the productivity of her tortilla shop.

With the previous loan, she stocked her tortilla shop, which enabled her to cover the demands of her customers and generate a bit more income to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy propane gas, as well as a new and larger tortilla press to increase the productivity of her tortilla shop.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 28 years old and has two children. Cristy is married and her children are currently in school.

Cristy is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristy has been in this business for 8 years and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Jose Victorino

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, elaboración de hamacas, matates y cultiva granos básicos, aprendió con su hermano a realizar los trabajos de la granja de pollos, vive con su familia, es casado, todos dependen económicamente de él.  No tiene un horario establecido para realizar sus actividades.
Necesita de capital para comprar concentrado, vacunas y pollos para fortalecer la granja, será de ayuda para engordarlos y mantenerlos saludables, con lo que espera venderlos y obtener  ingresos que utilizara para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Su aspiración es tener el mejor resultado del uso de créditos para cancelar la deuda sin dificultades.
texts.en:
José raises chickens, makes hammocks and canvas bags and grows basic staples. He learned to raise chickens from his brother. He is married and lives lives with his family. Everyone is financially dependent on him. He doesn't have established hours for carrying out his activities. 

He needs the capital in order to buy concentrate, vaccines and chickens for building up his chicken-raising operation. It will be helpful for fattening them and keeping them healthy, as he hopes to sell them and obtain income that he will use to provide a better quality of life for his family. 

He hopes to make best use of the loans, in order to pay off the debt without difficulty.

loans.use: To buy concentrate, vaccines and chickens for building up his chicken-raising operation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and iron for building a security wall.

loans.name: Asyia

texts.en:
Asyia is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two daughters who are students. Her husband has been running his own garment business of selling clothes for 9 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Asyia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also expand his business and increase profits with the help of this loan. 

Asyia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his garment business

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Edelina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. Edelina has been in this business for three years. Edelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers for harvesting maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers for harvesting maize.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Ruth has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ruth has been in this business for 22 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Abaziranenge Group

texts.en:
Mukamana is a group leader, aged 42. She is married with nine children aged between 2 and 20 years; all of them go to school.

The group is called Abaziranenge, which means “righteousness” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their better future.

Mukamana sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for 16 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is an artisan who specializes in marble sculptures and jade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of jade.

Jorge has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I'm Jorge. I was born in the beautiful city of Antigua on October 23, 1963. As a young man, I took a job in a typesetting workshop. I liked it a lot, but then a friend offered me the opportunity to learn how to carve stone. I loved it! I began to experiment with different materials and today I work in glass, marble, jade, wood and ceramic. I've been doing this since 1992, and I enjoy what I do very much. I especially like to engrave Maya motifs and designs, promoting the culture of this great civilization of our ancestors. What I like best about my work is knowing that people from other places like what I do, and I can offer them a glimpse of the culture of Guatemala."

"I feel very happy to be able to receive this microcredit so that I can purchase jade in bulk, as it is the most expensive raw material I work with. Gracias, amigos!"

Use the link below to view Jorge's marble sculptures and jade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8538

loans.use: to buy jade in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is an artist who specializes in making sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Francisco has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

He says, "I am the second generation of jewelers and now my daughters have also chosen this vocation. My designs are inspired by pre-Hispanic codices and the folklore of my country that I love so much, using different motifs from our own culture. I sign my work as Citlali, meaning Star in the Nahuatl language, so everyone wearing my designs has a star to keep them company."

"We feel very honored to receive this microcredit. Muchas gracias!"

Use the link below to view Francisco's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4397

loans.use: to buy silver in bulk.

loans.name: Cerapio

texts.en:
Cerapio is a weaver who specializes in handwoven wool rugs and tapestries. He would like to buyraw materials, including sheep's wool and natural dyes.

Cerapio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Peruvian artisan Cerapio was forced to leave his home in Ayacucho during the 1980s. "Terrorists were bleeding my people to death and there seemed little hope. I inherited my passion for weaving from my parents and grandparents. But the quality of my work is the result of my long experience, and the product of my careful observation over the years. I draw inspiration from our ancient Peruvian cultures, Andean village life, and from our snow-capped mountains."

"Many thanks to you all -- with this microcredit, we will be able to weave even more tapestries."

Use the link below to view Cerapio's handwoven wool rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/194

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including sheep's wool and natural dyes

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is an artisan who specializes in African masks and wood carvings. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including paint, wood, aluminum plates and polish.

Kwaku has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I studied business and worked for many years in the field, but I wasn't satisfied. In 1984 I was introduced to the carving profession by my cousin who was a carver and also a professional teacher. He taught me how to carve for about a year, which seemed to come naturally to me. I then started a full-time professional carving career late in 1985. I have been carving on my own ever since. I also learned how to decorate my works with brass and beads, making them unique."


"The support from those of you who help fund this microcredit will enable me to craft new items. I thank you all very much for doing this for me."

Use the link below to view Kwaku's African masks and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2392

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including paint, wood, aluminum plates and polish.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African drums and wood carvings. She would like to buyraw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and beads.

Ernestina has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I was born in the eastern region of Ghana and trained in dressmaking but realized that the trade would not do well in my town," Ernestina says. "I therefore trained for three years as a wood carver, and began developing woodcarvings on my own. Though carving has long been regarded as the preserve of men, I am glad that I have been able not only to infiltrate but to also make an impact on the trade."

"I wish to thank you all for your support."

Use the link below to view Ernestina's African drums and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1447

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and beads

loans.name: Otchere

texts.en:
Otchere is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper and polish.

Otchere has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"This skill of carving has been passed on for generations in my family. I was trained under the supervision of my father, who was also a master carver and very well known in our region. This art has sustained my family for most of my life. Like my father, I am a respected craftsmen in my town and have taught a lot of young men over the years. I have two daughters and a son who I hope to teach someday. Even if he does not pursue carving as a career, he can still teach his son in order to pass this family legacy on, for generations to come."

"The support I am getting in the form of this microcredit is very much appreciated. May God help each of you."

Use the link below to view Otchere's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8186

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper and polish

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a carver from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, nails and polish.

Winfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

Ghana's Winfred says, "I developed the art of carving at a young age. After school, I'd walk to a nearby workshop to observe carvers busy sculpting different objects from a log of wood. I was surprised to see such beautiful art pieces, and this aroused my interest in learning more. Several times during such visits, I picked up pieces of wood from the workshop and, when I reached home, I tried my hand at carving, following the process I had observed."

"Thank you very much for your support, as always."

Use the link below to view Winfred's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8014

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, nails and polish.

loans.name: The-Chou Ferme Production

texts.en:
The-Chou Ferme de Production Agricole is an agricultural farm that works in the production and breeding of goats. It is managed by Chouloute, a well-known man in the community of Hinche.

Chouloute, 52 years old, is married and has five children. In 2003, he graduated in Technique of Agriculture and had good experience under his belt in the NGO sector, including World Vision, World Food Program, and Elvetas.

He works together with Joseph (standing up in the picture above), who is in charge of the goats’ healthcare.

He is seeking the loan from Zafen to buy goats and medications, and to adjust a shelter to better structure the farm in order to earn more income and enhance the agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase goats and medications and to adjust shelters.

loans.name: Kernida Shop

texts.en:
Kernida Shop is a construction material business run by Kernida--found in the picture--that is focused on renting metallic props, shelves, plywood, and finished wood to customers for a period of 22 days. Due to limited resources, the business was challenged to satisfy its unlimited customer demand. However, a previous loan from Zafen has helped the business owner keep its operation running efficiently. In response, the business clientele has doubled. 

Today, the fast growth of the business has solicited another course of action to yet increase its stock.  A second Zafen loan will help the business supply more construction tools to clients, and experience revenue growth while creating two more part-time jobs.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for construction  such as: plywood, metallic props, shelves etc…

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a carver from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, polish and beads.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I specialize in antiqued and shining art. I started craft work at a youthful age. I am very good at drawing and so, when I see objects carved out of wood, I am attracted to them. I realized I could use my own skills to create new and exciting designs that could be carved out of wood. I get my inspiration from my workers, when I see the joy with which they approach their work, and from the compliments I receive from customers on our designs. To be able to master this art, it takes obedience to learn, to focus and be alert anytime you are working. It also takes constant practice. My local communities make firewood from the scrap wood at my workplace. I also offer temporary jobs at my workshop to people in my community. The favorite thing about my art is the finishing, where I take my time to give each item a very beautiful finish. Working with these sharp tools can be dangerous, and that is what I find challenging. My hopes and dreams are to become an international exporter and a famous person in my locality."

"I am very grateful to those of you who help fund my loan request. Your support will go a long way towards helping me sustain my business, the earnings from which go towards paying for my children's school fees."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's hand-carved African masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9138

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, polish and beads

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.en:
Victor Hugo is an artisan who specializes in hand-carved wooden serveware. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood and paint.

Victor Hugo has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I work in wood. Like many people who work in this craft, I had a difficult childhood that helped me become a man who strives to get ahead. We don't use complicated or modern tools, just a lathe, a band saw, a drill and a polisher. Right after the terrible earthquake of 1976, there was just no money in Guatemala and I had to go to Honduras to sell my designs. Thank God, we were able to keep the workshop and get through those tough times."

"Thanks for your support, my friends. This microcredit will help me to buy the materials I need to keep crafting new pieces."

Use the link below to view Victor Hugo's hand-carved wooden serveware on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8558

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood and paint

loans.name: Las Surgidoras De Horacio Zevallos Group

texts.es: La nueva Alcancía Comunal “las surgidoras de Horacio zevallos” está conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y entusiastas. Este es el caso de Lizeth de 30 años de edad, separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Lizeth es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de ropa, Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más polos, blusas, y vestidos. El anhelo de Lizeth es tener su propio local.
