El grupo “Las Surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada .Lizeth, es la primera del lado izquierdo, ella se encuentra sentada y lleva en brazos a su pequeño hijo, viste polo blanco con rayas negras.
texts.en:
The new communal bank "Las surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” [The Women Inspired by Horacio Zevallos] is made up of 6 enterprising and enthusiastic women.

One of them is 30-year-old Lizeth, who is separated and has three dependent children. Lizeth is a persevering mother who works with a lot of effort and diligence to provide for her family.

She currently makes a living by selling clothes. She is happy because her economic situation is improving.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more polo shirts, blouses, and dresses. Lizeth's desire is to have her own store.

The group “Las Surgidoras de Horacio Zevallos” thanks Kiva for the help it provides. In the photo, Lizeth is the first from the left, seated and holding her little son, wearing a white shirt with black stripes.

loans.use: to purchase more polo shirts, blouses, and dresses

loans.name: Tuyangatane Group

texts.en:
Aliyena, who is in her early thirties, is married with one son who is still in school. She has been running a pharmacy business for two years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Aliyena's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the medicine and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and loan repayments, and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving medicine and meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of extending her business and even opening another pharmacy.

Aliyena will share this loan with her loan group "Tuyangatane", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast-moving medicine and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, con el financiamiento anterior obtuvo una buena cosecha de granos básicos, no como la esperaba, pero logro almacenar una parte para alimentar a su familia y el resto lo vendió para generar ingresos con los que está minimizando las carencias familiares.
Necesita de capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, un silo para almacenar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos y pagar el alquiler del terreno, para su próxima siembra, espera seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
With the help of the previous loan, Apolinario had a good harvest of staple grains. It was not as much as he was hoping for, but he managed to store part of it for feeding his family and he sold the rest to generate income, with which he is lessening his family’s deprivations.

He needs capital in order to buy farming supplies and a silo so he can store a greater quantity of grain, and to pay the rent on the piece of land for the next planting season. He hopes to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and a silo so he can store a greater quantity of grain, and to pay the rent on the piece of land for the next planting season

loans.name: Severini

texts.en:
Severini is in his mid-20s and is single with no kids. He has 2 businesses: he sells charcoal and runs a retail shop. He has been in business for 3 years now. He works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Severini's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to increase his shop's inventory and start his charcoal sales business.  He has repaid all of his loans successfully. He used his profits to take care of himself and cover household expenses.   

Severini will use this current loan to buy sacks of charcoal as well as increase his retail shop's inventory of sugar, beans, salt, rice, peas, flour, soap, cigarettes, etc.  

Severini dreams of opening a shop for selling utensils. He will make sure he repays his loan according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal as well as increase his retail shop's inventory of sugar, beans, salt, rice, peas, flour, soap, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Innocent Group

texts.en:
Innocent Group is a group from Glenview suburb in Harare and Dorcas is one of the four members. She is married, with two school-going dependents, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. Her husband is a self-employed carpenter who specializes in household furniture, such as beds, chairs, and wardrobes.

Dorcas operates a very busy grocery tuck shop and she has been in this business since 2008. Her major challenge is a lack of working capital, so that she can restock in large quantities in order to benefit from economies of scale. She appreciates the idea of record and timekeeping encouraged during trainings by Thrive staff. 

The group applied for their combined loan of USD 950. Dorcas hopes to secure a proper place for herself and her family to live in by finishing to pay for her residential stand in a nearby suburb, using her profits and savings. 

Innocent group really appreciates the Kiva funders for helping them achieve financial security.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Manzanitas Group

texts.en:
In the highlands of western Guatemala, in the rural communities surrounding the city of Chichicastenango, poverty rates exceed 80 percent. In these communities, outside of subsistence farming and small scale animal husbandry and textile production, there are not many options to consistently provide for one’s family. Compelled by the lack of financial opportunity in their communities, entrepreneurial women commute hours to reach larger markets, buying and selling produce, traditional textiles, and shoes. Taking advantage of the low farmer and producer prices in the world famous Chichicastenango market, the women are able to earn small profits by reselling the goods in outlying cities and communities. 
	
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Mujeres Manzanitas” is made up of 8 motivated and vibrant women. The Trust Bank is entering its second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, and they are looking forward to continuing their success into 2016. 

Elena, a 27-year-old mother of 2 young children and treasurer of the Trust Bank, is a dedicated and driven entrepreneur and member of the group. She is applying for a small loan to support and expand her shoe store that she has owned and operated for over 3 years. She plans to use the loan to keep up with the heavy demand for children’s shoes driven by back-to-school purchases. Currently, she buys shoes at wholesale prices in the 2 biggest markets of the region, in San Francisco and Chichicastenango. With help from a local employee, she resells the shoes in a third city, out of her small storefront. 

With her young children growing older and beginning to enter school, Elena is determined to continue expanding and developing her business. Her goal for the future is to generate more income to improve the lives of her children, by providing them with the opportunity to continue to go to school.
	
With the support of Kiva funders, Elena will have access to the capital she needs to maintain her small business and continue improving the lives of her family. Thank you, Kiva funders, for believing in the ability of Elena and the other 7 members of “Las Mujeres Manzanitas” to create a better future for their families and their communities with the successes of their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Norma Maribel

texts.es:
Norma, es una madre soltera, que su vida la dedica a cuidar de dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, como no tiene apoyo económico de otras personas, opto por  vender pupusas y tortillas, es así como sale adelante con su familia, parte del día vende tortillas y por las tardes abre la pupusería, hasta la fecha no manifiesta dificultades para continuar trabajando.
Comprará quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, bebidas, aceite, tomates y otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar la venta de tortillas y pupusas, espera atraer nuevos clientes, ofrecer mejor servicio  y mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
Anhela a tener una fuente de ingresos para darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y que estos se conviertan en unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is a single mother who dedicates her life to taking care of her 8 and 9-year-old children.  Since she doesn't receive any economic support from other people, she decided to sell pupusas and tortillas in order to move her family ahead.  She sells tortillas for part of the day, and in the afternoons she opens the pupusa shop.  To date, she has not had any difficulty continuing to work.

She will buy cheese, shredded pork, corn, drinks, oil, tomatoes, and other necessary ingredients to make and sell tortillas and pupusas.  She hopes to attract new customers, offer a better service, and maintain the consistency of her business.  She is eager to have a new source of income to give her children a better future so they will be able to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cheese, shredded pork, corn, drinks, oil, tomatoes, and other necessary ingredients to make and sell tortillas and pupusas

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio is an artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including leather and silver. Jose Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "I've worked with silver jewelry since 2009. At first, I saw it as an opportunity, and learned the crafting techniques. But as time passed, I realized it was more than this, that designing is a way to express art through jewelry. Silver jewelry, and especially filigree, has a special attraction for each person. I feel proud of my work." "I'd like to thank everyone for their support through this microcredit. It will really help me with the purchase of the raw materials that I need to push my business forward." Use the link below to view Jose Antonio's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8493

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including leather and silver

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 52 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Гулмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 овцы, также она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и увеличения доходов, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт помещения для скота.
texts.en: Gulmira is 52 years old, a widow and a mother of 3 children. Gulmira has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 10 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, today her farm contains 4 sheep, and she also grows barley. Her monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS), but this money is catastrophically insufficient for a decent life. In order to further develop her business and increasing her income, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep and increase her livestock headcount. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and save money to repair the space for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep for fattening and resale to help bolster her income

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Это Мунира. Она жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Мунира проживает вместе семьей. Её муж пенсионер. У нее трое детей. Одна дочка и двое сыновей. Дети ходят в школу. Сама Мунира занимается выращиванием скота. Она очень любит домашних животных, по этой причине выбрала животноводческую деятельность. Мунира 5 лет назад начала эту деятельность. У Мунире есть коровник и крупнорогатый скот. Она доит корову и продает молоко своим клиентам. Мунира хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить крупнорогатого скота и корм для скота. Мунира верит и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Meet Munira, a resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube.  Munira lives with her family.  Her husband is retired. She has three children (one daughter and two sons).  Her children all attend school.  Munira herself raises livestock.  She loves domestic animals and, for this reason, she has chosen to be involved in animal husbandry.  She started in this field five years ago.  She now has a barn and some cattle.  She gets milk from her cows and sells their milk to her customers.  Munira wants to increase her cattle headcount and expand her activity.  For this reason, she has applied for a loan.  This loan will allow her to buy cattle as well as livestock feed.  Munira is confident that she will receive your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her activity.

loans.name: Sabagul

texts.ru: Саъбагул жительница городка Куляб. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Один сын и две дочери. Дети учатся в средней школе. Саъбагул шустрая и активная женщина. Она домохозяйка, ведет домашнее хозяйство и одновременно занимается шитьем женской одежды. Саъбагул занимается шитьем у себя дома. Она любить освоить и сшить стильную одежду и предлагать своим клиентом. Саъбагул обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить многофункциональную швейную машинку для привлечения больше клиентов.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность и увеличить ежедневный доход.
texts.en: Sabagul is a resident of the town of Kulob. She is 41 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has one son and two daughters, and all of them attend a secondary school. Sabagul is a smart and active woman. She is a homemaker, who simultaneously runs the household and a women's clothing sewing business. Sabagul is involved in sewing at home. She loves to perfect and sew stylish clothing and provide it to her customers. Sabagul requested this loan to purchase a multifunctional sewing machine in order to attract more customers. The requested loan will help her expand the business and increase her daily income.

loans.use: to purchase a multifunctional sewing machine in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Mujeres De La Puerta Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Tolimán is located on the Southern shore of the beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de la Puerta” was formed by seven enthusiastic women who wanted to have access to credit and improve their lives. Friendship Bridge serves over 22,000 impoverished women in Guatemala to create their own solutions to poverty with education and small loans (“Microcredit Plus”).

The majority of the ladies in the Trust Bank work in traditional textile production as well as agriculture. Encarnación, who is 31 years of age with four children, is the President of the Trust Bank. She only had one year of formal education, but her leadership qualities and determination inspire her fellow Trust Bank members. 

Encarnación, who creates beautiful textiles of the area, has requested a loan to purchase thread in large quantities. She also wants to increase her sale of chicken to meet the needs of her clientele. 

Encarnación is aware of the tremendous benefit of education and laments that she was not able to attend school for a longer time. She understands that her children will have a better future in every way with a good education. They will benefit economically and personally. Encarnación is focused on their education, and three of them already are in school. 

KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge for these women. The ladies are poised to step into a brighter future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of San Lucas Tolimán. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase thread in large quantities for her textile business

loans.name: Heisemberg Isael

texts.es:
Heisemberg, es agricultor, su núcleo familiar lo compone su esposa y sus hijos, todos viven en una misma casa, el negocio de cultivar granos básicos y plátano lo heredo de su familia, su ventaja es que trabaja en tierras propias, ahorrándose así el alquiler, sus dificultades son los cambios de clima que pueden afectar sus cultivos, lo hace desde hace 10 años.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para realizar la siembra de granos básicos de esta temporada, espera que la cosecha sea mayor que en otras ocasiones para tener mejores ingresos, con los que ira cancelando su deuda y cubriendo necesidades familiares.
Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio con la crianza de ganado y continuar cubriendo los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Heisemberg is a farmer and his nuclear family is made up of of his wife and his children, who all live in the same house.  He inherited this basic grain and banana farming business from his family.  He has an advantage because he works on his own land and therefore saves on rent, but his difficulties come from the changes in climate that can affect his crops.  He has been doing this business for 10 years.

He will buy agricultural inputs to use in planting basic grains this season, and he is hopeful that the harvest will be larger than on other occasions so he can bring in more income, which he will use to pay back his debt and provide his family with what they need.  His dreams are to strengthen his business by raising livestock and to continue covering the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant basic grains this season and bring in a larger harvest than previous times

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business and increase her income

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovanny, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento a Padecomsm y a los inversionistas Kiva, para invertirlo en la compra de una ternera y semilla de jícama, fortalecerá su negocio e iniciara la siembra de un nuevo cultivo.
Los beneficios que ha tenido en su negocio por la inversión del crédito anterior son: cosecha abundante de maíz y frijol, mejores ventas y estabilidad económica, su familia se mantiene unida.
texts.en:
Jeovanny is applying for new financing from PADECOMSM and Kiva lenders to purchase a calf and jicama seeds in order to strengthen his business and start planting a new crop.  

Thanks to his previous loan, his business benefited from an abundant harvest of corn and beans as well as better sales and economic stability, and his family remained united.

loans.use: to buy a calf and jicama seeds in order to strengthen his business and start cultivating a new crop

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.ru: Бифотима женщина 50 лет, замуж, счастливая мать и бабушка. На протяжение 30 с лишним лет Бифотима занимается животноводством. На своем участке земли она разводит крупный рогатый скот. Из молока, полученного от коров, Бифотима приготавливает кефир и сметану и продает на рынке. Также она выращивает овощи на поле: картошку, морковь, огурцы, помидоры и также относит на рынок для продажи. В ее делах ей помогает невестка, так как Бифотима уже в пожилом возрасте и иногда ей трудно самой справляться со всеми делами. В настоящее время Бифотима планирует расширить свой бизнес и купить корову и барана, также приобрести корм для скота. Но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Бифотима заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Bifotima is a 50-year-old married woman, happy mother and grandmother. Bifotima has been involved in animal husbandry for over 30 years. She raises cattle on her plot of land. Bifotima makes kefir and sour-cream from the milk obtained from the cows and sells these products at a market. She also grows vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, cucumbers and tomatoes, on the field and takes them to a market for sale. Her daughter-in-law helps her with the business because Bifotima is of an elderly age and finds it difficult at times to take care of everything. At the present time, Bifotima plans to expand her business and buy a cow and a ram, as well as livestock feed, but she does not have the entire necessary amount of money. This is why she requested financial support from MDO Arvand. Bifotima is grateful for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a ram, as well as livestock feed, in order to expand her business

loans.name: Sendero De Luz Group

texts.en:
Last April, ten women in the Guatemalan Highland town of San Francisco El Alto formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Sendero de Luz”  meaning “Signal of Light.” They requested their very first loan from Kiva. The ladies are happy to report that the funds were of huge benefit to their small businesses and that they have paid back the loan fully and on time! Thank you, Kiva investors! Now, nine of the women are requesting a new loan from Kiva investors, as they are in need of additional capital. The majority of the members of the Trust Bank have invested their loan in the fabrication of traditional textiles. San Francisco El Alto has a huge and colorful market that attracts people from all over the Western Highlands and beyond.
 
Sebastiana is a 23-year-old member of “Sendero de Luz” and one of the youngest. She has had five years of formal education. Sebastiana is married and has four children between the ages of two and eight. She married quite young, as is the custom of many girls in the area. Only one of her children is enrolled in school. Sebastiana, along with her young family, works in textile production and creates children’s printed tee-shirts. She is requesting funding to purchase a sewing machine, as she wants to increase production and decrease costs. Her family is quite excited about the possibility of this new machine. Sebastiana and her husband travel to the Mexican border to sell their tee-shirts and report that there is a lot of competition from sellers as well as demand from clients. Sebastiana has a long-range goal of building her own house and is working hard to make that a reality.

Sebastiana and her friends in the “Sendero de Luz” Trust Bank express their appreciation to Kiva investors for their kindness and generosity. They have already taken steps toward a more prosperous future, benefitting themselves, their families and their town of San Francisco El Alto.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to increase tee-shirt production and decrease costs

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos, cal, harina, gas propano, leña, gaseosas etc., fortalecerá la tienda y tendrá materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas y tortillas.
El efecto del crédito anterior es positivo, cuenta con mejor mercadería, nuevos clientes y una situación económica más estabilizada, su familia se siente satisfecha de  tener una vida más confortable y con menos deudas.
texts.en:
Ines is asking for a new loan to buy basic grains, lime powder, flour, propane gas, wood, soda pop etc.  This will strengthen her store and will give her raw material in order to make tortillas and pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). 

The effect of the previous loan has been positive.  She has better merchandise, new customers and a more stabilized economic situation.  Her family feels satisfied to have a more comfortable life with fewer debts.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, lime powder, flour, propane gas, wood, soda pop etc. which will strengthen her store and give her raw material to make pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Estrellas Del Calvario Group

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer de 31 años es casada tiene un hijo de 6 años vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá.
Aracely (la segunda del lado izquierdo la de blusa morada y pantalón negro) es una madre de familia muy amable y responsable que trabaja con dedicación y esmero para que a su familia  no le haga falta nada, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y a la venta de huevos, esta labor lo realiza desde hace 2 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos  ella también es cocinera en la escuela de su comunidad, Aracely cuenta que esta actividad es bastante rentable para ella y su familia pues con lo que genera ha logrado apoyar a su familia, Aracely se ha dado cuenta que la venta de huevos le ha funcionado bastante bien pero los pollo que ella tiene ya no están produciendo lo necesario para abastecer a los clientes, es por eso que ella ha pensado comprar más pollos ponedoras, pero una de las limitaciones que Aracely tiene es que no tiene el dinero necesario para comprar sus pollos, pero ella es una mujer muy admirable, pues para que pueda acceder a un préstamo a organizado a un grupo de señoras con las  mismas necesidades para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar pollos ponedoras.
Para el grupo de Aracely no hay nada más importante que su familia es por eso que tienen las esperanzas para conseguir el prestamo para realizar una buena inversión y mejorar sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor vida, así mismo tener algún día un negocio de ropa típica
texts.en:
Aracely is a 31-year-old married woman with a 6-year-old son, who lives with her husband in the community of Sololá.  She is the second woman from the left with a purple shirt and black pants in the photo.  She is the friendly and responsible mother of a family who puts dedication and care into her work so that her family has everything that they need.  

Aracely has made a living raising chickens and selling eggs for 2 years, but in order to increase her income she also works as a cook at a school in the community.  She notes that this business is fairly profitable for her and her family since she has been able to support her family with it.  She has noticed that egg sales have gone fairly well but the chickens that she has are not producing enough to satisfy her customers at the moment.  Therefore, she thought of buying more laying hens, but one of her limitations is that she doesn't have enough money to buy them.  However, she is a very admirable woman, so in order to be able to access a loan she organized a group of women with the same needs to take out a loan to buy laying hens.  

Nothing is more important to the members of Aracely's group than family and therefore they hope to get a loan in order to make a good investment and improve their income in order to give their families a better life.  They also hope to start a traditional clothing business one day.

loans.use: to buy laying hens

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus 03 hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad Catimore, cuneta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento del terreno cultivable, esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano is 44 years old and lives in his own home made of rustic materials with his wife and 3 children in the District of Querocotillo, Province of Cutervo, Cajamarca Region, in the northern sierras of Peru.  The community where he lives is a small rural zone where the residents know each other and are principally involved in farming, commerce, and ranching.  

He makes a living growing coffee of the Catimore variety, and he has experience in this business as well as good personal and work references from the area.  He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for the maintenance of farmland, and this investment will allow him to make earnings to improve his economic situation and invest in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for the maintenance of farmland

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married and has four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosemarie operates a Barbeque stall. She regularly buys pork, meat and chicken entrails that she prepare to cook and sell in the afternoon in her barbeque stand near her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, pork and other products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosemarie dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy meat products and supplies she needs to continue operate her barbeque business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old and has five children. Luzviminda is a married woman.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and has five children. Victoria is married and has three children who are in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and has two children. Mary Ann is married and has one child in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Ronnadel

texts.en:
Ronnadel is 34 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ronnadel works very hard to provide for them.

Ronnadel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries.

Ronnadel has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, soap powder, beverages, biscuits, junk foods, candies, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ronnadel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, flour, etc., for her food-vending business.

Nellie has been in this business for 9 years. Nellie earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nellie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of ingredients, such as sugar, milk, eggs, etc

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aileen is 41 years old.

Aileen has a charcoal-making business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy coconut shells to use in her business.

Aileen has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to use in her business

loans.name: Betallana

texts.en:
Betallana is 53 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Betallana works very hard to provide for them.

Betallana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries.

Betallana has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Betallana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages and other groceries

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elvie is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elvie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, de 59 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 3 hijos.

Tomas, tiene 40 años de experiencia en trabajos agrícolas, está actividad la aprendió de sus padres quienes lo educaron y le inculcaron buenos principios, que lo han llevado a tener éxito en su vida.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar dos cerdos, porque se los están vendiendo en buen precio, Tomas, los alimentara y los cuidara para luego ponerlos a la venta, de esta manera  podrá obtener mejor ingreso para su familia. 

Tomas, sueña con apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y hacer una nueva galera para los cerdos.
texts.en:
Tomas is 59 years old. He makes a living in agriculture. He is married, and his wife performs household chores. They have 3 children.

Tomas has 40 years of experience in agricultural work. He learned this job from his parents, who educated him and instilled in him good principles that have made it possible for him to succeed in life.

He is requesting a loan to buy two pigs, which are being sold to him at a good price. Tomas will feed them and take care of them so that he can sell them at a later date. This way, he will be able to obtain a better income for his family. Tomas dreams of supporting his children's educations and of building a shed for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es: Angel de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia ya que desde muy joven ha sido el ingreso familiar, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder tener un mejor cultivo y tener mejores ganancias con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Angel is 37 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and child. He cultivates basic staple crops, such as corn and beans. Angel has more than 20 years of experience since he has been helping his family in this trade since he was a young man. He sells his products in the surrounding neighborhoods near where he lives. With the income he earns from his sales, Angel is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides so that he can achieve a better crop and generate more profits from his sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 46 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Esterlita works very hard to provide for them.

Esterlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase item to sell in her general store, such as home product care and other groceries.

Esterlita has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase item to sell in her general store, such as home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and general store.  Nelia is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erwina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business. Erwina is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, egg, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erwina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, egg, etc

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 4 years. Rosalina earns more income from a general store.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Feggie

texts.en:
Feggie is a woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Feggie is 52 years old.

Feggie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Feggie requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies to use in her business.

Feggie has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Feggie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 58 years old.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
Abelina una madre de familia de 55 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades de entre 31 y 41 años de edad.
Abelina es una madre de familia que ama su trabajo y para generar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales desde hace 10 años, Abelina es grandemente bendecida porque cuenta con el don más grande que es ser comadrona  y ayuda a salvar vidas en su comunidad, para ella estas dos actividades es lo más importante,  sus servicios como comadrona y como curandera han contribuido al desarrollo de la comunidad pues acude a ella la gente más necesitada que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para ir con un médico, sus medicinas a parte de sus precios económicos son bastantes efectivos, por lo que la gente lo busca con más frecuencia, por lo que sus productos se han escaseado, es por eso que se necesita surtir mejor las medicinas para seguir ayudando a la gente, pero una de las dificultades que Abelina tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta inversión, por lo tanto ella  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar medicinas naturales para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
El gran deseo de Abelina es poder conseguir el préstamo para seguir ayudando a la gente mas necesitada.
texts.en:
Abelina is 55 years old and the mother of a lovely family of 4 children from 31 to 41 years old.  She is a mother who loves her work and for 10 years she has been generating income by selling natural medicines.  Abelina is extremely blessed because she has a great gift which is to be a mid-wife and she helps to save lives in her community.  For her, these two occupations are the most important.

Her services as a mid-wife and as a healer have contributed to the development of the community.  The people who go to her are those most in need who do not have enough money to go to a doctor.  Her medicines, aside from their economical price, are quite effective.  Thus, people search her out more and more frequently, and so her products have become scarce.  It is for this reason that she needs to improve her supply of medicine in order to continue helping people.

One of the difficulties that Abelina has is that she does not have sufficient capital to make this investment. Thus, she has made the decision to ask for a loan that she will use to buy natural medicines that she can then sell at a fair price.  Her great desire is to be able to obtain the loan in order to continue helping people who are most in need.

loans.use: to buy and sell natural medicines

loans.name: Antonio Coc

texts.es:
Antonio es un padre de familia dedicado a su hermosa familia de 4 hijos de las cuales son 2 mujeres y 2 hombres de las edades entre 14 y 28 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Este admirable padre de familia para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia en óptimas condiciones se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando todo tipo de hortalizas de su región, pues gracias a Dios que en el lugar donde él vive es una zona bastante fértil y esto lo ayuda  a él a producir buenas verduras, según cuenta Antonio que esta actividad para él no es suficiente es por eso que para mejorar sus ingresos  también es jornalero realiza todo tipo de actividad donde se requiere de su servicio, el asegura que gracias a estas dos actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, hace algún tiempo él ha empezado a construir su casa pero con los altos precios que tienen los materiales de construcción, dentro de sus posibilidades ya no puede adquirir  más materiales para terminar la construcción, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo utilizar para la compra de cemente, block y arena.
El gran anhelo de Antonio es terminar de construir su casa durante este  año y seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Antonio is a devoted parent to his beautiful family of four children, with 2 girls and 2 boys, whose ages are between 14 and 28. They live in a community of Solola. This admirable father works in agriculture in order to generate income and support his family in optimal conditions. He grows all types of vegetables, because thanks to God, the place where he lives is very fertile and he can produce good vegetables from his region. According to what Antonio says, this job is not enough. For this reason and to improve his income, he also works as a daily laborer. He works in any type of job that requires his services. He assures that, thanks to these two activities, he has been able to move his family ahead. A while ago, he started building his house, but due to the high prices of building materials, he has not been able to get more materials to finish his construction. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, blocks and sand. Antonio's greatest wish is to finish building his house this year and continue making improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks and sand.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también se dedica a la venta de pupusas todos los días de la semana en su comunidad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.

María, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la venta de pupusas, una de sus hijas le ayuda en esta actividad y les ha dado las ganancias suficientes, para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar un molino nixtamal, ya que en su comunidad el molino más próximo, está muy lejos, también comprara una estufa nueva, para hacer pupusas, de esta manera podrá tener un mejor ingreso para cumplir con las necesidades que su familia le demande.

María, sueña con ampliar su negocio y apoyar en los estudios de su nieto, ya que quiere estudiar medicina y ser doctor.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old. She performs household chores. In addition, she works selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) every day of the week in her community. She is married, and she has 2 children.

Maria has 15 years of experience selling pupusas. One of her daughters helps her with this work, which has provided them with enough earnings to satisfy the necessities of their home.

She is requesting a loan to buy a corn mill because the mill that is located closest in her community is too far. Additionally, she will buy a new stove to make her pupusas. This way, she will earn a higher income in order to meet the needs that her family demands. Maria dreams of expanding her business and of supporting her grandson's education, since he desires to study medicine and become a doctor.

loans.use: to buy a mill as well as a new stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a factory worker. He is from Cavite, Philippines and has a child. He is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Ernesto works as an Assistant Production Line Leader. He conducts inspections and tests per control plan, work instructions and procedures. He maintains good housekeeping at all times in the respective working area. He is also responsible for a group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipments.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Ernesto is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Ernesto is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every payday. He looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to pay to retrieve the ATM card that he pawned.

Ernesto hopes that he will always be effective and efficient in the workplace. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem his pawned ATM card and avoid being indebted to loan sharks.

loans.name: Anargul

texts.ru: Анаргул 22 года, замужем, есть сын, образование высшее, занимается торговлей постельного белья и одежды. Успешно занимаясь торговлей, Анаргул добилась очень хороших результатов, ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара на весенний период. На прибыль от кредита Анаргул планирует открыть еще один торговый павильон, а также расширить сельскохозяйственную деятельность за счет покупки скота, на сегодня у Анаргул уже есть одна дойная корова.
texts.en: Anargul is 22 years old, married, and she has a son.  She also has a college education and she makes a living selling bedsheets and clothes.  She does an excellent job and has achieved great success, since she currently makes a monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy merchandise for the spring.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to open an additional retail outlet.  She would also like to buy some livestock and expand her farming business (she currently has one dairy cow).

loans.use: to buy bedsheets and women's clothes for resale, in order to increase her spring inventory.

loans.name: Jose De La Paz

texts.es:
José, de 63 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, creció con sus padres, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. 

José, tiene 40 años de experiencia en trabajos de agricultura; está actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor y sabiduría y eso es lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona de éxito en su vida y un ejemplo para su familia. 

El dinero será utilizado para pagar el alquiler de los terrenos donde cultivará sus granos básicos y otra parte del dinero será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas.

Los sueño de José, son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, también comenzar a cultivar hortalizas y comprar ganado, para criarlo y venderlo.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and a farmer. He grew up with his parents, is married and lives with his wife and their four children. José has 40 years of experience in farm work. He learn this livelihood from his parents, who raised him with love and wisdom. That it is what has led him to be a person with success in life, and an example for his family.

The money will be used to pay for the rent on the land where he will grow basic staples and also to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

José's dream is to help his children with their education and also begin to grow vegetables and buy cattle in order to raise and sell them.

loans.use: To pay for the rent on the land where he will grow basic staples and also to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso, de 44 años de edad, se dedica a ejercer el oficio de carpintería, también se dedica a la agricultura, es una actividad que aprendió de sus padres, está casado y tiene 1 hijo.

Narciso, se dedica a la carpintería y agricultura  desde la edad de 16 años, decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades, ya que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia, pues ella se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural, de esta forma juntos pueden satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y solventar las obligaciones financieras.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar herramientas para su taller de carpintería, otra parte será invertida en el mejoramiento y ampliación de su casa, ya que es de barro.

Los sueños de Narciso son, tener un taller más amplio y más equipado para emplear a sus dos sobrinos, otro de sus sueños es comprar un vehículo, para trasladar los muebles fabricados a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Narciso is 44 years old, married and he has one child.  He works as a skilled carpenter.  He also works in agriculture, an occupation that he learned from his parents.

Narciso has worked in carpentry and agriculture since the age of 16.  He decided to continue practising these occupations since they have become his principal source of income.  His wife also gives an economic contribution to the family since she works selling natural medicine products.  In this way together they can satisfy their household needs and pay their financial obligations.

The money will be used to buy tools for his carpentry workshop.  The other part will be invested in the improvement and expansion of his house since it is made of mud.

Narciso's dreams are to have a larger and more equipped workshop in order to employ his two nephews and to buy a vehicle to transport the furniture he makes to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tools for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 45 years old and widowed with two children. With both children in school, Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store. like rice, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for five years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like rice, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Hildegarda

texts.en:
Hildegarda is 49 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Hildegarda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Hildegarda has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from abaca-fiber weaving.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Denia Liseth

texts.es:
Denia, de 36 años de edad, creció solo con su madre, ya que su padre falleció cuando ella era una niña, desde entonces su mamá se dedicó a la compra y venta de productos básicos; de esta manera pudo sacar adelante su familia, es madre soltera de 2 hijos.

Denia, tiene 10 años de experiencia en administrar su propia tienda con ayuda de sus dos hijas, gracias a la realización de esta actividad, ha podido pagar los estudios de sus hijas.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar productos básicos para la tienda, ya que se acercan las fiestas patronales de su comunidad y en esas fechas la demanda de sus clientes aumenta y necesita el dinero para surtir y ampliar su negocio, de esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos, los cuales serán invertidos en el mejoramiento del sistema de agua potable de su casa. 

Los sueños de Denia, son mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y ampliar su casa, ya que planea construir dos cuartos adiciónales uno para cada una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Denia, who is 36 years old, grew up with only her mother, since her father died when she was a little girl. Since then, her mother worked in buying and selling basic products. In this way she was able to raise her family. She [Denia] is the single mother of two children.

Denia has 10 years of experience in running her own store with the help of her two daughters. Thanks to this business, she has been able to pay for the education of her daughters.

The money will be used to buy basic products for the store, since the patron saint festivities of her community are approaching, and on these dates the demand from her customers increases, and she needs the money to stock and expand her business. In this way, she will be able to have better income, which will be invested in the improvement of the potable water system in her house.

Denia's dreams are to improve the facilities in her store and enlarge her house, since she plans to build two additional rooms, one for each one of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy basic products for her store.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucita is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lucita has a food processing business in the Philippines. Lucita requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk and plastic wrappers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Evelyn has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of scrap materials to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for eight years and earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. Florencia is single woman with two children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Florencia requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish nets and bamboo as well as pay for maintenance for her boat.

Florencia has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish nets and bamboo as well as pay for maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina works hard to support her family. Victorina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Victorina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fishing net and other materials for her business.

Victorina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Restituta works very hard to provide for them.

Restituta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages and other groceries.

Restituta has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Restituta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат, 62 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 30 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве Саламат есть 4 коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 900 долларов (USD) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита помогут Саламат в будущем развить бизнес и накопить на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Salamat is 62 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for 30 years already.  She currently has four cows on her farm.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of $900 (USD) to buy a few cows and increase the size of her herd.  The earnings from her loan will help Salamat to further develop her business and to save some money to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a few cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Danny Boy

texts.en:
From Cavite Philippines, Danny Boy is married and has children. He is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Danny Boy works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as hand-stitching hems and linings. One of the main dilemmas of employees like Danny Boy is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Danny Boy is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking an 8,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items and other supplies he needs for his mini-variety store, which also helps provide for his daily needs. Danny Boy wants his business to prosper, for he desires to give his family a good life. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services. CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other supplies he needs for his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is a married woman with three children and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lorna has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from personal collection.

Lorna has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, personal care items, soft drinks, soap, coffee, spices, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling scrap. Marilyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, personal care, soft drinks, soap, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Imie

texts.en:
Imie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imie is 44 years old three of her children are still in school. Imie has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Imie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 60 years old now.

Ma. Elena has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng, 54, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for thirty six years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 37 años de edad que esta próxima a dar un gran paso en su vida, con la ayuda de un préstamo podrá iniciar con un negocio que podría significar el sostenimiento de su hogar, aprovechando las habilidades culinarias que aprendió de su madre y algunas amigas quiere vender alimentos y es por esta razón que recurre a ustedes para ver si le ayuda a materializar su sueño.
Una estufa, 2 termos e insumos para preparar desayunos, fritos, almuerzos, con esta actividad busca mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, de sus dos hijos, buscar vivir mejorar, soñar con una vivienda propia, con carro, con un restaurante propio, todo ello a partir de tu voluntario aporte a este Lindo proyecto.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman of 37 who is close to taking a big step in her life. With the help of a loan, she will be able to begin a business that would mean sustaining her household. Taking advantage of the culinary skills that she learned from her mother and some friends, she wants to sell foods, and it is for this reason that she is turning to you to see if you will help her to make her dream a reality.

[She will use the loan to buy] a stove, two thermoses, and supplies to prepare breakfasts, fried snacks, and lunches. With this business, she seeks to improve the quality of life of her family and of her two children. To live better, she dreams of her own house, a car, and her own restaurant, all that as a result of your voluntary support of this beautiful project.

loans.use: to buy a stove, two thermoses, and supplies to prepare breakfasts, fried snacks, and lunches.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Myrna is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

Myrna has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber.

Myrna has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es:
Ella es Amparo una mujer de 43 años de edad dedicada a la venta de alimentos rápidas como lo son hamburguesas, perros calientes, chorizos, papas a la francesa, arepas con carne, ensaladas bebidas entre otros.
Amparo inicio dicha actividad como necesidad económica pues se separó de su esposo y quedo sola con su hijo de 15 de años de edad. Es una mujer muy soñadora y no quiere que sus pensamientos se queden solo en sueños, su mayor prioridad en el momento es seguir apoyando los estudios de su hijo que aprenda inglés, quiere tener un local, pues desplazar su puesto de comidas, es un trabajo tedioso y agotador físicamente.
Su idea es mejorar, mejorar, mejorar y solo mejorar, tener mejores, ventas, aumentar sus clientes, optimizar sus procesos, incrementar su utilidad, ser competitiva, tener empleados, ser  siempre feliz.
Amparo quiere solicitar un préstamo para atender una urgencia que la tiene imposibilitada de trabajar la cual es reparar su puesto de comida rápidas, con el resto de capital comprara surtido para la elaboración de los alimentos inicialmente mencionados
texts.en:
Ampara is a 43 year old woman who makes a living selling fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, sausages, french fries, chicken arenas, salads, drinks, and more.

Ampara began this activity out of an economic need to support herself after separating from her husband and staying with her 15 year old son. She is a woman who has always been a dreamer, and she does not want her thoughts only to remain in her dreams. Her top priorities at the moment are to: continue supporting her son's English studies, and to open a bar so she can move her work away from the food stall, as it is tedious and exhausting work. 

Her main goal is to improve, improve, improve, and ONLY improve. She wants to have better sales, to increase her client base, to optimize her current processes, to improve her utility, to be competitive, to have employees, and ultimately, to be happy.

Amparo wants to ask a loan in order to attend to urgent repairs at her fast food stall. With the rest of the capital, she will buy extra food, like why she mentioned above.

loans.use: to repair urgent needs at her fast food stall

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una adorable, tierna, luchadora, trabajadora madre cabeza de familia, su negocio consiste en la venta de mangos, dulces, chocolates y frituras en empaque.
María tiene 52 años de edad, un pequeño de 10 años de edad, trabaja en las calles desplazándose y tratando de conseguir una venta para llevar el alimento a su hogar.
Sus sueños con su negocio son poder tener una vivienda propia, pagar la educación de su hijo, ganar sostenibilidad, en un futuro tener un local propio, mejorar sus ventas entre otros.
María solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido principalmente mangos, sal, Azúcar y pimienta, el resto de capital lo invertirá en el arreglo de su carro, le hará soldaduras, le cambiara las ruedas y comprara una nueva sombrilla.
texts.en:
Maria is an adorable, affectionate, striving, and hard-working mother who is the head of a family. Her business consists of selling mangoes, sweets, chocolates, and fried foods in packages.

Maria is 52 years old, and she has a little 10-year-old son. She works in the streets, moving around and trying to make a sale to bring food to her household.

Her dreams with her business are to be able to have her own house, pay for the education of her son, earn sustenance, in the future to have her own shop, and to improve her sales, among other things.

Maria is applying for a loan for the purchase of a stock principally of mangoes, salt, sugar, and peppers. She will invest the rest of the capital in repairing her cart. She will do soldering, replace the wheels, and buy a new umbrella.

loans.use: to buy a stock of mangoes, salt, sugar, and peppers and use the rest of the loan to repair her cart and replace her umbrella

loans.name: Nueva Vida Quixaya Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Nueva Vida Quixaya” is made up of eight women who organized in order to receive loans through Friendship Bridge. The members of the group are anxious to begin a new loan cycle and are applying for a 22,000 GTQ to be apportioned among themselves. They are ready as well to continue to gain knowledge from the monthly meetings where they learn about women’s issues, health, micro-businesses and administration. These are subjects that are a part of The Friendship Bridge’s “Microcredit Plus” non-formal education program.

28-year-old Myra is the leader of the group. She has three children and only two years of a formal education. She raises pigs to sell. Right now she has two piglets, but with her portion of the loan she hopes to buy five more as well as material to keep the pigs in corrals. Her business has generated enough income that she is certain she will have enough in profits for her children’s education.

Myra and the other members of the Trust Bank “Nueva Vida Quixaya” have many dreams and goals. They are grateful to KIVA investors for making their dreams and goals happen. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy five more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and unmarried. For the past two years she has run a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Vilma took out and successfully repaid a previous loan. She is now requesting 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries.

Vilma works very hard to provide for her family and save money to build her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with a variety of groceries.

loans.name: Gladis Seneida

texts.es:
Gladis, de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y es madre de cuatro hijas, en su casa vive su padre y 3 nietos.

Gladis, tiene una tienda desde hace muchos años, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como (aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, verduras y otros), vende todos los días de la semana desde muy temprano hasta las ocho de la noche.
Gladis, solicita un crédito para comprar frijoles, aceite, arroz, azúcar, maíz, harina y otros productos para su tienda.

Ella sueña con mejorar poco a poco  su casa e incrementar su inventario de productos, para ofrecer más productos a los clientes, además desea apoyar a sus hijas menores, para que sigan con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis, a 48 year old woman, studied until fifth grade. She has a partner, and she is a mother of 4 daughters. Her father and three grandchildren live with her.

Gladis has had a store for many years, in which she sells basic necessities such as oil, beans, rice, sugar, vegetables, and more. She works every day of the week from early in the morning until eight at night. Gladis is asking for a loan in order to buy beans, oil, rice, sugar, corn, flour, and more products for her store.

She dreams of bettering her life and home little by little, and increasing her inventory of products in order to offer more to her clients. She also dreams of supporting her youngest children in continuing their studies.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, rice, sugar, corn, flour, and other products for her shop.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 22, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For the past five years she has earned money selling fish in the Philippines.

Marivic has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She is working hard to save enough money so she can continue sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Desde el año 1996 la señora Luz María viene ofertando sus servicios de sala de belleza, una actividad que inicio por pasión por amor a la estética, a los peinados, a mirar la cara de admiración y de alegría cuando una cliente queda hermosa por un trabajo suyo.
Luz María es una madre soltera cabeza de familia ella sola levanto a sus dos hijos de 25 y 15 años de edad, les dio techo, alimento y estudio y siempre está dispuesta para ellos.
