Luz María se ha trazado unas metas muy claras para este año las cuales son a partir de un apoyo financiero que se encuentra solicitando juntar capital e invertirlo en tinturas para el cabello, y cabello natural para las extensiones que realiza. 
Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera comenzar ahorrar y en diciembre encontrarse con resultados como mejoras locativas, cambio de maquinaria, empelar personas, o incluso abrir un segundo local.
texts.en:
Since 1996, Luz Maria has been offering beauty salon services; it's an activity that began as a passion and love of aesthetics and haircuts, and she loves to see the face of admiration and happiness when a client feels beautiful due to her work. 

Luz Maria is a single mother and the head of her family; she has raised two children by herself, who are aged 25 and 15. She gives them shelter, food, schooling, and is always ready to be there for him.

She has set very clear goals for this year involving the financial support she needs; she is requesting to raise capital to invest in hair dyes as well as natural hair for extensions. With the support from her loan, she hopes to begin saving money. In December, she hopes to see improvements such as changing her machinery, employing new people, and opening a second location.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and natural hair to supply her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a factory worker. She is from Cavite, Philippines, and has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Mary Jane works as an Assistant Production Line Leader. She conducts inspections and tests per control plan, work instruction and procedures. She maintains good housekeeping at all times at the respective working area. She is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipment.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Mary Jane is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Mary Jane is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for the ATM card that she pawned.

Mary Jane dreams to improve her present financial condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned ATM card

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 43 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Marilyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa works hard to support her family. Nimfa is married and has a banana-farming business in the Philippines.

Nimfa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nimfa has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital to start her business and hire a web developer to update her website.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa and her husband were farmers when they got married. She is from Canubay, Oroquieta. She has a coconut farm and earns a good income each quarter, enabling her to support her family. Luisa has applied for her membership in PMPC to access insurance and financial assistance. She wants to repair the comfort room in her house so she has requested an amount to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. Luisa is thankful for all her financing needs being supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are still in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 58-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a barber shop; he is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. 

Her husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics (i.e creams, hair brush, shaving creams, blades and other accessories) for his barber shop but due to financial constraints he is not capable of buying these items. Therefore Grace has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

Grace is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: and her husband buy different types of cosmeticsfor his barber shop

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is 37 years old from Puangi, Dipaculao, Aurora. She and her husband earn a living through farming and a sari sari store in order to provide for their two children. 

Even though they both work, they find it hard to send their son Christian to college. That’s why Emilie is asking for an education loan of PHP12,000 from the KIVA lenders. 

Christian is taking up his BS in Forestry. He is hopeful to finish his college education to help his parents alleviate their way of living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is from Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Jhones and they have children.  She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for years now with the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Rose Ann is a Sewing Assistant.  She helps the sewer or tailor in the production department and also does the sewing of clothing apparel according to the company or client’s demands.  She sews clothing using a sewing machine or other stitching machine, or often hand stitches edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Rose Ann, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Rose Ann is asking for your assistance to prevent her from engaging with loan sharks.  She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem with repayment since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help.  She will also use the loan to pay for housing expenses.

Rose Ann hopes to give her children a quality education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land preparation. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Nena hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is earning a living by farming in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. He has always been known to provide the best for his family. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, he diligently pays all his obligations from his earnings. 

Hilario hopes to provide his family with safe and comfortable living quarters.  Therefore, he has requested a loan to purchase marine plywood and nails for for double walling his house. 

Hilario wishes to earn more from his business to continuously benefit his family.

loans.use: to purchase plywood and nails to double wall his house.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 30 years old and married with two children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arlyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural district of Kampong Cham province, Ra, is 48 years old and married with one son, who is now working as a taxi driver. 

Ra and her husband have been farming rice for around thirty years and this is the family's main source of income. This is Ra's second loan with VisionFund. After she fully repaid her previous loan, Ra formed up a group of two to request this loan. Ra spent her loan portion on rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field. She wishes to generate more income so that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Romie

texts.en: Romie, a farmer from San Mariano, Isabela, is married to an overseas Filipino worker and blessed with three children. Even though the two of them are earning income, it is sometimes insufficient to meet all the needs of their children. That is why, to send his son to college, Romie wants to borrow a PHP 200,000 education loan from Kiva lenders. That amount will pay for his son's tuition fees. His son Richard is studying for a bachelor of science degree in accountancy because he dreams of becoming a successful certified public accountant.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma has been in this business for 8 years. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pakeeza Shaheen

texts.en:
Pakeeza Shaheen is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for five years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Pakeeza Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Pakeeza Shaheen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. She also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Pakeeza Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Rovy

texts.en:
Rovy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Rovy has a food manufacturing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and other materials for her food production business.

Rovy has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Jeune célibataire et très actif, Samuel est âgé de 34 ans. Il vit à Tokoin pour exercer son activité. Pour gagner sa vie, Samuel répare et vend des chaussures aux clients en sollicitation. Grâce à son activité, Samuel arrive à satisfaire l’attente de ses clients et désire améliorer sa prestation. Samuel achète ses matières de fabrication au marché  et demande ce prêt pour commander des colles, semelles et des peaux de chaussures et accroitre sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old, single and very active in his business.  He lives in Tokoin and earns his living by reparing and selling shoes to his customers.  Thanks to this business, Samuel is able to satisfy his clients but he would like to improve the services that he offers.

Samuel buys his supplies from the market and has requested this loan to buy glue, soles and shoe skins to help to improve his profitability.

loans.use: to buy a box of glue, 3 shoe soles and 8 shoe skins for his cobbler business.

loans.name: Mablé

texts.fr: Magblé vit à Sagboville  et est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est une femme mariée qui s’occupe de la charge de ses deux enfants. Pour entreprendre une activité rémunératrice de revenu, Magblé vend des poissons dans son quartier pour gagner son revenu. Magblé achète ses marchandises au port de pèche deux fois par mois afin d’avoir en permanence un stock disponible. Magblé veut commander des tas de poissons et demande ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat et continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Magblé is 42 years old and lives in Sagboville.  She is a married woman who takes care of her two children.

In order to earn a living, Magblé sells fish in her neighbourhood.  She buys her supplies from the fishing port twice a month to ensure that she always has enough stock.

Magblé has requested this loan to buy quantities of fish to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy 7 lots of fish for resale.

loans.name: Yeferson

texts.es:
Yeferson es un hombre de 31 años de edad, honesto y trabajador se dedica al transporte de personas de las zonas rurales, solo para que se hagan la idea del difícil camino que tiene que recorrer la muestra está en la foto como se encuentra el vehículo por pasar por terrenos pantanosos, difíciles pero sin estos vehículos cientos de personas que viven en zonas rurales, montañas estarías muy afectadas.
Yeferson tiene una familia unidad, junto con su pareja tienen una hija de 16 meses de edad, esta bebe le ha entregado alegría y momentos inolvidables y  pacto un compromiso con él mismo de mejorar tanto personal como laboralmente, solo por ella por buscarle un mejor futuro, y que ella tenga todo de parte suya para triunfar.
Yeferson se encuentran solicitando un apoyo el motivo es que quiere realizar un mantenimiento preventivo y algunas reparaciones a su vehículo que ha sido tan maltratado por los difíciles caminos que diariamente recorre.
texts.en:
Yeferson is a 31-year-old man, honest and hardworking, whose business is providing transport for people in rural areas. Just to give an idea of the difficult terrain he has to cover, the photo shows what the vehicle looks like after being driven through difficult, marshy terrain. Without these vehicles, hundreds of people who live in rural and mountaineous areas would suffer.

Yeferson has a family unit, he and his partner have a 16-month-old daughter, a baby that has brought him joy and unforgettable moments and he has vowed to improve himself on the personal and professional level to make a better future for her, and to give her what she needs to succeed. 

Yeferson is requesting this support because he wants to carry out preventive maintenance and some repairs on his vehicle that has been battered by the difficult tracks that he travels on every day.

loans.use: to carry out preventive maintenance on his vehicle, and do some repairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 46 años de edad esta solo juntado con su esposa con la que tiene una familia de ocho hijos de las de edades entre 4 y 29 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Para Cruz trabajar en el campo y compartir con la naturaleza es una gran bendición, porque con el sudor en la frente día con día lucha para que su familia tenga todo lo necesario, el desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura por lo tanto sus años  de experiencia lo hace producir buenas cosechas, él cuenta que gracias a esta actividad él ha logrado mantener  a su familia, Cruz ahora ha empezado a preparar la tierra para cultivar pero la dificultad que tiene Cruz es que en estos días la situación económica de su comunidad le impide poder cultivar porque no cuenta con suficiente dinero para cultivar  la cosecha de zanahoria y papa, pero el para que pueda cultivar este años ha pensado solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comparar sus semillas de zanahoria y papa.
El gran anhelo de Cruz es poder cultivar este año, para generar mejores ingresos y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela para verlos graduar algún día.
texts.en:
Cruz is 46 years old and lives with his wife. The couple has eight children, between the ages of 4 and 29 years old. The family lives in a community in Sololá.

For Cruz, working in the countryside and in nature is a wonderful blessing. With the sweat on his brow, he works hard every day so that his family has everything that they need. Cruz has worked in farming for 20 years and his experience allows him to produce a good harvest. It is thanks to this work that Cruz has been able to support his family. 

Cruz has now begun to prepare the earth to grow his crops. The problem is, however, that, owing to the local economy, Cruz does not have enough money to grow his carrots and potatoes. He is therefore applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds to grow carrots and potatoes.

Cruz’s biggest wish is to grow his crops this year in order to earn a higher income and continue supporting his children at school and see them graduate one day.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Tchotcho est une femme mariée et âgée de 53 ans. Tchotcho vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier de Kpehenou. Tchotcho désire contribuer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants qui sont à sa charge et vend de l’eau en sachet. Cette activité lui génère un gain favorable afin de venir en aider aux besoins de son foyer. Tchotcho s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter les sachets d’eau, Tchotcho sollicite ce crédit pour son financement et réaliser une bonne rentabilité pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Tchotcho is a 53-year-old, married woman.  She lives with her four children in the Kpehenou district.  She wants to contribute to the improvement in living conditions of her children so she sells water in bags.  Her business is profitable and allows her to provide for the needs of her household.

Tchotcho buys her supplies twice a month from the market.  She has requested this loan to buy water bags.  The sale of this water will make enough profit to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 100 water bags for her retail business.

loans.name: Rodolfo Benjamín

texts.es:
Rodolfo es un hombre de 51 años de edad es casado tiene una familia muy hermosa de 3 hijos de las edades entre 22 y 30 años,  vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura sembrando frijol y tomate, para Rodolfo trabajar en el campo es una bendición, porque el comparte con la belleza de la naturaleza día con día, el hace algunos días sembró  tomate en una pequeña comunidad de su  pueblo, Pues esa siembra de tomate ahora ya necesita de su mantenimiento pero una de las limitaciones de Rodolfo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder darle su mantenimiento, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, fungicidas para que la cosecha de buena producción.
El gran sueño de Rodolfo es poder mejorar su vivienda y poder construirles su propia casa a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 51, is married and has a very beautiful family of three children from ages 22 to 30.  He lives with his family in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

To earn an income to support his family, he works in agriculture growing beans and tomatoes.  For Rodolfo, working on the farm is a blessing because he lives with the beauty of nature every day.  A few days ago he planted tomatoes in a small community of his village and the crop now is in need of maintenance.  But Rodolfo does not have enough money and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides to produce a good harvest.

Rodolfo's dream is to renovate his home and build houses for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy locust bean seeds.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Silvia es una mujer con su estado civil como separada, dedicada a la venta informal de mercancía como lo son lociones, fragancias, desodorantes, productos capilares, productos faciales, y algunos artículos de joyería realizados en acero.
Silvia es madre de dos hijos, hace todo pro que ellos puedan comer bien, tengan una prenda limpia para vestir, es muy sobreprotectora y su sueño es poder verlos graduarse de una institución universitaria.
Aprendió del negocio de la distribución de mercancía gracias a un amigo y con la ha ejercido desde el año 2002.
Su sueño más valioso, lo que más quiere, mas desea es poder tener una vivienda propia y trabaja muy fuerte por ello.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía tal y como se ve en la foto con ello saldrá a las calles a vender y esperar una buena utilidad por sus productos.
texts.en:
This is Silvia. She is separated and makes a living selling merchandise, such as lotions, perfumes, deodorants, hair and face products, and some jewellery items produced with steel.

Silvia is a mother to two children. She does everything that she can so that they may eat and dress well. Silvia is very protective of her children; her dream is to watch them graduate from university.

Silvia learned how to run her business from a friend. She has been doing it since 2002.

Silvia’s biggest dream is to own her own house. She is working hard to achieve this. 

Silvia is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as that shown in the photo. This loan will allow Silvia to go out into the streets to sell her products. She hopes that she will earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy personal products, such as lotions, deodorants, hair and facial products, and steel jewellery products.

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mirna, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ellos tienen tres hijos, los cuales actualmente estudian.

Mirna, trabaja como empleada domésticos en casas ajenas, tiene dos meses de dedicarse a este oficio.- Mirna, quiere  dedicarse a otras actividades, pero en este caso quiere comenzar con la crianza de animales y es algo que les seria de provecho, para mejorar su nivel económico y así  generar más ingresos a su hogar.- Su trabajo actual se encuentra situado a tres cuadras de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Mirna, necesita el dinero para comprar cerdos y maicillo para la alimentación de los animales y engordarlos para venderlos a un mejor precio, para sacar ganancias de ellos y así hacer venta y compra de animales para ampliar su negocio sucesivamente.

Los sueños de Mirna, son tener un buen negocio, que le genere ingresos para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar hasta donde ella no pudo.
texts.en:
Mirna, 30, has a fifth grade education.  She and her partner work in agriculture and livestock farming.  They have three children who attend school.

Mirna is a domestic employee in private homes and has been in this line of work for two months.  She wants to start other activities like raising animals to improve her income and generate more money for the household.  Her place of work is three blocks from home and her schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

The loan Mirna needs is to buy pigs and millet to feed them.  When they grow she will sell them at the best price for a profit and continue to expand her pig business little by little.

Mirna dreams of having her own business and generating an income so her children can get the education she did not have access to.

loans.use: To buy pigs and millet to feed them.

loans.name: Cristian Javier

texts.es:
Cristian, de 26 años de edad, está estudiando ingeniería agronómica, tiene tres años de estar acompañado y su pareja trabaja y estudia, ella tiene una tienda con artículos para mujer, se dedica a ambas cosas y a cuidar de su hijo de tres años. 

Cristian, desde hace tres años trabaja en un restaurante, tuvo que empezar a trabajar, desde que formo su hogar, la distancia de su casa a su trabajo es de 20 kilómetros y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

Cristian, necesita el crédito para comprar una motocicleta, para poder trasladarse a su trabajo y a su lugar de estudio, esto le ayudara mucho tanto económicamente, como en tiempo.

Los sueños de Cristian son seguir adelante en su trabajo y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cristian, 26, is studying agronomy engineering.  For three years he has been in a relationship and his partner works and studies.  She runs a women's accessories store and also takes care of the home and their three-year-old son.

For three years Cristian has been working in a restaurant.  Since he set up his household three years ago he has had to travel 20 kilometers to his workplace.  His schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Cristian is in need of a loan to buy a motorcycle to go to work and his place of study.  This will help him save time and money.

Cristian dreams of advancing in his work and of finishing his studies.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: France Arles

texts.es:
Por herencia de su familia, por ser fiel a sus creencias, seguir los pasos de su padre, France tomo un negocio de cultivo de cebolla, en las fotos se puede ver lo sano y bien cuidado que lo tiene, pues en este negocio hay que tener mucha pasión y dedicación para entregar un buen producto final.

Hablando un poco de la vida de France, es un hombre de 38 años de edad vive junto con su esposa con la cual tiene 4 niños, dos mujeres de 17 y 5 años de edad y dos varones de 14 y 13 años de edad.

La familia simboliza todo para France, ellos son su pilar moral, los ama y trabaja fuertemente para que no pasen necesidades, su objetivo inmediato es poder tener sostenibilidad de su negocio para seguir llevando el alimento diario a su mesa.

France solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son gallinaza, insecticidas, fungicidas, y herbicidas, la razón del  monto es equivalente al alto precio de estos productos multiplicado por el área de su cultivo de cebolla.
texts.en:
Through family inheritance, to remain faithful to his beliefs and to follow in his father's footsteps, France took on a business growing onions. In the photo, you can see how healthy it is and how well he looks after it, because this is a business that requires a great deal of passion and dedication to deliver a good final product. 

To say a little about France's life, he is 38 years old and he lives with his wife with whom he has 4 children, two girls of 17 and 5 years of age and 2 boys of 14 and 13 years of age. Family is everything for France, they are his moral pillar, he loves them and works very hard to ensure that they do not suffer any hardships. His immediate aim is to make his business sustainable in order to continue putting the daily food on his table. 

France is requesting a loan to buy agricultural consumables such as hen droppings, insecticide, fungicide and herbicide. The amount requested reflects the high price of these products multiplied by the cultivation area of his onions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables such as hen droppings, insecticides, fungicides

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of 8 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For several days now his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this her husband has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing it. Therefore. Robina has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover this cost. This will help him to continue his business. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 31 años de edad es de Sololá, tiene una familia de 1 hijo de la edad de 2 años que se encuentra bajo el cuidado de la madre.
Santiago para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, trabaja con amor y dedicación para generar sus ingresos él se dedica desde hace 8 años a la compra y venta de consumo diario  en la plaza de su comunidad,  para el este pequeño negocio es su fuente de ingresos, a él le gusta este tipo de negocio pues a través de ella se relaciona con  mucha gente, pero en otros días que no son días  de plaza él también se dedica a la agricultura, para el a pesar de ser  comerciante, el ser agricultor no es nada difícil pues el creció junto a su padre dedicándose a la siembra, ahora Santiago en estos últimos días se ha puesto a observar las necesidades de su familia y una de ellas la remodelación de su casa, pues su casa ya tienes algunos  años por lo tanto ya cuenta con algunos desperfectos, pero Santiago en este momento no tiene el dinero suficiente para realizar la remodelación, pero se ha propuesto solicitar un préstamo  que lo utilizara para comparar cemento, block, arena, y junto a su familia estarían pagando la deuda.
Santiago tiene las esperanzas  de conseguir un préstamo para realizar la mejora de su casa este año.l
texts.en:
Santiago, 31, is from Sololá.  He has a two-year-old son who is cared for by the mother.  So that the family lacks for nothing, Santiago works with love and dedication to generate an income.  For eight years he has been buying and selling daily consumption goods in the village square.  This small business is his source of income, and he enjoys it because he is able to be in touch with many people.  On days that are not market days he also works in agriculture which is not difficult for him because he grew up beside his father who was a crop farmer.

Lately, Santiago has been observing the needs of his family, one of which is remodeling the house which is quite old and in need of a few repairs.  For the time being Santiago does not have the money for the project.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy cement, blocks and sand.  The family will pay back the loan.

Santiago trusts he will receive the loan so he can renovate the house this year.

loans.use: To buy cement, blocks and sand to renovate his house.

loans.name: Raquel Del Carmen

texts.es: Raquel nació en una comunidad llamada Nacascolo sur en el año de 1982, ella creció con su madre y abuelita, a los 7 años empezó a estudiar su primaria ,luego que término de estudiar su primaria se dedico a ayudarle a su madre a las actividades de la casa, así fue que aprendió las labores del hogar.Actualmente esta casada y tiene 2 hijos.Ella y su esposo con mucho esfuerzo lograron poner una pulperia. En su comunidad no tiene red de agua potable, por eso ellos decidieron hacer un pozo en la propiedad, pero quisieran un préstamo para la compra de un sistema de bombeo y un panel solar ya que en ese sector donde ella vive se va bastante la luz eléctrica y a veces se quedan a oscuras, el sistema de bombeo seria de gran beneficio ya que a ella le toca viajar bastante largo para traer el agua hasta su casa y tiene que utilizar una carreta con baldes de agua para poder traer el agua de un pozo que está bastante largo de donde ella vive, ella estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema de bombeo y panel solar.
texts.en:
Raquel was born in 1982 in a community called Nacascolo.  She was raised by her mother and grandmother and started grade school at age 7.  After finishing primary she started helping her mother with the housework.  Now she is married and has two children.  She and her husband worked to hard to establish a grocery store.  In their community there is no running water so they decided to open a well on their property.  Now they are requesting a loan to buy a pump system and solar panel since the electricity goes out frequently where they live.  The water pump would be of great benefit since Raquel has to travel quite a distance to get water using a wheelbarrow and jugs to bring it from the well to her home.

She would be very grateful for a loan to buy a pump system and solar panel.

loans.use: To buy a solar system and a water pump.

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en: Jovencio learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives for businesses. He became a member in 2012. Jovencio has supported his family in doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He was fortunate to receive the needed capital when he joined PMPC. He was grateful to PMPC for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. Now, Jovencio borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give his farming income a big boost. Jovencio looks for better business opportunities and deeply wishes to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Gulfam Bibi

texts.en:
Gulfam Bibi is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her six children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own scrap business, and one of her sons has been running a mobile shop for the past six years. 

Gulfam Bibi's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business but, due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Gulfam Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Gulfam Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of mobile accessories for her son's mobile business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of that, her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shazia is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en: Sean is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still under her support. The family lives in a very rural area of Mondulkiri province and has been growing cassava for more than five years. This is her family's main and only source of income. After successfully repaying her previous loan, Sean led a group of five females to seek other loans from VisionFund. Sean used her loan portion to spend on the land-plowing fee. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family by having sufficient and nutritious food.

loans.use: to pay the land-plowing fee

loans.name: Anchares

texts.en:
Anchares works hard to support her family. Anchares has a live-in partner and has an entertainment business in the Philippines.

Anchares requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and prizes for her business. Anchares has been in this business for five years now.

Anchares would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and prizes for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 49 years old. She is married with six children and is from Ozamiz, Philippines. Lolita has a snack-vending business and has been earning approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of activity for 5 years now. This is how she helped her husband in sustaining their needs. Lolita wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks and plywood for her house. Lolita has recently became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks and plywood for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, 12-24-12 manure, liquid fertilizers to apply to the leaves, and more to tend her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer and liquid fertilizer to apply to the leaves, to tend her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, liquid fertilizer to apply to leaves, and pay labor costs to take care of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos.

Saúl, trabaja como albañil y es agricultor, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, la distancia de su casa hasta su trabajo es de 9 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

Saúl, necesita el crédito para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, bloque y pagar la mano de obra, para mejorar su casa, el préstamo le ayudara a reparar su casa, porque hay una parte que está en mal estado.

Los sueños de Saúl, son seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta, que es albañilería  y en el futuro desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Saúl is 30 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He has 3 children, and none of whom live with them.  

Saúl works as a bricklayer and he is a farmer. He has done this activity for 10 years The distance from his house to his work is 9 kilometers and his work schedule is 6 hours a day.

Saúl needs the loan to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks and to pay for the labor to improve his home. The loan will help him repair his home because there is a part that is in poor condition.  

Saúl's dream is to keep working at what he likes, which is bricklaying, and in the future he wants to keep supporting his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and to pay for labor to improve his home.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Doña Olinda con el crédito brindado por COMIXMUL compro abonos y foliares así como también semilla de maíz y frijol certificada para poder sembrar y mejorar los ingresos en su hogar apoyando a su familia en lo posible obteniendo una cosecha de 20 QQ de maíz y 5 QQ de Frijol. Gracias al crédito obtenido su vida cambio mucho ya que en el lugar donde habita no existe ningún apoyo económico que sea beneficioso para ellos como productores de café, excepto los dueños de beneficios, intermediarios que viven en la zona y prestan a tasas de interés elevadas mensualmente desde un 7% hasta un 10%. Doña Olinda solicita un nuevo crédito con el cual comprara nuevamente, abonos, foliares y semilla de maíz y frijol certificada para poder cultivar 6 tareas  de tierra por lo cual espera ser nuevamente apoyada.
texts.en: With the loan offered by COMIXMUL, Olinda bought fertilizer and foliar sprays as well as certified corn and bean seeds to plant and improve her household income to support her family as much as possible. She obtained a harvest of 20 quintals of corn and 5 quintals of beans. Thanks to the loan she obtained, her life has changed a lot. Where she lives there is no financial support that is beneficial to them as coffee growers, except for intermediaries that live in the area and loan at elevated monthly interest rates from 7% to 10%. Olinda is asking for a new loan to once again buy fertilizer, foliar sprays and certified corn and bean seeds so she can plant 6 hectares of land, for which she hopes to be supported once more.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and once again corn and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Melbourne

texts.en: Melbourne has been operating her grocery store for 14 years. With her hard work and determination she was able to improve her business. She plans to purchase more stocks of grocery items and is seeking for an additional capital of 50,000 PHP. She will utilise this loan amount to buy grocery items such as boxes of noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, junk foods and juice drinks to sell. Melbourne believes that her success relies on her own hard work and initiative in running her grocery store well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as boxes of noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, junk foods and juice drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as bread, coffee, canned goods, candies, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

Zosima has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Zosima aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as bread, coffee, canned goods, candies, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 35-year-old, married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cheryl has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional units and spare parts for her business. Cheryl has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional units and spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es:
José es un adorable muy trabajador, conversador, agradable hombre de 66 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, dulces, chocolates, café, frituras en empaque, con esta actividad puede llevar todos los días una bolsa de alimentos a su hogar, puede pagar las cuentas y gastar los medicamentos de su señora esposa.
Él trabaja intensamente 10 horas por cada día pues su negocio surgió de una seria de pensamientos, de pruebas guiados por la necesidad económica y más por su incapacidad de conseguir empleo no por sus facultades si no por su ya avanzada edad.
José necesita comprar surtido el requiere de tu apoyo, de no serlo así tendría que acudir con entes no legales pues necesita de urgencia abastecer el negocio que le está dando de comer.
Con el crédito comprara billetes de lotería, surtido de café, frituras, dulces, y chocolates
texts.en:
José is an adorable, very hard-working, talkative, and pleasant 66-year-old man. He works selling lottery tickets, sweets, chocolates, coffee, packaged fried foods and, with this work, he can bring a bag of food to the house every day, he can pay his bills and buy the medicines for his wife. 

He works hard 10 hours each day. His business came out of a series of thoughts and trials guided by economic necessity and more by his inability to get work, not due to his skills, but to his advanced age. 

José needs to purchase an assortment of things, and he needs your help, without it, he would have to approach illegal entities since he urgently needs to stock the business which provides him with food.

With this loan, he will purchase lottery tickets, and an assortment of coffee, fried foods, sweets, and chocolate.

loans.use: to purchase lottery tickets to sell, and and assortment of coffee, fried foods, sweets, and chocolates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, liquid fertilizer to apply to the leaves, and tend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, liquid fertilizers to apply to the leaves, fertilizers, and pay labor costs to tend her coffee plants.

loans.name: Ariel De Jesus

texts.es:
Ariel es un hombre de 29 años de edad, una persona honesta, centrada en su trabajo y familia, trabaja diariamente en su cultivo de lulos que son la fruta que podemos ver en la foto con este negocio logra generar el sustento para sus 3 hijas ellas tiene una edad de 4, 5, 10 años son muy cariñosas le demuestran mucho amor a Ariel y aunque es separado de su esposa, sigue trabajando incluso más fuerte para mandarles dinero pues no quiere que en ningún momento pasen necesidad, no tengan estudio, una prenda de vestir o algún útil escolar. 

Ariel continuo con su este negocio pus le fue heredado de sus padres quienes le enseñaron como mantenerlo, abonarla, protegerlo y poco a poco ha ido implementando su estilo de trabajo, tal y como lo podemos ver en la foto, cuelga los productos pero los protege en un invernadero, evitando que insectos, aves o personas inescrupulosas le roben productos.

Ariel en el momento se encuentra ante ustedes comentándoles su vida, su trabajo, pues quiere buscar un apoyo, comprometiéndose a pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas ya que le están brindando la oportunidad de crecer, extender sus tierras, proteger sus preciadas frutas.

Ariel con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar los siguientes productos y realizar algunas reparaciones descritas a continuación.

•	Mejora del invernadero para los nuevos terrenos, compra de plástico, cuerda, palos de madera, clavos y mano de obra.
•	Compra insumos agrícolas como gallinaza, insecticidas, fungicidas.
•	Compra de abonos, riegos, semillas
texts.en:
Ariel is a 29 year old man. He is an honest person who is centered on his work and his family. Every day he works at his naranjilla crop, which is the fruit that can be seen in the photo. With this business, he is able to generate income to support his 3 daughters, aged  4, 5, and 10. They are very affectionate and show Ariel a lot of love, even though he is separated from his wife. He continues to work even harder in order to send them money. He doesn't want them to lack for anything, not education, an item of clothing, or a school supply.  

Ariel continues with his business that he inherited from his parents, who taught him how to maintain it, fertilize it, and protect it. Little by little he has put his work style into practice, as can be seen in the photo. He hangs his products, but he protects them in a greenhouse, avoiding insects, birds, and unscrupulous people who steel the products.

At this time, Ariel finds himself before you, telling you about his life, and his work. He is seeking help and is committed to making his payments on time, since he is being offered this chance to grow, extend his land, and protect his delicate fruit. 

With the help of this loan, Ariel wants to buy the following products and make the repairs described below:  

•	Improve the greenhouse for the new land, buy plastic, rope, wooden rods, mails and pay for labor. 
•	Buy agricultural materials such as chicken manure, insecticides, and fungicide.
•	Buy fertilizer, irrigation materials, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, irrigation materials and seeds.

loans.name: Beatriz Lucila

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer del campo toda una luchadora, ella es muy independiente le gusta valerse por sí misma por eso desde que tuvo la oportunidad monto un negocio de cría de ganado porcino, dicha actividad le ha permitido ganarse su sustento, vivir bajo sus propias normas y espera seguir creciendo paso a paso.
Su idea al iniciar su negocio fue buscar fondos para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y no descansara hasta lograrlo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cerda de cría, construir de un corral y alimento de engorde para cerdos. 
Dicho préstamo le permitirá tener un cerdo que pueda gestar crías, para evitar los gastos de compra de lechones que le suben muchos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a very determined woman of the countryside. She is very independent and likes to take care of herself so, when she had the opportunity, she established a business raising pigs. This work has allowed her to earn her living, live under her own control, and she hopes to continue growing, step by step. 

Her idea when she began her business was to seek funds to improve the condition of her house and she won't rest until she manages to do it.

She asks for a loan to purchase a pig to raise, build a corral, and fattening feed for pigs.

This loan will allow her to have a pig that can breed, to avoid the cost of purchasing piglets that increases her expenses a lot.

loans.use: to build a corral, purchase a pig to raise, piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
Venancia es casada, vive en una comunidad de Sololá tiene 34 años de edad, cuenta con una linda familia de 3 hijos de los cuales son dos mujeres y un hombre de las edades entre 2 y 6 años.
Para Venancia no hay nada más importante que sus hijos es por eso que para darles todo lo mejor ella se dedica a dos actividades, la primera es que ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de tortillería, en su casa pues ella con la higiene y responsabilidad con la que prepara las tortillas ha logrado que su clientela se sientan satisfechos con su trabajo, pero con estos ingresos no es suficiente es por eso que también realiza oficios domésticos con otras personas de su comunidad donde lava trastos realiza la limpieza y entre y entre otras cosas, Venancia cuenta que esta segunda actividad para ella es bastante rentable pues la ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos y así poder darle a su familia lo que necesiten, pero Venancia se preocupa por las necesidades que la familia tiene es por eso que ahora se ha dado cuenta que es necesario terminar la construcción de su casa, pues hace mucho que no se ha terminado, pero uno de los motivos que le impide a Venancia a terminar la construcción  es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar los materiales necesario, Pero ella para cumplir la meta se ha propuesto trabajar más para solicitar un prestamo que lo utiliza para comprar algunos materiales como cemento, block y arena y poder acabar con la construcción.
Para Venancia es importante conseguir el prestamo para que su familia tenga una mejor comodidad, y seguir realizando mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Venancia is married, lives in the community of Sololá, is 34 years old, and has a lovely family with three children, of whom two are women and a one is a man, between the ages of 2 and 6. 

For Venancia, there is nothing more important than her children, and it is to give them the best, that she works in two jobs. The first is that she has a small tortilla making business, in her house, since with the cleanliness and responsibility with which she makes the tortillas, she has managed to have customers satisfied with her work. But this income is not enough, so she also does domestic work with other people in her community where she washes dishes, does cleaning, and other things. Venancia says that this second job for her is fairly profitable since it helps her to increase her income and in this way give her family what they need, but Venancia is worried about the needs that her family has, and for this she now has realized that it is necessary to finish building her house, since it hasn't been finished for a long time, but one of the things that prevents Venancia from finishing its construction is that she doesn't have enough money to purchase the materials she needs. In order to achieve this goal, she has proposed working more to ask for a loan to use to purchase some materials such as cement, blocks, and sand to be able to finish the construction. 

For Venancia, it is important to get the loan so that her family is more comfortable and to continue making improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, blocks, and sand to finish building her house.

loans.name: Martha Dolly

texts.es:
En la foto podemos apreciar el arte y talento de la señora Martha quien es una confeccionista de 65 años de edad, soltera sin hijos que trabaja para generarse su propio sustento, es un negocio heredado por su señora madre quien la entreno y la capacito para realizar este tipo de acabados.
Como ella es sola no tiene muchas personas en quien apoyarse en momento difíciles, o cuando necesita préstamos para insumos.
Para Martha la necesidad de mantener su negocio es muy latente es lo único que tiene sin ello queda en la calle por eso se preocupa cunado pasa por estas situaciones tan complicadas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, pero son algo especiales y más delicadas, comprar herramientas de trabajo como agujas especiales e hilos para ese tipo de acabados.
texts.en:
In this photo we can appreciate the art and talent of Martha, the creator. Martha is 65 years old, single and has no children, so she works to support herself. She inherited this line of work from her mother who trained her in how to make of all these kinds of pieces.

As Martha lives alone she doesn’t have many people to turn to for support in difficult times or when she needs a loan for supplies. For Martha, the need to maintain her business is very strong, because without it she would be on the streets. This is why she worries when she goes through such difficult times.

Martha is applying for a loan to buy fabric which is quite special and very delicate. She will buy work tools such as special needles and thread for these type of pieces.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and special supplies to make her pieces which are very finely crafted and delicate

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza ganado de engorde, posee 10 años de experiencia y inicio su trajo con capital propia, almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y los comercializa durante todo el año en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  y así tener una mejor producción para un mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 39 years old and lives in his own home along with his five daughters. He cultivates corn and raises livestock for fattening. Rigoberto has 10 years of experience and started his work with his own capital. He stores his products in granaries, such as the one shown in the photograph. Rigoberto sells his products throughout the year in neighboring towns. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

Rigoberto is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies so that he can achieve better production and generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, pest controls, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza is a generous woman. She was born in 1985. She lives in a village and is married with three children. She is a businesswoman. Gulnoza is a brave, honest, hospitable, and responsible person. She is busy with planting agricultural products on land. She plants wheat, rice, different vegetables, and other agricultural products. Besides this, she keeps and feeds livestock. Every month she trades her goods in the animal market. She buys forage for the income of her plants. She is experienced and well-known for her activity. Her husband helps and supports her in this business. Gulnoza is asking for financial support to buy fertilizers and make payments on rented land. She hopes Kiva will support her financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and make payments on rented land

loans.name: Levie

texts.en: Levie is engaged in the wild duck raising business. She has been involved in this kind of business for one year. She is happily married and has three children. Levie also manages her rice farming business. She and her husband would like to increase their income so they can send their children to a higher level of education and get ahead of life. To realize their goals, Levie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP. Levie believes that someday she could be a better entrepreneur. She hopes to receive the said loan amount.

loans.use: to buy 100 pieces of coconut and cassava for her wild duck raising business

loans.name: Umida

texts.en: Umida is an active woman. She was born in 1995. She is living in a village with her parents. She successfully graduated secondary school and entered into medical college. She has a dream to be a nurse and be helpful for society. Her parents are workers and do not earn enough money to make payments for her education. Umida is hoping and asking for financial support from Kiva to pay for her college tuition fees. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Hanley

texts.en:
Hanley is 27 years old and single.  

Hanley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Hanley has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, bread, eggs, detergent soap, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Hanley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bertha Lucia

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 47 años de edad, ella desde el año 2007 inicio con su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal como lo son desodorantes, talcos, perfumes, cremas de manos, productos capilares, productos de cuidado facial, tratamientos entre otros.
Su negocio lo inicio como una alternativa económica para auxiliar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar pues no daba abasto para cubrir las deuda, el alimento.

La forma de trabajar de Bertha es tener sus productos en la sala de su casa, los tiene encima de los muebles no cuenta con una exhibición como una vitrina o estanterías.

Pensando en esta necesidad de exhibición de sus productos y de abastecer su negocio, Bertha quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina y surtido de los productos anteriormente descritos.

Este préstamo simbolizara un avanza en las intenciones de Bertha por tener un local de venta de productos de uso personal propio e independiente de su hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 47 year old woman who has been selling personal hygiene products since 2007. These include deodorants, powder, perfume, hand cream, hair products, facial care products and treatments, amongst others.

Bertha began this business as a financial alternative to help her husband cover the household bills since he wasn’t earning enough to cover their debts or the cost of food. As part of Bertha’s job, her products are on display in a room in her house above the furniture as she doesn’t have any other way to display them such as a glass cabinet or shelves.

Having considered the need to display her products and restock her business, Bertha would like to apply for a loan to purchase a glass cabinet and stock up on the aforementioned products.

This loan represents a step forward for Bertha’s plan to have a shop of her own where she can sell her personal hygiene products independently of her home.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of deodorants, perfume, powder, hair products and face cream

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en: A mother of five, Yom lives with her family in a rural area of the Preah Vihear province. Of her five children, three are still in school. Yom and her husband have been farming rice for more than twenty years. To make additional income, Yom and her husband work for others for a labor fee during their spare time from farming. With concerns about hygiene for their family, especially for her three dependent children, Yom formed a group of two to request loans from VisionFund. Her loan portion was spent on building a latrine for her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is a 48-year-old mother with three children. She had a small business sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. 

Lesina has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, and a tape measurement to help her with the business. 

She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future. Lesina became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1983. She is living in a remote district. She is divorced and has a daughter. She wants to start her own business. 

She is planning to trade big and small honored cattle. Shoira will keep and feed livestock and sell goods in the animal market in her area. Additionally she wants to gain milk and dairy products from livestock and sell these for additional income. 

Shoira needs to buy a milk cow to start her business. She requested a 4,000 TJS loan from Kiva to realize her plans. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelyn is 32 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jelyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Jelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alexi De Jesus

texts.es:
Alexi es un joven de 21 años de edad, residente de la zona de Caucasia, es una persona que busca crecer, ser alguien en la vida, educarse, proteger sus familiares, sacarlos adelante y siempre velar por su futuro.

En la zona donde reside el joven Alexi es una zona con mucha desigualdad social, son muy afectados por la pobreza, casi no hay oportunidades a jóvenes con ganas de ganarse la vida honradamente.

Alexi a través de un préstamo quiere iniciar un negocio el cual será ofertar servicios de barbería, el tomo clases y trabajo por un tiempo en un negocio.

Gracias a ese lapso de tiempo que trabajo Alexi pudo recoger algo de capital para construir en una parte de su casa un pqueño espacio donde quiere ubicar su barbería.

La solicitud del préstamo la quiere realizar para comprar los siguientes productos.
•	Puerta de vidrio
•	Sofá
•	Aire acondicionado ( es una zona muy calurosa) 
•	Espejos
•	Surtido de insumos como lo son (espuma, gel, shampoo, cuchillas,)
texts.en:
Alexi is a young man of 21 who lives in the area of Caucasia. He is a person who is looking to grow and be someone in life, to educate himself, protect and provide for his family and and always keep an eye on his future.

The area where Alexi lives is a region where there is a lot of social inequality. People are very affected by poverty and there are hardly any opportunities for young people to earn an honest living.

With this loan Alexi would like to start a business offering his services as a barber as he has taken classes and worked for a business for a while. Thanks to this period of work, Alexi was able to get together a bit of capital to build a small space in a section of his house where he would like to have his barber’s shop. 

Alexi would like to use this loan to buy the following products:

•	glass door
•	couch
•	air-conditioning (it is a very hot region) 
•	mirrors
•	an assortment of supplies (shaving cream, gel, shampoo, razor blades)

loans.use: to start his own business as a barber and buy a door, a couch, air-conditioning, mirrors and stock

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luz has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as fabric conditioner, shampoo, candies, detergent soap, coffee, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Maureen is 22 years old and is first of the three children in the family. Her mother, Nieves, is a member of NWTF; she supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Maureen is studying for a bachelor of science in elementary education, and is currently in the fourth of this four-year course.

Nieves is borrowing 17,330 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Maureen for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Maureen plans to find a stable job so she could help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en: A widowed mother of two, Sum is 53 years old and lives in Kulen district's Preah Vihear province. Sum supports her family by farming rice. She also helps others harvest cassava for a labor fee. Given financial constraints, Sum's family was not able to have a proper latrine. After hearing from VisionFund about social loans, Sum and another lady formed up a group to request loans to build latrines at their houses with the intention of improving sanitation for the family.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Tib's Group

texts.en:
Tib is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are under her support. The whole family is supported by rice farming, which is the main source of income. To generate more money, they work on other farms for a labor fee. 

Because of financial difficulty, the family was not able to have a proper latrine until they heard about a social loan from VisionFund. Tib led a group of three female members to request loans from VisionFund to build latrines in their houses.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 45-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons. Her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for past 16 years; her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Kousar's husband wants to purchase an animal for his business purposes but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Kousar has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her husband's business

loans.name: Hach's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of Mondulkiri province, Hach is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Hach and her husband support the family by growing cassava on their 6 hectare of land. 

With the hope to grow a better quality of cassava, Hach led a group of two members to request a loan from VisionFund. Hach spent her loan portion on fertilizer. 

She hopes to generate more profit so that she can get sufficient and nutritious food for her kids.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for cassava plantation

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte signed up for her membership with PMPC, and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Charlotte is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

In the future, she hopes to arrange a simple yet decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Predeswinda

texts.en:
Predeswinda is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Predeswinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, cooking oil, bath soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, etc. to sell.

Predeswinda has been in this business for 18 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, bath soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, cooking oil, bath soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Nora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella has a farm in Mahyag, Zambo del Sur. 

She joined PMPC to avail another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. 

Louella perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa earns well from her farming activities in Dumingag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has a higher cost of living since her children entered college. Josefa approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, bags of fertilizer and herbicides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, bags of fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 56-year-old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for six years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Zareena's husband wants to purchase cattle for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these animals. Therefore, Zareena has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also enable him to earn maximum profitable income from his business.

For this financial assistance, Zareena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Vivelyn

texts.en:
Vivelyn is 37 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are currently in school.

Vivelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vivelyn has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Vivelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Vivelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase grains from the Néré tree

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 53 years old and married with four children.  

Marieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Marieta has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nelyn is 37 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Nelyn has a hand-woven piña fiber business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy pineapple fiber to use for her business.

Nelyn has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piña fiber to use for her business

loans.name: Patricia Aracely

texts.es:
Patricia, tiene 30 años está viviendo de unión libre el marido tiene 38 años tienen 2 hijos con los cuales viven en el barrio cooperativa Imbabura lugar donde la gente se dedica al comercio y también al turismo por el sector hay una universidad que se llama universidad NORTE.
Patricia se dedica al comercio de comida rápida en el mercado la Playa de Ibarra esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace 1 año atrás tiene clientes que desde hace años trabaja con ella y les gusta el preparado que ella realiza normalmente ella elabora desayunos y también aparte de eso tiene su otro negocio de venta de plásticos, papel higiénicos, vasos y otros de donde tiene ingresos para todas las necesidades que vengan en el mes, con el crédito que está solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de productos para seguir incrementando más el negocio de las comidas y también del otro comercio de plásticos y así ayudar a sus hijos en todo lo que ellos necesiten.
Agradece a fundación alternativa por el apoyo que le brindan con el capital para seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
