Patricia is 30 years old and lives with her partner, 38 years old, and their two children. The family lives in the Imbabura area where the locals work as traders and in farming. There is a local university, called “Universidad Norte”.

Patricia makes a living selling fast food at the Playa de Ibarra market. She has been doing this work for one year and has many customers who like her food. Patricia normally prepares breakfasts. She also has a business where she sells plastic products, toilet paper, cups and other items. This provides an income to cover monthly spending.

Patricia will use this loan to expand her fast food and plastics business. She can then help her children by providing everything that they need.

Patricia is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support they are providing. This capital will allow Patricia’s business to expand.

loans.use: to buy products and give her children what they need.

loans.name: Nancy Susana

texts.es:
Nancy tiene  20 años, no tiene hijo es soltera vive en casa familiar en la comunidad de Camuendo que pertenece a la ciudad de Otavalo por el lugar que ella vive se dedican la mayoría de personas al comercio de artesanías las que ellos mismo fabrican y también realizan turismo como de la laguna de San Pablo.
Nancy tiene su taller donde viene realizando servicio de maquilado de prendas de vestir como calentadores, sacos y otras prendas más ella ya viene realizando esta actividad más de 5 años experiencia que aprendió por la familiar y también por el trabajo que hacia como obrera en un taller de confecciones, por la zona que ella vive no hay mucha competencia y es por eso que le va bien en su taller tiene clientes que llegan a pedir el servicio en su taller.
El crédito que está solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de una maquina recubridora para ofrecer más servicio y así seguir manteniendo a los mismos clientes y que no se vayan a otros lados para buscar el servicio que ella mismo puede brindar.
texts.en:
Nancy is 20 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives at home in the Camuendo community of Otavalo city, Ecuador. Here the majority of locals produce handicrafts to sell, and in tourism activities, including at San Pablo lake.

Nancy has a workshop where, for more than five years, she has produced clothing items, such as legwarmers, jackets and more. Nancy learned this trade from a relative and from working in another workshop. There is not much competition locally and so Nancy’s business is going very well. She has customers who make orders at her workshop.

Nancy is applying for a job in order to buy a coverstitch sewing machine and offer more services to customers. She can then hold on to her customers and prevent them using the services of other businesses as she will be able to offer the same services.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and has four children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Ana has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Tele

texts.en:
Tele is 57 years old with three children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Tele has requested for a loan to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. Tele joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase condiments

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.en:
Mizhgona is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1988. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has one child. Mizhgona is generous, kind, responsible, gentle and an active person. For about four years she has been busy with sewing traditional dresses for women and travelling rugs. 

After some period of time she got sick. She saved up money from her business and plans to have an operation in a medical clinic. The amount of money that is needed to pay for the operation is more than what she saved. 

Mizhgona requested financial support from KIVA for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To have an operation in a medical clinic

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea, 60 years old, lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and gifted with five children. Irenea's husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables and other agricultural commodities. 

Irenea has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious woman helps her husband to plow the rice field and to plant corn, vegetables and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Irenea decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. Irenea has been able to manage her income and provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain the needed working capital. 

She hopes to buy a rice land to cultivate someday for a potential added income for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
In 2013, Bonifacio learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. Bonifacio tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. 

Bonifacio borrowed another amount to pay for fertilizer and compost. This will give his farming income a big boost. Bonifacio looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Esa

texts.en:
Esa is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba. Esa is a farmer of vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers and seedlings. Esa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Esa hopes to harvest more vegetable crops.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Tuhtahon

texts.en:
Tuhtahon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1971. She is living in a remote district. She is married. She has four children. Tuhtahon is a bright, kind, gentle and responsible person. 

When she was a child, her family had a hard time after the civil war. They moved from place to place. They did not have clothes to wear or food for eating, but the government helped them to live. Somewhat to keep safe and feed the family, her parents kept livestock. She got experienced in how to keep livestock from her parents. 

She had a dream to have a milk cow and gain dairy products from it. Her dream came true, because her husband saved up money and bought a cow. Each year, she tried to enlarge the amount of her livestock. 

Her children are growing and their expenditures and needs are also growing. The family needs to renovate their house. Tuhtahon is asking for financial support from the Kiva project to renovate her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is from Carmona Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Monaliza works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Monaliza is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Monaliza is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment was deducted every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay her personal and household expenses.

Monaliza only dreams to have sufficiency in her daily and become able to help more her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay her personal and household expenses.

loans.name: Felisicima

texts.en:
Felisicima finds pleasure in doing her vegetable and flower gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 44 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Felisicima wishes to supply her products in the neighboring towns and provinces. This will give a chance to her family to improve their iving conditions.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has considerably prepared for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice) in Mahayag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took a loan. Lorna hopes to save more money for her wish to buy more rice land to cultivate for additional earnings.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Yorie

texts.en:
Ivy Jane is 24 years old and is the second of the seven children in the family. Her mother, Yorie, is a member of NWTF who supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Ivy Jane is studying for a Bachelor of Science in commerce and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Yorie is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Ivy Jane for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

Ivy Jane plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with four children.

Maribel earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Maribel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maribel has been farming coconuts for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store and from selling firewood.

Maribel is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman with one child. Raquel is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has one child who is in school.

Raquel has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like bags, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods like bags, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ailyn is 47 years old and her two children are in school.

Ailyn has a business farming bananas  in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan  through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ailyn has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fredaliza

texts.en:
Fredaliza works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Fredaliza requested an 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear products like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear products like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Aine

texts.en:
Aine is 30 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Aine works very hard to provide for them.

Aine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, etc., to sell.

Aine has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Aine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is a married women with children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish net and other materials for her fishing business.

Janet has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from seafood vending.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Erika Vanesaa

texts.es:
Erika tiene tiene 36, tiene 2 hijos vive en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Ibarra por el sector de los ceibos, por el sector donde ella vive la mayoría de personas se dedican al comercio de prendas de vestir y también se dedican al turismo como es la laguna de yahuarcocha, las personas son hospitalarias, amables respetuosos.
Erika se dedica al bordado de prendas de vestir desde hace 10 años atrás la cual ha venido demostrando su responsabilidad en sus obras que ella realiza tiene clientes a los cuales entrega los productos que ella realiza, tiene clientes que frecuentan comprar en cantidades grandes los productos que ofrece y es por eso que Erika solicita el crédito para comprar materiales compra de lana para incrementar más producción y ofrecer más productos y seguir manteniendo a los clientes y así ofrecer lo mejor para su familia dar educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro sea unas personas de bien y que sigan educándose día a día.
Agradece a fundación alternativa por el apoyo que le dan con el capital para seguir creciendo con su negocio y seguir brindando más productos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Erika is 36 years old and has two children.  They live in a rental house in the city of Ibarra, in the Los Ceibos sector.  In the sector where she lives, most people make a living through selling clothing and through tourism due to the Yahuarcocha lagoon.  The people are hospitable, friendly, and respectful.

Erika has made a living by embroidering clothing for ten years, during which she has come to demonstrate the responsibility she has for her work.  She has customers to whom she delivers her products, and customers who often visit and buy her products in large quantities.  It is for this reason that Erika asks for a loan to buy materials like wool in order to increase her production, offer more products, and continue maintaining her customers.  Thus she will be able to provide the best for her family, and to give her children an education so that in the future they become good people and continue educating themselves day by day.  

She is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa for the support they give her with the capital to continue growing her business and offering more products in the market.

loans.use: to buy more material, increase production, and give her children an education.

loans.name: Zaib Un Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib Un Nisa is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Zaib Un Nisa provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Zaib Un Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aukatangni Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es mixto está conformado por un hombre y 4 mujeres emprendedoras (SARMIENTO, AIDA ADELIA, ALBA MARINA, ENEMERIA y LUCHA), todos viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se organizó recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Escogieron el nombre de AUKATAGNI, es en vocablo miskito que significa Flor de Bejuco. El término bejuco, de origen caribe, hace referencia a las plantas de guía de la región.

Sarmiento: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, tiene 45 años de edad, casado con dos hijas que estudian su secundaria. Su esposa se encuentra desempleada. Debido a la falta de empleo, desde hace 3 años estableció una pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, de esta manera apoya con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijas. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, granos básicos, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. El sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa usada.
texts.en:
This mixed solidarity group is formed of one male and four female entrepreneurs (Sarmiento, Aida Adelia, Alba Marina, Enemeria y Lucha). They all live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. It is a new group that was organized recently with the purpose of working in solidarity to access loans in Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, increase their incomes and improve the quality of life for their families. They chose the name Aukatagni, which is a Miskito work that means Flower of Bejuco, of Caribbean origin, which refers to plants as the guide of the region.

Sarmiento is the coordinator of this solidarity group. He is 45 years old and is married with two daughters who study in secondary school. His wife is unemployed. Due to the lack of jobs, he established a general store three years ago in the hallway of his wooden house, and in this way he supports the household expenses and the studies of his daughters. He asks for his first financing to buy snacks, basic grains, and toilet paper, among other products. His dream is to establish a used clothing store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, and toilet paper, among other products.

loans.name: Ofisa

texts.en:
Ofisa is 41 years old with 4 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Ofisa has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. Ofisa joined SPBD in 2011 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Sonia Luz

texts.es: Sonia de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, la actividad la realiza junto con su esposo, ya tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo y tiene muchos clientes, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas chatarra como: hierro, aluminio, cobre, bronce, latas, etc.  y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 49-year-old Sonia lives with her family in their own home. She works with her husband, buying and selling scrap metal. She has been doing this for more than 4 years and has many customers. She sells her products in nearby towns and, with what she earns, she manages to support herself. She is seeking a loan to buy more scrap metal such as: iron, aluminium, copper, bronze, tins, etc. as this will enable her to boost her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminium, copper, bronze, tins, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita has managed her variety store for more than 15 years. With her hard work and friendly relationship with her customers, she was able to improve her sales and living conditions. Her previous financial assistance has been a big contribution in the increase of her sales.

Julita would like to have continuous growth of her variety store and that's the reason why she's asking for a loan of PHP 35,000.She will use this loan in buying large amounts of grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and candies. Julita would be thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and candies for her store

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.en:
Hayriniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1960. She is living in a remote district. She is married and she has four children. Hayriniso is an active, responsible, generous and kind person. She is a businesswoman who plants agricultural produce.

Now she is planting cotton. She trades cotton as a raw material, sometimes sells after processing to cotton cleaning fabrics as fiber. She is planning to buy crops of cotton and fertilizers for keeping to save her plants. Hayriniso needs financial support to buy crops and fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy crops and fertilizers

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 65 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is separated and raised her children bravely. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. 

This industrious member finds herself planting cacao, because of the demand. In need of additional working capital, Marjorie joined Paglaum Cooperative. She recently requested a loan for 96,000 PHP, which she will use to pay labor for the holing for her cacao plantation. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay labor for the holing of her cacao plantation

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year old Elsa is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. Her oldest child is 11, while the youngest is 4. She earns a living by means of fishing. She catches and sells fish. It has been almost nine years that she has been engaged in fishing.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floaters, nylon, weights and rope. These will help Elsa and her family improve their ongoing catch. She will be selling more fish and will improve her income. In this way, she will be able to balance her finances and afford to buy a nutritious diet.

She will exert extra effort to improve her current livelihood to become more sustainable and productive.

Elsa hopes that she would be able to send all her children to school for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, floaters, nylon, weights and rope

loans.name: Elbie

texts.en:
Elbie is 38 years old and has three children. Elbie is married, and her three children are still in school.

Elbie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Elbie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elbie has been in her business for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mariza is 49 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Mariza has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mariza requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Mariza has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.en:
Maria Vilma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Vilma is 43 years old, and five of her children are still in school.

Maria Vilma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Maria Vilma requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall.

Maria Vilma has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from food vending. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia  is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florencia is 66 years old now.

Florencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies to use for her business.

Florencia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies to use for her business

loans.name: Glendaly

texts.en:
Glendaly is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Glendaly is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Glendaly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies to use in her business.

Glendaly has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elnora requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Elnora has been in this business for 2 years now.

Elnora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines.

Eleuteria requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen products to sell.  She has been in this business for 5 years now. Eleuteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, Micro finance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Joseph, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest father who is 66 years of age. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is the proud father of four lovely children. He loves and treasures his children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Joseph's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures he has been able to earn a decent income. He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 40 years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming. 

Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". He faces financial challenges, and because the Nkubu area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve his income. Joseph' upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements, and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Joseph has received training and he has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business. Joseph is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and  turn his life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 42 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Julieta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Julieta requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a fish cart, net and other materials needed for her business.

Julieta has been in this business for one year. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish cart, net and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 40 years old and single with one child. She has a pig-fattening business. She earns a living in the Philippines. 

Cherry Mae is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional piglets, sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherry Mae has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilane

texts.en:
Lilane is 42 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Lilane works very hard to provide for them.

Lilane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, eggs, and other groceries.

Lilane has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like condiments, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita is 50 years old and married with one child. Ma. Teresita works very hard to provide for the family.

Ma. Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Ma. Teresita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y gaseosas, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir un cuarto que muestra en la fotografía ero como no tiene de suficiente capital  solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, arena, cemento, ladrillos, polines, puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman who has her face pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. She makes a living selling fries and soda. She has more than 5 years working at this activity. With the money she makes in sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

She lives in her own house with her husband and son. She wants to improve their home by constructing a room in the area shown in the picture but she does not have sufficient capital.

She is asking for a loan to buy sheets, sand, cement, bricks, poles, doors, security bars, and pay for labor and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets, sand, cement, bricks, poles, doors, security bars, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Pierre Manuel

texts.es:
Pierre tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de San Miguel que se encuentra ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pierre is 23 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house in a rural part of the district of San Miguel which is located in the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle.

He raises and sells small animals like pigs, ducks, turkeys, chickens amongst others. His business is located at his house. He has been doing this business for 3 years and has regular clients who can provide him with very good personal and work reference. He is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals like pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, chickens amongst others to increase the stock of his business. The loan will help him have a larger investmen, with the goal of expanding his business and satisfying the needs of his clients. This will generate more income that will improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals like pigs, guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, amongst others to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Manuel Cristobal

texts.es:
Manuel Cristóbal tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de lima, tiene aproximadamente 02 ha de finca frutera que lo ofrece en los diversos mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en este sector y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel Cristóbal is 53 years old. He lives with his children in the San Felipe district. Locals grow and sell fruits or raise animals. This district is located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.

Manuel grows lime. He owns approximately 2 hectares of land where he grows fruits. He sells them at the markets of the city of Chiclayo. He has been doing this for thirteen years and has a fixed customer base that can give good personal and professional references of him.

Manuel has requested a loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations, in order to be able to offer a better product to his customers. This will result in a higher income, and the improvement of his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lime plantations.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia es madre de familia de 32 años de edad es casada, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos, ella para generar sus ingresos desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ceviche en una plaza de su comunidad, gracias a Dios esta actividad es bastante rentable para ella, porque con los ingresos que genera ha logrado mantener a su familia, para Lidia la comodidad de su familia es lo más importante es por ello que ha visto la necesidad de terminar de construir su casa, pero para ello necesita de un préstamo que lo utiliza para comprar, laminas, puertas, balcones para las ventanas. El sueño más grande de Lidia es poder terminar de construir la casa, y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en: 32-year-old Lidia lives in the town of Sololá and is married with 3 lovely children. She has earned her living for the past 2 years by selling ceviche (a seafood dish) in a square in her town. She thanks God for the fact that her business is quite profitable for her, because her earnings allow her to support her family. For Lidia, her family's comfort is the most important thing and that is why she needs to finish building her house. However, to do this she needs a loan to buy sheeting, doors and balconies for the windows. Lidia's dearest wish is to be able to finish building her house and to be able to continue supporting her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, doors and balconies for the windows to finish building her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, lime powder, sand, cement blocks, and iron.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julia is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Julia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Julia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fish nets, etc. to use in her business.

Julia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fish nets, etc. to use in her business

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Agusta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, water and eggs. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agusta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, water and eggs

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 51-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches, toast sandwiches, drinks (soda), and noodles in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Telesia has requested a loan to buy a carton of soda (drinks), a box of noodles, plastic cups, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise to assist her with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. Telesia became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a carton of soda (drinks), a box of noodles, plastic cups, tomato sauce, a box of fish (canned tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en:
Lemau is a 32-year-old mother with three children.  She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Lemau has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, containers, and a freezer to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. Lemau became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, containers, and a freezer

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en:
Safargul is a businesswoman. She was born in 1971. She is living in a remote district. She is divorced and has four children. She is working at an energy station. Safargul is a responsible, hardworking, mannered, and kind person.

She wants to renovate her apartment and buy construction materials for renovation. She earns enough money to make payments on time. Safargul is asking for financial support from Kiva to renovate her apartment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su tía y abuela, es una familia unidad que vive en una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales y se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en este negocio y sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Wilfredo espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 25 years old and lives in a house with his aunt and grandmother. His family is close-knit, and they live in a community in which farming, keeping livestock and raising animals are the main industries. They live in an area found in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú. 

Wilfredo makes a living raising and selling young animals, such as pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys. He has more than 3 years experience in this business and his neighbours give him very good personal and working references. Additionally, he earns money providing transport to passengers in a moto-taxi. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals, such as pigs, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, as well as balanced feed in order to fatten the animals. Wilfredo hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals, such as pigs, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, and balanced feed in order to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Pascual Oswaldo

texts.es:
Pascual tiene 40 años, es padre soltero, vive en casa familiar con su madre e hija, su familia es unida y viven en una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de construcción por su zona de residencia y alrededores, se dedica a este sector desde hace 15 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo será para la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio, con esto Pascual espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar sus ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pascual is 40 years old. He is a single father who lives in his own house with his mother and son. His family is close-knit and lives in a community that works in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

He works providing construction services in his area of residence and it's surroundings. He has worked in this sector for 15 years and has good personal and work references from his neighbors. The loan will be used to buy tools to set up his business. Doing this Pascual hopes to offer better services to his clients which will allow him better income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools to set up his business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyes y gallinas, realiza esta actividad hace mas 2 años y cuenta con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría, con esto Delia espera mejorar su negocio y incrementar sus ingresos lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her son in the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this area work in agriculture and raising animals.

She works raising and selling animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and has good references in her area. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as to make repairs and do maintenance on the place where she raises them. Doing this Delia hopes to improve her business and increase her income which will allow her to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as making repairs and doing maintenance on the place where she keeps them.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rose Marie is 49 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Rose Marie has a buy and sell sand gravel business in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell, and to pay laborers salaries.

She has been in this business for three years. 

Rose Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tons of sand and gravel and payment for laborers salaries

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ana Mae is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Mae has been in pig fattening for 12 years, and also earns additional income from house rental.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is married and has one child who does not attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

For the past two years she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Arcelena

texts.en:
Arcelena is 50 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Arcelena runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Arcelena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines.

Claudia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional beauty products like lotions, perfume, cosmetics, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Claudia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products like lotions, perfume, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Agusta to improve her business. Agusta opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as sugar, coffee, and salt. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Agusta is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and salt.

loans.name: Godua

texts.fr: Godua vit à Adakpamé et âgée de 56 ans, elle est une femme mariée avec quatre personnes à charge. Godua entreprend une activité de vente des nattes traditionnelles. Godua expose ses nattes dans le quartier et au marché et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Godua s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Attikpodji. Pour commander de nouvelles tas nattes, Godua demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Godua lives in Adakpamé and is 56. She is a married woman responsible for four persons. Godua has a business selling traditional woven mats. She displays her mats in the neighborhood and at the market and manages to sell them thanks to her resourcefulness. 

Godua buys her supplies once a month at the market of Attikpodji. To order some new piles of mats, Godua is asking for this loan so she can complete her purchase and make the necessary profit to be able to help her husband cover their family's various expenses.

loans.use: to buy six piles of woven mats

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Femme entreprenante et courageuse, Akossiwa vit avec ses quatre enfants à Adakpamé. Bien qu’elle soit divorcée, Akossiwa ne laisse pas ses enfants dans la misère et travaille ardemment pour leur permettre une bonne éducation. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Akossiwa est une restauratrice qui vend de la pate emballée accompagnée de poissons frits. Akossiwa achète ses matières une fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des poissons. Le bénéfice lui permettra d’améliorer son environnement de vente et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: An enterprising and courageous woman, Akossiwa lives with her four children in Adakpamé. Although divorced, Akossiwa does not leave her children in poverty and works ardently to allow them a good education.  To reach her ends, Akossiwa is a restaurant owner who sells packaged pasta accompanied by fried fish. Akossiwa buys her materials one time per month at the market. She asks for this credit to order some bags of corn and some fish. The profit will allow her to improve her sales environment and to support her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of corn and 100 fish

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a 37-year-old mother with four children. For the past five years, she has operated a small business cutting grass to earn a living. Donna has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

Donna is requesting a loan to buy a lawn mowing machine, chemicals, safety boots, and a safety uniform to help her run her business. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower, chemicals, and safety equipment

loans.name: Faagase

texts.en: Faagase is a 47-year-old mother of four children. She conducts a small business sewing and selling clothes in her community to earn a living. Faagase has applied for a loan to buy fabrics, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure to help her with her business. She has been engaged in this business for more than a year. She will use her profits to expand her business in the near future. Faagase became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking mother of three and a very supportive partner to her husband Romeo. She is from Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Alma works as a garment manufacturing supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Alma is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Alma is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in repaying, since the loan payment is being deducted every payday.

She looks forward to your positive response; any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for educational expenses of her child who is graduating from college.

Alma dreams to become successful and hopes for her children to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the educational expenses of her child who is graduating from college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lengths of pagnes and clothing items

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura hace 5 años, siembra papa y oca como los principales productos en parte de su terreno  con una extensión de 3 hectáreas en el mismo lugar que fue herencia de parte de sus padres. Produce con rotación de cultivos tales como avena y cebada para consumo de su ganado vacuno, también cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno(2 vacas-yuntas, 1 lechera y 1 toro). La señora requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 1.5 camiones, productos agroquímicos y herramientas agrícolas para su actividad con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marlene lives and works in Colomi. Economically she is independent, a hard-worker and responsible. She has worked in agriculture for 5 years, growing potatoes and oca (a root vegetable) as her principal products. She grows on a 3 hectare plot of land that was an inheritance from her parents. She rotates her production with crops like oats and barley to feed her cattle. She also has 4 cattle (2 oxen, a milk cow and a bull) This woman needs a loan to buy one and a half truck loads of (chicken )organic fertilizer, agrochemical products and agricultural tools for her business with the goal of improving living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, agrochemical products and agricultural tools for her business with the goal of improving living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Ma. Verna

texts.en:
Ma. Verna is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, detergent, beer, soft drinks, and other products. Ma. Verna works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Verna is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Remera

texts.en:
Remera is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remera is 58 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Remera has a personal collection products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more personal collection products to sell to her customers.

Remera has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of personal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past six years, she has raised pigs in the Philippines. Benita has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Benita is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She farms corn in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Edelyn is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nenafe

texts.en:
Nenafe is a widow who works hard to support her family. For the past eight years, she has operated a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Nenafe is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products such as towels, shirts, t-shirts, and other items. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Noneluna

texts.en: Noneluna is a married woman, 61 years old, who has seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Noneluna has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Noneluna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 54 years old, married, and has four children. Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Nelly has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for ten years, and she also earns an income from selling electronic mobile loads.  Nelly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Caryl

texts.en: Caryl is a 32-year-old with two children in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Caryl runs a general store in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, including beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries. Caryl has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Caryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, including beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Edgita

texts.en:
Edgita is 49 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operate a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns additional income from selling rice.

Edgita requested her ninth loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, rice, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell. Edgita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, rice, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 40 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Karen operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Karen requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more snack foods, diapers, sanitary pads, eggs, beers, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell. In the future, Karen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, diapers, sanitary pads, eggs, beers, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has two children both of whom attend school. For the past two years, she has owned a food stall for her neighbors and town dwellers. Mariam lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her major business challenge is the fluctuation in customer numbers which results in the loss of perishable goods. 

Mariam is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase a stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Jaqueline Gabriela

texts.es:
Jaqueline tiene 20 años, está viviendo de unión libre, el esposo tiene 23 años, tiene un hijo, viven en casa familiar en el sector de El coco que pertenece a Atuntaqui por el sector que ella vive la gente se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y producción de muebles lugar que la mayoría de personas van a visitar por comprar muebles que son hechos por las personas de la zona y también ofrecen platos típicos como las fritadas con tostado.
Jaqueline tiene pequeño criadero de chanchos de donde tiene ingresos para todas las necesidades que viene en el mes y también el marido trabaja como empleado en la Parroquia de Natabuela en fábrica de bloques ellos trabajan muy duro para brindar un bienestar bueno para el hijo y para la familia en el transcurso de lo que están viviendo juntos ha habido problemas que los dos han enfrentado.
El crédito que está solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de más chanchos  y alimentos para los mismos Jaqueline quiere mejorar el comercio que mantiene desde hace años atrás comprando más animales para comercializar y tener mayor ingresos para el hogar y todo los gastos que viene en el mes.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, 20 years old, lives in a common law marriage with her partner who's 23. They have a son, and live in a family home in the zone of El Coco, in Atuntaqui. 

The local people earn a living in agriculture, livestock farming, and furniture making. Most of the visitors to the area go shopping for furniture, made by local artisans, and they also enjoy traditional food such as “fritadas con tostado” [a dish of pork with toasted corn].

Jaqueline has a few pigs that she raises. This brings her some income to meet monthly expenses. Her partner is employed by the Natabuela Parish and he works making bricks. They are working very hard to provide for their son and themselves. In the course of their life together, there have been problems they had to face.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and the feed to raise them. She want to improve on the commerce she's kept going from years back, buying more animals so she can sell more and get more income for her home and all monthly expenses.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed to raise them, so that she can get more income for her home.

loans.name: Alba Merarda

texts.es: Alba Merarda, mayor de edad soltera con seis hijos los cuales todos son independientes originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de sus propios negocios los cuales consisten en la compra  venta de ropa nueva y usada el cual lo realiza ambulante y también en su casa de habitación, el cual se caracteriza como una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable también con muchos deseos de superación personal tiene clientes tanto al crédito como al contado que recupera  quincenal o mensualmente, inicio este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar  los ingresos en su hogar, al verse sola y madre soltera tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado  durante once años  en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio  desde muy temprano ella se levanta a abrir su venta para empezar a vender y poder sacar adelante a  su familia .Alba es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable con todos sus compromisos adquiridos, ha venido poco a poco mejorando su negocio, No es primer crédito con león 2000   el objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como; zapatos, ropa interior, cosmeticos, productos plasticos entre otros etc. Alba se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Alba Merarda is an older single woman with six adult children.  She's from Chinandega, in the western part of the country.  She's a micro-entrepreneur who owns and runs her own businesses buying and selling new and used clothing.  She works as a street vendor as well as in her home.  Alba's known to be a very hardworking and responsible woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  She has credit and cash customers, and she collects her bills every two weeks or monthly.

She started this business with her own funds because she needed to work and wanted to improve her household income.  Seeing herself alone and a single mother, she made the commitment to get ahead with the same effort and constant work she has done for 11 years, in which she has shown her responsibility in making her payments.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a great business.  She gets up very early to open her store and begin making sales so she can get her family ahead.  Alba's enterprising, hardworking, and responsible with all the commitments she takes on.  She has been improving her business little by little.

This is not her first loan with León 2000.  The goal of this loan is to be able to buy more merchandise, including shoes, underwear, cosmetics, and plastic products.

Alba's very grateful for the financial help Kiva gives to the neediest people.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as shoes and different styles of new and used clothing

loans.name: Steve Jhonny

texts.es:
Steve tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con sus hijos en una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros, desde hace más de 5 años Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de camote, arroz, entre otros productos. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Steve espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y sus preferencias lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Steve is 29 years old and lives with his children in a village where most people work in farming or animal husbandry and trade. Said village is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. 
Steve has been selling small farm animals such as hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others for over five years. He is very experienced and has a loyal customer base who thinks very highly of him on both a personal and professional level. Steve also grows sweet potato, rice, and other crops. The loan will be used to buy more animals as well as balanced fattening feed.  Steve's goal is to have a greater diversity of animals on offer to suit customers' tastes.  He hopes thus to increase his income and enjoy a better standard of living together with his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as balanced fattening feed.

loans.name: Gerson Benjamin

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 19 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con sus hijos en una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, desde hace más de 2 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola en los diferentes cultivos de su distrito y zonas cercanas. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Gerson espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y por ende obtener mayores ingresos que le van a permitir tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerson is 19 and lives with his children in a peaceful village whose inhabitants are farmers, cattle-rearers, and traders, and which is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. 
Gerson has been selling small farm animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys for over two years. He has a loyal customer base who thinks very highly of him on both a personal and professional level. He also works as a farm hand for farmers in his district and in neighbouring areas. The loan will be used to buy more animals as well as balanced fattening feed. Gerson thus hopes to increase his business's productivity and increase his income in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as balanced fattening feed.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con sus hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es un distrito mediano cuyas actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales de corral como son cuyes, patos, gallinas, esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 05 años, contando con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Manuel cuenta con casa propia en la cual tiene un corral amplio para criar a sus animales, además se dedica a brindar servicio de peón agrícola en diferentes cultivos de su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones al lugar donde los cría, de esta manera el espera poder adquirir mayores ingresos para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 44, has a common-law wife, and lives together with her and their children in the district of Pucará, Jaén Province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountain ranges of Peru. The district is of medium size and its inhabitants are mainly traders and farmers.
Manuel has been raising and selling backyard animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and hens for over five years. He is very experienced and his neighbours think highly of him.
Manuel has a house of his own with a big pen where to raise the animals. He also works as a farm hand for farmers in his district. He will use the loan to buy more animals as well as to repair the pen. He thus hopes to increase his income in order to improve his standard of living and that of his family's.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as to repair their pen.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia de 28 años de edad con 3 hijos dependientes, está casada hace más de 5 años con el señor Orlando, vive en una zona rural del departamento Cochabamba. La señora y su esposo son jóvenes trabajadores, humildes y responsables de escasos recursos, cuentan  con la actividad de producción agrícola con ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de papa, papaliza, haba y oca cultivando en terreno herencia de sus padres, de esta forma ellos se mantienen y buscan mejorar económicamente, últimamente tuvieron gastos fuertes en compra de material escolar para sus hijos que están estudiando y sus cultivos todavía no están como para cosechar, por este motivo la señora solicita un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) así podrá aprovechar el precio bajo por la época y lograra mejorar su producción agrícola para tener más ingresos y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celia is a 28 year old woman with three dependent children. She has been married to Orlando for over 5 years. She lives in a rural area of Cochabamba. She and her husband are hardworking, humble, and responsible, but have scarce resources. They count on income from agricultural production and the seasonal sale of potatoes, papaliza, and oca (local vegetables) that they cultivate on land inherited from their parents. In this way they can sustain themselves and look to improve economically. 

Lately they have had to spend heavily on school supply purchases for their children who are studying and the crops are not yet ready for harvest. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase organic fertilizer so she can take advantage of the lower price at this time and improve agricultural production. This will enable her to have a better income and pay for her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and improve agricultural production, enabling her to increase income and pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en la provincia de San Miguel que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de cuyes, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes.
