Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cuyes para incrementar su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría, con esto Ivan espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le van a permitir tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ivan, 31 and single, lives with his family in the province of San Miguel, Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountain ranges of Peru. Life in the province is a peaceful affair and the inhabitants mainly raise animals for sale. 
Ivan buys and sells guinea pigs.  He has tools of his own as well as over two years' experience in the trade. His customers consider him an honest person and a reliable trading partner. He asks for a loan to buy more guinea pigs in order to take his business to the next level. He also wants to perform repairs in the pen where he raises the guinea pigs, his goal being to have a better product to sell so as to increase his income and enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and repair their pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale to his neighbors and in the local market.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 36 years old and married with one child in school. Cecil works very hard to provide for them.

Cecil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

Cecil has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Cecil would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marvin is 33 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Marvin has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marvin has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en:
Lelibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Lelibeth requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear products such as pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

Lelibeth has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear products such as pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Keto

texts.en:
Keto, who is a 59-year-old woman, lives in a small village, Odishi. She has three sisters and a brother, and Keto is the only breadwinner in the family.

In spite of her high education, Keto was unable to start any stable job, so she had started trading in food products. She sells purchased products locally with price mark-ups and generates approximately 400 GEL. Her project is profitable, but it needs support for further development.

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Keto decided to expand her business and requested a loan in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of USD 450 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase all equipment and open a restaurant. She will serve local people and will get the chance to increase productivity.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Jose Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales menores como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, brinda servicio de jornalería y cuenta con herramientas propias con las que realiza esta actividad, tiene 8 años de experiencia en este negocio y muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para brindar mantenimiento a sus herramientas de trabajo así como para la compra de nuevas herramientas, con esto Jose Carlos espera implementar su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Carlos, 22, is single and lives at his family's in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The people there mainly are farmers or raise and sell small animals for a living.
José Carlos is a day labourer. He has his own tools which he uses to farm for others. He has eight years' experience in this trade and people think very highly of him on both a personal and professional level. He will use the loan to perform maintenance on the tools he uses to work as well as to buy new ones. José Carlos thus hopes to strengthen his business and to provide a better service. He hopes for a better income so as to improve his standard of living as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the tools he uses to work as well as to buy new ones.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 22 años de edad, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario, los escasos recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir estudiando, es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo dependiente al que apoya en su educación y alimentación, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven actualmente tiene su propia vivienda que se compró con mucho esfuerzo, ahí vive con su hijo, también tiene su lote agrícola de 3 has. que su padre le vendió para que pueda salir adelante, hace 2 años comenzó a trabajar independientemente desde que el papa de su hijo le abandono, empezó a cultivar palmito, yuca y arroz con la ayuda de sus padres, en la actualidad solicita un crédito para ampliar su plantación de palmito y a si mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 22 years old. She was educated until the primary level, but the scarce resources of her parents would not support her to continue studying. She is a single mother with one dependent son who she supports with education and food. She started working at a very young age and currently has her own home that she bought with much effort. She lives there with her son, and also has a 3 hectare agricultural lot. Like her father who worked so that he could get ahead, she started working independently 2 years ago when her son's father abandoned them. She started to cultivate palm hearts, cassava, and rice with the help of her parents.

She is currently requesting a loan to expand her palm heart plantation, thereby improving the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to expand her heart of palm plantation, thereby improving the standard of living for her family.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda has mastered skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe, and she is known of her homemade sweet bread. She sells her breads around her barangay (district) and to schools.This has kept her business going for more than five years. Emelda requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar and margarine for bread production. Emelda hopes to expand her business by displaying in more store outlets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and margarine for bread production

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutter, clippers, etc. for her manicure/pedicure service business.

Melecia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from selling used clothing.

Melecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutter, clippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 53 года, замужем, есть 14 летний сын. У Дамиры средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На 3,0 Га арендованной земельной доли Дамира с супругом выращивают ячмень. В хозяйстве также есть 2 коровы, 8 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). Дамира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации.  Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие деятельности и покупку корма для скота.
texts.en: Damira is 53, married, and has a 14-year-old son. She has a specialized secondary education and her main source of income comes from farming. Damira and her husband rent a 3.0 hectare plot of land where they plant barley. They also have two cows and eight sheep. They earn up to 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Damira applied for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy four young bulls to fatten and sell. Damira plans to use the profits to invest in expanding her business and to purchase livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: Fasogneta Group

texts.fr:
Toumani tient le mouton en main sur la photo au bout.
Toumani est un malien âgé de37 ans marié, père de 6 enfants âgés de 14 à 5 ans tous non scolarisés. N’ayant pas été à l’école Toumani et son épouse sont agriculteur, de surcroit Toumani fait l’embouche ovins et le commerce d’animaux pendant la saison sèche il y’a environ 5 ans de cela .Toumani rêve de son activité de pouvoir préparer un meilleur  avenir pour ses enfants. L’achat des animaux pour l’embouche et parfois le commerce simple est effectué au marché local, la vente aussi y est effectué. En ce moment où la pluie n’est plus abondante ce qui joue sur les récoltes, le prêt RMCR permet à toumani d’acheter plus de moutons pour l’embouche, les bénéfices de la vente lui permet de subvenir en complément sur les récoltes aux besoins de la famille.Toumani aime l’embouche car ceci l’aide dans la fabrication de fosse de compost pour ses champs.
texts.en:
Toumani holds the sheep in his hand in the photo at the end. 

Toumani is a Malian, 37 years old, married, and the father of 6 children from ages 5 to 14, all unschooled. Not having been to school, Toumani and his wife are farmers. Moreover, Toumani has been fattening sheep and trading animals during the dry season for about 5 years. Toumani’s dream for his business is that it can create a better future for his children.  

The purchase of animals to fatten and sometimes simple business is carried out at the local market. The sale is also carried out there. At the moment when the rain is more abundant, which plays to the crops, the RMCR loan permits Toumani to buy more sheep to fatten. The profits of the sale, in addition to the crops, permit him to support his family. Toumani likes fattening sheep because this helps with the production of compost pits for his fields.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten and then sell them

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 39-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish canned tuna, plastic bags, a container, butter, mayonnaise, and vegetables(cabbage, tomatoes) to assist with the business. 

She will expand her business using her profit. Maria became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of fish canned tuna, plastic bags, a container, butter, mayonnaise, and vegetables (cabbage, tomatoes)

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a widow with three grown-up children. She has had a variety store for more than 15 years.Thelma also cultivates her rice field as an additional source of income. In addition to farming and the variety store, she also offers native cakes.Though she's living alone, she still aims for a better way of living and obtaining a better income.

Thelma would like to take out a loan of PHP9,000, allowing her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, noodles, candies, canned goods and cooking oil.

She knows because she offers complete basic needs within her village, she could be able to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Soteria

texts.en:
Soteria is 22 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Soteria has requested a loan to buy  banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. Soteria joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old, married to a farmer, and, unfortunately, they don't have any children. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. 

Due to insufficient capital on her business, Lourdes would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase biscuits, bread, beverages, chips, candies, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, and food seasonings to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, beverages, chips, candies, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, and food seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 26-year-old mother with three children. To earn a living, she runs a small business, selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Josephine has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise to assist her with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. 

Josephine became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn, 32 years old, is married with two children. She is a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For more than 10 years, Analyn has been selling vegetables as her primary source of income. Analyn decided to apply for a loan through Kiva's partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Lolita sells a variety of flowers to earn a living and has had this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more fertilizer and compost for her flowers that she will sell. 

Lolita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Margara

texts.es: La señora Margara es originaria de Potosí migro hacia el trópico con la finalidad de buscar un mejor futuro, en la actualidad vive en Entre Ríos, en una casa en alquiler ya que aún no tiene vivienda propia, los bajos ingresos económicos de sus padres no permitieron que ella pudiera acceder a una formación escolar por ello desde pequeña trabajo mucho, con sus ahorros adquirió su propio lote agrícola el cual le permitió progresar ya que todo los ingresos generados fueron para su beneficio, ahora solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento y ampliación de su cultivo para mejorar sus ingresos y a futuro comprarse su propio lote urbano y construir su vivienda donde podrá vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Margara is  a native of Potosi who migrated to warmer climes in search of a better future. At present, she lives in Entre Rios in a rented house since she still lacks her own house. Her parents' low income  prevented Margara from gaining a basic education. For that reason, since she was little, Margara has worked hard. With her savings, she acquired her own agricultural lot which has allowed her to progress, and all the income she now generates is for her own benefit.

Margara is applying for a loan to maintain and expand her crops in order to improve her income and, in the future, she hopes to purchase her own urban lot and construct a house where she can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to maintain and expand her crop land to improve her income and, in the future, to purchase her own urban lot and construct a home where she can live more comfortably.

loans.name: Donnabel

texts.en: Donnabel is 32 years old and married with one child in school. Donnabel works very hard to provide for her family. For two years, Donnabel has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 9000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell in her general store such as party accessories and groceries. In the future, Donnabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 50 years old and has eight children. She is married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Elenita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 43 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Vilma has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Jehane

texts.en:
Jehane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen products business in the Philippines.

Jehane requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more frozen products, like hot dogs, sausages, and other frozen products.

Jehane has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen products, like hot dogs, sausages, and other frozen products.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elvira has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy garments and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 29 years old and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Felisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is 32 years old and single with one child.

Jessel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, noodles, juice, soft drinks, soap, canned goods, etc.

Jessel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jessel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, noodles, juice, soft drinks, soap, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernadette is 33 years old.

Bernadette has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, and other supplies for her business.

Bernadette has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Bernadette would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emma has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en:
Lelibeth works hard to support her family. She is a married woman with two children, and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Lelibeth requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman, but has no children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense is food.

Linet has been operating a business of a nursery school for the past year, offering education to young children in the neighborhood. She  faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chairs for her nursery school.

She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her nursery school.

loans.name: Aleta

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Aleta to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own $100.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like rice, noodles, water, cigarettes, oils and eggs.

Aleta is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, water, cigarettes, oils and eggs

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustinha is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as traditional Timor cloth. 

Agustinha opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy traditional Timor cloth

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, married, makes a good earning with every cropping on her rice farm in Mahayag, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Evelyn has been able to provide her children with a good education, until they graduated and secured stable jobs. Evelyn pawned her 1-hectare rice land when her children entered college. Now, with the help and support of her youngest son, she wishes to access a PMPC loan to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land. Evelyn has high hopes that she will have a higher yield on her rice farm next cropping, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: El señora Dominga, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada tiene cinco hijos dependientes, vive en una comunidad rural, sus hijos estudian en los colegios de un municipio porque el nivel de estudio es mucho mejor y como madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos. La señora Dominga se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus padres. El 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios que atravesó los productos agrícolas y también por las lluvias que le echaron a perder sus plantaciones de papa y el caudal de las aguas del rió que colapsaron a sus sembradillos, por ello perdió parte de su cultivo y ahora quiere un crédito para comprar semilla de papa y agroquímicos de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia además de cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is 30 years old and married with five dependent children. She lives in a rural community and her children study in city schools because the education level is much better and as a mother, she wants the best for her children.

Dominga earns a living through agriculture because it's the only thing she learned from her parents. In 2014, she suffered a decrease in her income because the prices for agricultural products fell and the rains ruined her potato crops. The flow of the water to the river collapsed her seedlings, so she lost part of her crop.

Now, she wants a loan to buy potato seeds and agricultural chemicals to increase her income and her family's quality of live, as well as covering the cost of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural chemicals, increasing her inputs and her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 56 years old now.

Felisa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like home products and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like home products and other groceries.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гулбарчын 35 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Гулбарчын - высшее образование, работает учителем в школе. На данный момент также Гулбарчын занимается сельским хозяйством, в качестве дополнительного дохода. Стартовав много лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Гулбарчын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы. На 1,0 Га она выращивает рис для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбарчын обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на подготовку земли для проведения полевых работ. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулбарчын развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn is 35, married, and has four children. She has a college education and is a schoolteacher. At the present time she also farms for additional income. She started doing this many years ago, and thanks to her hard work she currently has three cows. She grows rice to sell on a 1.0 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her farm, Gulbarchyn applied for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to prepare the soil for planting crops. The loan will allow Gulbarchyn to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for planting crops in order to grow organic products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 35 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 5 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 14 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carmen  para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta  de banano desde hace 2 años, ella ama a su familia es por eso que ha deseado  mejorar sus ingresos,  pero para poder hacerlo es necesario invertir más en su negocio de banano, pero una delas dificultades que Carmen tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder hacerlo, es por eso que ella ha decidido solicitar un prestamo para comprar  más bananos para luego  venderlos a un buen precio.
Carmen su gran sueño es poder realizar esta inversión para mejorar sus ingresos para poder seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 35 year old woman. She has a beautiful family of 5 children between one and 14 years old. She lives in the community of Sololá.

To earn a living, Carmen has been buying and selling bananas for two years. She loves her family, so she has wanted to increase her income, but in order to do this, it's necessary to invest more in her banana business. 

One of the difficulties Carmen has is that she doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to do this. This is why she's seeking a loan to buy more bananas to later sell them at a good price.

Carmen's greatest dream is to be able to achieve this investment to increase her income to be able to continue building her house.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Tocache Group

texts.es:
Irma (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa rosada) es una mujer de 40 años de edad es casada, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, junto a sus cinco hijos de las edades entre 3 y 23 años de edad, ella para generar sus ingresos se dedica al tejido típico de diferentes tipos de blusas de su región, Irma realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años, lo realiza con el único  fin de apoyar a su esposo al mantenimiento de la familia, según cuenta Irma que desde hace algún tiempo junto a su esposo avían decidido remodelar su casa pero no lo avían podido realizar, por lo que ellos ahora han decidido solicitar un préstamo entonces Irma con el afán de conseguir el préstamo ha organizado a un grupo de mujeres para poder comprar block, cemento, piedrín y hierro y realizar la remodelación de su casa.
El gran sueño de Irma es poder conseguir el préstamo cuanto antes para que su familia tenga una mejor casa, y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela para que sean  buenos profesionales
texts.en:
Irma (the first woman on the left in a pink shirt) is a 40 year old woman who's married. She lives in the community of Sololá together with her five children who are between 3 and 23 years old. 

To earn a living, she does traditional weaving of different types of blouses from her region. Irma has been doing this work for 10 years and does it with the sole goal of supporting her husband with maintaining their family. 

Irma says that for a long time, she and her husband decided to remodel their home, but haven't been able to do this. This is why they've decided to seek a loan, and in an effort to get the loan, Irma has organized a group of women to be able to buy cement blocks, stone and iron to complete the remodel of her home. 

Irma's big dream is to be able to be able to get the loan so that her family will have a better house and continue helping her children in school so they can be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy cement block, stone and iron for remodeling her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 49 años de edad esta simplemente unida con su esposo, tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 16 y 28 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana  para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo para el mantenimiento de la casa se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, para ella trabajar en el campo es la mejor manera de ganarse el pan de cada día, Juana es una madre que ama a su familia es por eso que se desde hace algunos días se puesto a ver las mayores necesidades de la familia que una de ellas este terminar de construir su casa, para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida pero una de las limitaciones que Juana tiene, es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar su sueño, Juana ahora ha decidido realizar un préstamo   que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, arena. El mayor anhelo de Juana es poder conseguir el préstamo para que su familia este año cuente con una mejor casa y seguir haciendo mejoras en  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is a 49 year old woman who is simply connected with her husband. She has a beautiful family of three children between 16 and 28 years old. She lives in the community of Sololá.

To earn a living and support her husband in maintaining their house, Juana has worked in agriculture for 20 years. For her, working in the field is the best way of earning their daily bread. Juana is a mother who loves her family. Seeing her family's great need, she decided a few days ago to finish building her house so her children have a better life. 

One of the limitations Juana has is that she doesn't have enough money to be able to achieve her dream. Juana has decided to get a loan which she'll use to buy cement blocks and sand. Juana's greatest desire is to be able to get the loan so her family will have a better home this year, and continue making improvements in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks and sand.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 20-year-old divorced woman, from the village of Kakhaberi. She lives with her grandmother and takes care of her little daughter on her own. The only source of existence is her grandmother's pension, which is hardly enough to meet even their basic needs. Because of their situation, the family lives in poverty and requires financial support to earn enough income. 

Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Nana requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides leniency to the country's poor people, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Nana will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and will sell in her community at higher prices. She will generate some money that will provide for their basic needs and create better living conditions for her daughter.
 
She awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start a clothing business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years of age, married and blessed with two children. Her husband works as an electronic technician. Catherine has been working as a cashier at a gasoline station. She and her husband both work hard in order to improve their living conditions and send their children to school.

Catherine would like to purchase hog feed and vaccines but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. 

She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan amount, and that she will be able to keep her hog raising business profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines needed by her hogs

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.en:
Hurmatoy is a generous woman. She was born in a remote district and is from the southern part of the country. She is married and has four children. 

Hurmatoy works in agriculture. She knows her duties well and attracts a lot of clients for her livestock. For almost ten years she has been building her experience in this sphere of business. She is a capable, hardworking, bright and honest woman. 

She wants to buy livestock to sell on. She feeds the animals well and keeps them correctly. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell on

loans.name: Tailua

texts.en: Tailua is 18 years old, and she owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. Tailua  has  requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Tailua  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 47 years old, married and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.  She is engaged in corn coffee processing as her source of income.  But the income of her business is not enough to support the needs of her family.  So, she decided to join Paglaum because of the services and programs she can access.  

Now she is applying for a loan from Paglaum in the amount of 10,000 PHP for fertilizer and seedlings of vegetables as another type of business to increase her income.  Fe hopes and prays that God will bless her business expansion so that she can help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario (Charapoto) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta  relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 6  años, la mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es chofer.
Doña María en con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres o cuatro  días por semana en su recorridos, ella sale en las mañanas ya que a esta hora se le hace más fácil realizar su labor, ella deja a crédito y cobra por semana, tiene más de 2  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha  ayuda. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario loan group meets every five days in Charapoto. This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province - San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is a group of people who decided to come together a while ago and form this loan group, which has served them well. With the loans, they have improved their small businesses and lives. They work in diverse activities like agriculture, general retail and services, among others.

One of the group's members is Maria. She's 45 years old, married and has three children from this marriage who are 12, 10 and six years old. The oldest is in high school and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is a driver.

With a goal of earning something for her account, Maria works selling all types of clothing. She does door to door sales and also sells from her house, where her best-known customers come. She works three or four days a week on her route, leaving in the morning, which is the easiest time to do her work. She sells on credit and collects each week. She's been doing this business for more than two years and earns a living with it.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She's been in the loan group for three cycles and likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucita is 42 years old now.

Lucita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Lucita has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of transportation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 37-year-old mother with 4 children. 

She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan for her business. 

Eseta hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a frying pan

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi is 44 years old, married and a resident of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have three children, all in school.  Starting with 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2012 and has taken out three loans. 
 
Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and would be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
The majority of Africa's young people struggle to make their way in the world because of scarce resources and inequalities. This is true for Paul, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. 

Paul has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years, and he has managed to earn a decent income. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business he engages in to make that extra coin. Paul enjoys the farming lifestyle. He has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that he names each of them. 

He has aspirations of expanding his dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, he has been unable to do so until now. Now Paul is kindly requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva lenders to buy a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, he will have more for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, he will be able to service his loan on time. 

With increased income from the loan, Paul plans to cover the high farming costs of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with his increased income, Paul will not need to take such measures. In the long run, his family's standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is requesting a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including soaps, noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, slippers, coffee, detergents, cooking oils, soft drinks and other things to sell. She has a kiosk shop and wants to improve her business. 

She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of USD 200. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking out this loan and will manange it well to improve her business. 

She is happy with the loan that has been offered by Tuba Rai Metin, which will help her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy soaps, noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, slippers, coffee, detergents, cooking oils, soft drinks and other things to sell

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en: Nazokat is an experienced woman who was born in 1979. She is from the southern part of the country living in a remote district. She is divorced and has four children. Since 2006, she has been working at a canteen as a waiter. Her daughter got sick so Nazokat needs to get her treatment at a medical clinic. She requested financial support from KIva for the medical clinic treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to treat her daughter in medical clinic

loans.name: Sinaseni

texts.en: Sinaseni is a 53-year-old mother of five children. She operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sinaseni has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery in the near future. Sinaseni joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 60-year-old woman who is very responsible towards her household obligations and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. 

Rebecca is a farmer who plants corn and beans, and she wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer and other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, compost and other items

loans.name: Lary

texts.en: Lary is 46 years old and married with three children.  She grows vegetables as her primary source of income.  She joined Paglaum in May 2011 because of the programs and service offered to members.  Lary has applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy lumber for housing repair.  Lary is very thankful for Paglaum because slowly she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy lumber for housing repair

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Mayline

texts.en:
Mayline is a 33-year-old mother of two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mayline has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Mayline requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Mayline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mayline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years she has been operating an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chairs for her business, which customers can sit on.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her business

loans.name: Leonor Concepcion

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene Cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 11 y 3 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el siguiente  en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Leonor es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio familiar, ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden frutas, verduras y legumbres en un local en el mercado central de la ciudad, allí todos los días ellos venden sus productos a clientes que a diario acuden al lugar a surtirse de sus productos, ella le ayuda un rato en la mañana y los fines de semana todo el día ya que son días de ferias y es cuando más personas acuden al lugar. Su marido lleva más de 15 años con su negocio, ella antes vendía ropa pero dejo este negocio porque no le fue muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para realizar los créditos. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes community bank meets every fifteen days in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí and long known for real tamarinds.

Sra. Leonor, 39, is married and has four children: 16-, 15-, 11- and 3-years old, respectively.  The two oldest children are in high school and the next in age to them is in middle school.  Leonor and her husband make a living selling fruits and vegetables.  They sell the produce in the city's central market and work every day.  Doña Leonor works mornings during the week and entire days on weekends and holidays when there are more buyers around.  Leonor's husband has operated the business for more than 15 years.  She used to have another business selling clothing but it wasn't successful and she gave it up.  

Doña Leonor will use this loan to stock the family's fruit and vegetables business.  She was one of the founding members of the community bank and says that she likes having access to credit.  For the future, she wants to go on providing for her children.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables business.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu is a 41-year-old mother of five children. She operates a small business selling elei (fabric) printing materials at the market to earn a living. Fetu has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Fetu hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is from Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Orlando and they have children. She has been employed by a garment factory in Cavite for some years now, through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.  

Anna Marie is a Sewing Assistant. She helps the sewer or tailor in the production department and also does the sewing of clothing apparel according to the company's or client’s demands. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machines, and often does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Anna Marie is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, which puts them in a situation where they can become heavily indebted to usurious money lenders, who then capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Anna Marie is asking for your assistance to prevent her from getting involved with loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in returning the money, since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. 

She looks forward to your positive response, and any forthcoming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for the cost of house repairs.

Anna Marie hopes that their present living conditions will improve in the future. 

 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, provide quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance and repair of their house.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Soledad is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Soledad has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Soledad requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more to sell in her food stall.

Soledad has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Meet Douglas. He is a 45-year-old smallholder farmer from Kithangari village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Like most farmers in the region, Douglas practices mixed farming. He keeps dairy animals and grows maize, among other crops. He has been doing this work for a decade now. Over the years, he has come to like farming because it is a sustainable and self-fulfilling investment. Farming doesn’t take all his time, so he is also able to attend to his “side hustle” job. A delicate balance of both jobs has enabled him to comfortably raise his four children. Douglas is seeking a loan to start banana farming. Nkubu area has a favorable weather pattern that supports banana farming. Selling the bananas will never be a problem because the Nkubu area has a ready market for bananas. When Juhudi Kilimo’s loan officer asked Douglas how his family will benefit from the loan, he replied, “they will benefit from the income I get once I acquire the loan and buy the asset.”

loans.use: To start banana farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Yolita Yenny

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes.
En este lugar vive la  señora Yolita, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero no ha podido tener  hijos, su marido realiza transportes en un triciclo de su propiedad.
Doña Yolita es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo desde productos de primera necesidad hasta ciertos productos de bazar y papelería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su marido le ayuda más que todo en horas de la noche que es cuando él está desocupado, pero por lo general es ella la que trata de brindar la mejor atención a sus clientes,  lleva más de 11 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda con productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y útiles escolares. Lleva más de 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son mejorar aun más su tienda.
texts.en:
The members of the Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes community bank meet twice a month in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí and long known for real tamarinds.
Sra. Yolita, 47, and her husband have no children.  Her husband has a vehicle for hauling goods.  Doña Yolita enjoys working and says that it is how she gets ahead.  She has a corner store where she sells the everyday products that her customers want.  She works every day, starting at 6:00 in the morning and working until 8:00 in the evening.  Her husband sometimes helps her in the evenings when he's not working, but generally she has to be at the store to meet any customers who come in.  She has operated the business for more than 11 years and her earnings from it cover part of the household's expenses.  
Doña Yolita is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her store with school supplies and the other merchandise that she sells.  She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years and says that the values the services it provides.  For the future, she wants to go on improving her store.

loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Meluna

texts.en:
Meluna is 24 years old and has three children. She is a woman with two children who are in school.

Meluna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Meluna has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meluna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 36 years old and has six children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Merlyn is in the agricultural business raising goats in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Merlyn has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is a taxi driver. He is 30 years old, married, and father of two children.

Arif is an IDP (Internally Displaced Peoples) and now he is living in the Fuzuli region with his lovely family. 

Today he wants to support his business.  The motor of his car was broken and Arif wants to change it. For that he needs a loan in amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new motor. 

Arif is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. 

In the future, Arif want to paint and repair his car.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria has mastered her skills in making bread. She has her own unique bread recipe and she is known for her homemade sweet bread. This has kept her business going for more than 7 years now. 

Recently, Eleuteria requested a loan to buy more kilos of flour, sugar, and margarine for bread production. 

Eleutria hopes to expand her business by displaying her bread in more store outlets and to be in the position to help her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy additional flour, sugar, and margarine

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other sea foods to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other sea foods to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 51 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she raises pigs. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock.

She has been in this business for seven years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 60-year-old widow and mother of two children. Nenita works very hard to provide for her children.  

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, bread, and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 25 years now. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, bread, and other groceries

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a small dairy and poultry farmer dying to get his hands on the horticultural market. He is the father of four and has been doing crop farming, for subsistence purposes. He also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for his cow. 

He is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. 

Benard is very excited to start commercialization of his crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. He will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. 

The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. His increased income will uplift the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en:
Pisila is 63 years old and has 12 children.  

She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living.  She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Pisila has requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her business profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has seven children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no to piped water. 

Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills.

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all people on a retail and whole sale basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. 

She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She would like to start planting green bananas to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Christine Jane

texts.en:
Christine has a farm in Salvador, Calamba, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Christine makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income.

She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Christine wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor and fertilizer for her banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Elisam

texts.en:
Elisam owns a produce store. He is 49 years old and very hard working.  He lives in Kasese Uganda. 

Elisam also has a coffee plantation which helps him meet his family's needs. 

His vision is to have a bigger store of produce in the near future and educating his children, but he has been faced with a challenge of stiff competition and limited capital which affect the performance of his business. 

Elisam is requesting a loan to buy more produce like bags of maize, beans, groundnuts, and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like bags of maize, beans, groundnuts, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima used the previous loan to buy land for farming. 

She owns a retail shop and also cooks food for sale to supplement her income. 

She faces challenges of low capital that hinder progress of her business. 

She hopes of building a permanent house and to start farming. 

She has asked for a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and have seven children, two are in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. 

She has a farm and raises and sells poultry and has been in this business for 22 years.

She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicks, vaccines, and bags of chicken feed. 

She generates additional income selling fresh fruits. She works from home and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees, utilities, and medication.

She aspires to raise more chicken.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vaccines, and bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She operates a shop on both a retail and wholesale basis, and she has been in this business for 12 years. 

Zaina has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, beans, sugar, rice, and crates of soda. 

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. She would like to buy a fridge to stock more drinks. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, sugar, rice, and crates of soda

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
C’est Bourama qui a  le bras levé sur la photo au bout à coté du bois.
Bourama est un malien âgé de 33 ans, marié, père de 3 enfants de 10 à 2 ans dont 01 est scolarisé. Son épouse est une femme au foyer, lui-même n’ayant pas été à l’école, Bourama  et sa femme sont des agriculteurs. Pendant la saison sèche Bourama fait l’embouche depuis 04 ans, le prêt RMCR permet à Bourama d’acheter plus d’animaux (moutons, parfois les bœufs) pour engraisser.L’approvisionnement se fait sur le marché local et environnant, après une embouche réussi la vente est effectué également sur le marché local. Le rêve de Bourama est qu’un jour ; il pourra être un grand emboucheur et bien préparer l’avenir de ses enfants. Les bénéfices tirés de l’activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famille (frais de condiment, frais de scolarisation des enfants).En plus les déchets des animaux constitue pour Bourama du fumier pour son champ.Bourama rencontre le problème  d’approvisionnement en aliment bétail dans l’exercice de son activité.
ll
texts.en:
Bourama, who has his arm raised in the photo, next to the pole, [is the featured borrower]. He is from Mali, is 33 years old, married, and the father of three children between two and 10 years old, one of whom attends school. His wife is a housewife; not having attended school himself, Bourama and his wife are farmers.

Bourama has been raising livestock during the dry season for four years and the loan from RMCR will allow him to purchase more animals (sheep, sometimes cattle) to raise. Bourama purchases his livestock in the local market and surrounds; after the animals are successfully raised, he sells them at the local market as well. Bourama's dream is to one day be a major livestock farmer and provide for his children's future.

The profits from this business allow Bourama to meet his family's needs (the cost of food, children's school fees). Additionally, the animals' waste provides Bourama with manure [to fertilize] his field. A problem Bourama encounters in running his business is sourcing livestock feed.

loans.use: To purchase animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Ledella

texts.en:
Ledella has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting to earning income as well. Ledella has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, Ledella has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, Ledella hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate, which will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Erlinse

texts.en:
Erlinse, the breadwinner in her family, is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 37 years old and married. She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her family.

Erlinse is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default.

Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and her sales. Erlinse continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and her sales

loans.name: Lauoi

texts.en:
Lauoi is 56 years old with 9 children. 

She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Lauoi has requested for a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013, and she hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Meminetou

texts.fr: Meminetou est femme mariée qui est âgée de 52 ans et vit à Fiavi avec ses onze enfants et son mari. Meminetou a entrepris une petite boutique où elle vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des articles scolaires. Ce commerce lui procure une rentabilité nécessaire pour assurer la survie quotidienne de ses enfants et leur éducation. Meminetou s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour lancer un nouvel achat afin d’équiper sa boutique, Meminetou demande ce prêt pour la réalisation de son objectif.
texts.en:
Meminetou is a 52-year-old married woman and lives in Fiavi with her 11 children and her husband. Meminetou has undertaken [running] a small shop where she sells general foodstuffs and school supplies. This business provides her the financial viability to ensure the daily survival of her children and see to their education.

Meminetou gets her supplies four times per month from Lomé's Grand Market. She is requesting this loan in order to realize her goal of making a new purchase to supply her shop.

loans.use: To purchase two containers of notebooks and six packs of chalk.

loans.name: Switzer

texts.en:
Switzer is a 69-year-old married man with 7 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a farmer growing tea and at the same time has firewood contracts. He is faced with the challenges of heavy rains that hinder the prosperity of his firewood business. However, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris lives on a hilltop in Kenyenya, Kenya with her children. 

From her small mud house she can see light at the end of the tunnel, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. Doris passionately loves dairy farming. Because of her immense farming knowledge she commands a lot of respect from other farmers. The biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. 

She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her family. She has gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, and she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and be able to pay back the loan. 

Doris is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tchalalaou

texts.fr: Tchalalaou est un homme marié qui est âgé de 37 ans. Tchalalaou vit à Logope avec sa femme et son enfant. Pour assurer les besoins quotidiens de sa famille, Tchalalaou répare et vend des pneux afin d’avoir la rentabilité nécessaire. Tchalalaou s’approvisionne au port de Lomé une fois par mois. Pour acheter des pneux, Tchalalaou sollicite ce crédit pour financer sa commande et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Tchalalaou is a 37-year-old married man. He lives in Logope with his wife and child. In order to [gain] the necessary funds to see to his family's daily needs, Tchalalaou repairs and sells tires. He gets his supplies at Lomé's port once a month. Tchalalaou is seeking this loan to pay for his order to buy the tires and have a good profit margin, [so he can] support his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase 20 tires.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes.
En este lugar vive la señora María,  tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija de 4 años  que estudia en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en el oriente ecuatoriano.
Doña María es una mujer que le  gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y meriendas en su casa, todas las tardes y noches con la ayuda de un hermano instalan su local en su casa, allí vende hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog, sanduches, tostadas, jugos y batidos de frutas así como también sodas y jugos de fabrica, entre otras cosas que prepara y que son del gusto de sus clientes que a diario asisten a su local a servirse sus alimentos,  trabajan todos los días en las tardes y noches, lleva 2 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local para vender sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo; the capital of Manabi (which has been known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds) the members of Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes (Small Merchants Credit Group) meet. It is here that Mrs. Maria lives; she is 26 years old, married and has a 4 year old daughter who is in kindergarten. Her husband works in eastern Ecuador.

Mrs. Maria is a woman who likes to work for the well being of her family. She sells fast food and snacks in her house. Every afternoon and evening with the help of her brother she sets up the restaurant in her house.
