There, she sells hamburgers, French fries, hot dogs, sandwiches, tostadas,   juices and fruit smoothies and commercial sodas and juices. As well as other item that she prepares which are to the liking of her customers who visit her restaurant daily for their meals. They work every day in the afternoon and evenings. She has been doing this work for 2 years and it has allowed her to move ahead. 

She will use this loan to buy the necessary supplies to prepare the food. She has had 2 loans with the credit group and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide her with. Her dream is to have a larger place to sell her food.

loans.use: buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, rock, sand, and beams to construct a room.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, which especially entails the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of rice fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Ligaya hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Takeo province, Chanda is 36 years old and a mother of five children. She earns income to support her family’s living via growing cassava and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

For Chanda, this is the first cycle with Visionfund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a loan. She will spend her loan portion to pay for labor to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield to make more income than last year.

loans.use: To pay for labor to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is married with two children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, dryer, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access this loan.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, dryer, and body lotions

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 54-year-old mother with five children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Susana has requested a loan to buy a box of twist-ties, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, and plastic bags, which she needs for running the business.

Susana became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of twist-ties, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, and plastic bags

loans.name: Deonisio

texts.en:
Deonisio is a strong-willed and determined man who pushes his ability when it comes to his piggery business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family.

Recently, he availed himself of a loan to purchase bags of animal grower feeds. Aside from his project of working in swine production, he has thought of adding additional heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday he hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal grower feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, beans, and sugar to resell

loans.name: Karakura Group

texts.fr:
François  fait partie du groupe  Karakura et  habite à  Bujumbura.Il a 32 ans et est marié à Immaculée,une commerçante. .
Il a sous sa charge son petit frère qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce du riz, du haricot,du sucre,... dans sa boutique depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot,de sucre  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir une belle maison.
texts.en:
François is a member of the Karakura group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and is married to Immaculée, a merchant. He takes care of his little brother, who goes to school.

François has worked selling rice, beans, sugar, etc. in a shop for three years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large amount of rice, beans, and sugar, which he will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to have a nice house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey runs a general merchandise shop that sells sugar and soap among other items. He begun the business to improve his standard of living. He hopes to build houses for rentals to earn an additional  income. Inadequate capital affects his business, and he needs a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old widowed woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop in Bundibugyo. She is a hardworking woman and has a stationery shop as a side business. 

Mary hopes to improve her shop. She needs a loan to buy soap, steel wool, salt, sugar, sweets, and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, steel wool, salt, sugar, sweets, and boxes of matches to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 59 year old married woman with three children. She lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda.

Florence has a restaurant, bar and pool table as her major sources of income. She works very hard to see that her businesses keep going. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels.

She intends to use the loan to repair her pool table and to renovate her premises.

loans.use: to repair her pool table and renovate her premises.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr: Helene vit à Adakpamé et âgée de 50 ans, elle est une femme mariée avec trois personnes à charge. Helene vend du jus de fruit et se promène dans le quartier et au marché et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Helene s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des fruits pour la préparation du jus, Helene demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Helene lives in Adakpamé and is 50 years old. She is married and has three people under her care. 

She works selling fruit juice at the market and by walking around the area. She is able to make her sales thanks to her dynamic character.

Helene procures her ingredients four times a month from the market. 

She is seeking a loan in order to buy fruit to make her juice, so that she can earn enough to help her husband with the various family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one carton of fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and maize.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She has a restaurant in the market. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy rice, cooking oil, sweet potatoes, flour, and a bunch of green bananas. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sweet potatoes, flour, and crates of soda.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is a businesswoman who earns income through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits it provides, like insurance and financial assistance.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for bags of cement and floor tiles for her house. She is on her way to paying her loan from her profit. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and floor tiles for her house

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is 18 years old from Doña Lucia, Quezon, Nueva Ecija. Their family owns a sari sari store which serves as their source of income. Having only that income and with two other children, her parents are having difficulties in sending her to college. 

That’s why Nadine wants to take an education loan of PHP 150,000 from the Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to continue pursuing her college education taking up BS in accountancy. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan so she can achieve her dreams and help her family have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Awoussi

texts.fr: Awoussi est une femme mariée qui vit des enfants à sa charge. Awoussi vit à  Agoè et est âgée de 54 ans. Pour réaliser ses gains, Awoussi vend du jus glacé dans son quartier et trouve un revenu pouvant couvrir ses charges mais nécessite réaliser plus de bénéfice. Pour préparer son jus nécessite du citron et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Awoussi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des paniers de citron afin de satisfaire agréablement ses consommateurs.
texts.en:
Awoussi is a married woman who lives in Agoe with children who are under her care. She is 54 years old. In order to earn a living, she works selling iced juice in her area. She is able to earn enough to be able to cover her expenses, but she needs more profits.

To make her juice, it is necessary to procure lemons three times a month from the market. 

Awoussi is seeking a loan to buy trays of lemon in order to happily satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy ten trays of lemons

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 47 years old and one of her children is in school.

Lolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lami

texts.fr: Etant mariée, Lami est âgée de 23 ans et habite avec deux personnes à charge dans le quartier d’Agoè. Lami vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans une boutique afin de gagner son revenu. Grâce  ce commerce Lami trouve le bénéfice nécessaire afin de venir en aide aux charges de la famille. Lami s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Lami demande ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates et des boites de lait afin d’avoir une marge bénéficiaire favorable au travers de son commerce.
texts.en:
Lami is 23 years old, married, and lives with two people under her care in the Agoe area. 

Lami sells general food products in a shop in order to earn a living. Thanks to this commerce, Lami is able to help with her family's expenses.

Lami procures her goods four times a month at the Lomé market. She is seeking a loan to buy trays of tomatoes and boxes of milk, so that she can have a favorable profit margin.

loans.use: to buy one carton of milk and tomatoes

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Sanaba est assise et a la main levée sur la photo
Sanaba est une agricultrice malienne âgée de 38 ans qui pratique le stockage d’arachide depuis 3 ans. Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 vont à l’école âgés de 12 à 2ans.Son mari est cultivateur, n’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, Sanaba achète ses arachides dans les marchés locaux. Elle les revend en gros dans le marché central de la zone. Sanaba emprunte au RMCR pour pouvoir acheter assez sacs  d’arachide à stocker. Le profit qu’elle tire de son stockage lui permet de subvenir  à ses dépenses tel que l’habillement de ses enfants et leur frais scolaire.
texts.en:
Sanaba is 38 years old and is seated with her hand raised in the photo. She is a Malian farmer who has been selling groundnuts for three years. She did not go to school.

She is married and a mother of four children, aged from two to 12 years old. Two of the children go to school. Her husband is a farmer.

Sanaba buys groundnuts in the local markets. She resells them at wholesale in the central market.

Sanaba is borrowing through RMCR in order to buy enough groundnuts to stock. Profits from this business will allow her to cover her expenses, especially her children's clothing needs and their school fees.

loans.use: to buy sacs of groundnuts to store and then resell

loans.name: Zouhera

texts.fr: Zouhera vit à Daliko et est âgée de 45 ans, elle est une femme mariée avec trois personnes à charge. Zouhera vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs dans le quartier et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Zouhera s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de maïs, Zouhera demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Zouhera lives in Daliko and is 45 years old. She is married and has three people under her care. 

Zouhera sells bouillie [porridge] made from corn in her area. She succeeds at this work because of her dynamism.

Zouhera procures her ingredients twice a month at the market. Zouhera is seeking a loan in order to buy sacs of corn and earn enough profits to help her husband with the various family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of corn

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es odontólogo aunque no ejerce la profesión por motivos de salud.
Doña Ángela es un ama de casa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que el no trabaja actualmente se dedica al comercio, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres  en un local que arrienda en un lugar muy transitado y con mucha clientela, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de aguas, sodas, jugos, helados pollos, etc. Ella también en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría gallinas criollas y pollos, pero los alimenta con maíz razón por lo cual los pollos parecen criollos, lo cual le favorece ya que los clientes la prefieren por esta razón y compran en su tienda ya que allí también vende sus pollos, de esta forma ella se gana sus ingresos que le sirven para el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, comprar víveres y maíz para la cría de pollos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su local propio ya que en arriendos gasta mucho.
texts.en:
In the city of Portovijeo, the capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, every fifteen days the members of the Grupo de Crédito Pequeños Comericantes (The Group of Small Loan Traders) meet.

In this place lives Señora Ángela.  She is 52 years old, is married, and from this relationship has three older children, two of whom still live in her house.  Her husband is a dentist, although he does not work due to his health.

Ángela is a housewife so that she can help her husband with the household costs since he doesn't work but currently makes a living trading.  She has a grocery store in a place that she rents in a place that is very busy with many customers.  In it, she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, in addition to waters, soft drinks, juices, ice creams, chickens, etc.  Also in her house, she has a small farm in which she raises creole hens and chickens, and she feeds them with corn so that the chickens seem creole.  She favors them since the customers prefer them for this reason and they buy them in her store since there she also sells her chickens.  In this way she earns her income that serves for the good of her family.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more, to buy food and corn to raise the chickens.  This is her second cycle in the Grupo de Crédito, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dreams are to have her own location since renting costs a lot.

loans.use: To buy food and corn.

loans.name: Metropolitana 2014  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a la ciudad de  Manta esta la ciudadela  Metropolitana, lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Metropolitana 2014. Este es un grupo de 11 mujeres y 1 hombre  que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Fanny, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 12 años, la menor  estudia en colegio, ambos aun viven en su casa. Su marido es ebanista.
Doña Fanny  es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  ella sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta que les sirven para la educación de sus hijos y para ir mejorando su hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the road to the city of Manta, is the Metropolitana city, the place where every 15 days the members of the Grupo de Crédito Metropolitana 2014 (Metropolitan Credit Group 2014)  meet.  This is a group of 11 women and 1 man that decided to get together a while ago and to form this group that has served them a lot, since, with the loan, they have been able to improve their small businesses.  They make living in diverse jobs such as farming, selling, services, among other jobs. 

One of the members in this group is Señora Fanny.  She is 41 years old, she is married, and from this relationship they have two children who are 20 and 12 years old.  The younger one studies in school, and both still live in her house.  Her husband is a carpenter.

Fanny is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources, and with this help her husband with the household expenses, makes a living selling all kinds of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  Her form of selling is door to door and she also sells from her house.  She goes out to sell almost every day during her free time since she does not have a fixed schedule.  She buys her products with credit and pays it off every eight to fifteen days.  She has been making a living on this job for more than twenty years, which has allowed her gain something on her own that serves for the education of her children and to continue improving her house.

This loan is to buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been with the Grupo de Créto since it began, and she likes it because the loan allows her to finance her business.  Her dreams are to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy clothes, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada y su pareja trabaja de seguridad, tiene tres hijas que aún viven con ella.

Rosa, trabaja con ganado de doble propósito, lo ha hecho por 2 años y lo aprendió gracias a una prima y decidió hacerlo para buscar un ingreso económico, para su familia y de alguna manera ayudar con los gastos del hogar.- 
Antes, solo hacia los oficios domésticos; la distancia que camina hasta donde está el ganado es de 1 kilómetro.

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar más ganado, esto le permitirá incrementar su negocio y mejorar las ganancias.

El sueño de Rosa, es seguir trabajando, para poder ayudar a su esposo y también poder darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and studied up until fifth grade. She is married and her husband works in security. She has three daughters who still live with her.
 
Rosa works with cattle for a dual-purpose. She has worked in this field for two years having learnt thanks to a cousin. She decided to look for a form of income for her family so that she could help out in some way with the household bills. Previously she only did the housework but now she walks a kilometre to the place where the cattle are kept.

Rosa needs a loan to buy more cattle which will allow her to increase her business and improve her earnings. Her dream is to keep working to help her husband and also give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Etant mariée, Akouavi est âgée de 27 ans et habite avec son mari et ses trois enfants dans le quartier de Daliko. Akouavi vend friperies en promenant les quartiers pour gagner son revenu. Grâce  ce commerce Akouavi trouve le bénéfice nécessaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouavi demande ce prêt pour commander des habits. Grâce au bénéfice Akouavi souhaite favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their three children in Daliko. 

She earns a living by traveling around her area and selling used clothing. Thanks to this commerce, she earns enough to help her husband cover the family expenses.

Akouabi procures her goods twice a month from the market. She is seeking a loan to buy clothing.

With her profits, Akouavi wishes to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two lots of used clothing

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses used the previous loan to buy cement to construct his family house. For five years Moses has been selling coffee and earning a salary alongside farming in order to earn a living. Moses is 31 years of age and married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Moses has a dream of growing his business and being rich in the future. Moses is a hardworking man faced with a challenge of limited capital. Moses wants money to buy roofing materials like iron sheets to use for his family house.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets for his family house.

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 37 años de edad, está acompañada y es madre de 2 niños y una niña, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad y ella se dedica a la venta de productos de cosmetología y perfumería. 

Rosa, tiene 3 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de belleza como su negocio personal, todo lo aprendió de sus hermanas, quienes se dedicaban a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza, los cuales por encontrarse en un temporada de liquidación, serán comprados a bajo precio, para posteriormente ser puestos a la venta a un mejor precio, con esto generara mejores ganancias, para volver a invertir e ir fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son, tener un bazar y una sala de belleza, también sueña con estudiar cosmetología.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37 years old, is married and is the mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom are studying in the community school.  She makes a living selling cosmetic products and perfumes.

Rose has three years of experience in selling beauty products as her personal business.  She learned everything from her sisters, who used to make a living selling cosmetics through catalogs.

The money will be utilized to buy beauty products, which are in a liquidation season, and can be bought at a low price, to later be put on sale for a better price.  With this, she will generate better profits to reinvest and to continue strengthening the capital of her business. 

The goals that she has in the future are to have a bazaar and a beauty salon.  She also dreams of studying cosmetology.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidala is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Samuel, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos y también cuida de un sobrino; Samuel, tiene dos hijos que no viven con él, porque ya están casados y tienen sus propios hogares. 

Samuel, trabaja vendiendo ropa en los cantones desde hace dos años y lo aprendió de un cuñado; también hace viajes, trasladando muebles en su pick up; antes era empleado en una comercial de granos básicos.

Samuel, comprará ropa para vender, con estas compras aumentará su inventario de ropa y podrá ofrecer diferente variedad a sus clientes.

Él sueña con tener un bazar en un local propio, para no tener que andar en la calle vendiendo sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old, studied up until Grade 3 and is married. His wife does the household chores and also takes care of a nephew. Samuel has two children who don’t live with him because they are already married and have their own homes.

Samuel has worked selling clothes in the cantons for two years having learnt this trade from a brother-in-law. He also does removals, moving furniture in his pick up. Previously he worked in a store selling staple grains. 

Samuel will buy clothes to resell. With these purchases he will increase his clothing inventory and he will be able to offer a diverse variety of clothing to his customers. He dreams of having his own shop so that he doesn’t have to walk from street to street selling his items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Bahoma

texts.fr: Femme entreprenante et très active, Bahoma vit avec son enfant à Sogbossito et est âgée de 48 ans. Etant mariée, Bahoma ne laisse pas uniquement son mari s’acharner pour assurer les charges du foyer. Elle travaille ardemment pour contribuer et pour parvenir à ses fins, Bahoma prépare du riz qu’elle vend pour avoir un revenu. Bahoma s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz. Le bénéfice lui permettra d’améliorer son environnement de vente et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Bahoma is a very resourceful and energetic person. She is 48years old and lives with her child in Sogbossito. She is married but does not rely solely on her husband to provide for household needs. She works very hard to contribute to the family budget. In order to do so, she cooks rice for sale. Bahoma stocks up three times a year at the market and is requesting this loan to buy bags of rice. The revenue will allow her to enhance her sales stand and provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance LTD (MDI), providing electrical services like phone charging, battery charging and saloon services which he started in 1998. He is a married man with four children of whom two attend school at the moment. He is a hardworking man who works 9 hours a day and 7 days a week. 

He started his business to be able to have a sustainable source of income to cater for his needs and the needs of his family.  The business is done in his local area Kiyora LC1, Bitereko Mitooma district, and his clients are tea traders and factories. He has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000 (One million shillings only) to buy electronics to sell in his business and in the long run make more profits and educate his children. 

His major challenge is lack of electric power so he has to use battery power all the time, which is costly. He is determined to succeed through hard work. He appreciates the services of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Elsa Bellalinda

texts.es:
Elsa madre de 3 niños de las edades entre 5 y 10 años de edad, ella es casada vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Elsa para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa se dedica a cuidar una piscina de su familia desde hace un año atendiendo a las personas quienes visitan el lugar, ella cuenta que con lo poco que gana ha logrado junto a su esposo cubrir las necesidades de su familia, pero Elsa es una mujer que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia, y se ha puesto a ver cuál de todas es la más importante, y una de ellas  es la remodelación de su casa, lamentablemente que Elsa no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la remodelación, y por tal motivo el ahora acude a un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, arena y hierro para remodelar su casa.
Elsa sueña con  poder mejorar sus ingresos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando para tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a mother of three children between the ages of 5 and 10 years old.  She is married and lives together with her family in the community of Suchitepéquez.

Elsa, to support her husband with the income of the house, makes a living taking care of the family pool, and for a year has been attending to the people who visit the place.  She says that with the little that she has earned, she has been able to, together with her husband, cover the necessities of her family.  But Elsa is a woman that worries for the needs of her family, and she has set out to see which of them all is the most important.  One of them is the remodeling of her house. 

Lamentably, Elsa does not have enough money to be able to remodel, and for this motive she is requesting a loan to utilize it to buy cement, block, sand, and iron to remodel her home.

Elsa dreams of being able to improve her income so that her children continue to study to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy cement, block, sand, and iron for the remodeling of her home.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas, age 35, does farming, specializing in matooke and coffee growing, which he started 20 years back. He is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school at the moment. He is a hardworking man who started farming to be able to have a sustainable source of income so he could cater for his needs and the needs of his family. In addition to his major source of income he also earns money through car hiring and tea farming to supplement his monthly income. The business is done in Nyakazinga, Kibazi, Kyamuhunga, Igara, and Bushenyi  districts, and his clients are all categories of people, especially urban and trading centre markets. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 (one million shillings only) to buy mulch for the banana plantation so that he can increase his yields and the sales of matooke every season. His major challenge is poor weather -- for example, heavy rain falls -- and low prices, but he is determined to grow his businesses. He requests lenders to finance other farmers doing agriculture so that the production is high in the area, to enable them to start a factory of matooke in their area.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Maresa

texts.en:
Maresa is a 43-year-old mother with one child.  She has a small business selling vegetables, such as cabbage, eggplant and cucumbers, in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Maresa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. 

Maresa hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel,  gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Nestor Fabian

texts.es: A sus 48 años de edad Nestor  es un señor soltero que vive con su madre que es de la tercera edad, Nestor se dedica de lunes a viernes a trabajar de albañil y los fines de semana vende helados, Nestor comenta que le va  bien en su negocio  y sobre todo los días que hace calor es cuando mas le compran su producto, Nestor va a invertir el crédito en la compra frutas y demás implementos para hacer  helados para variar de sabores y de  formas, Nestor  tiene  la aspiración de seguir en su negocio variar su mercadería y de esta manera mejorarlo y con las ganancias del negocio apoyarse en sus gastos y los de su madre que  esta viejita.
texts.en:
At 48 years of age, Nestor is a single man who lives with his mother who is a senior.  Nestor works from Monday to Friday as a bricklayer and on the weekends he sells ice cream.  Nestor  comments that his business is going well, especially on hot days when more people buy his product.

Nestor is going to invest the loan in the purchase of fruits and implements to make ice cream in order to vary the flavours and the forms.  Nestor has the aspiration to continue in his business, varying his merchandise and in this way improve the business and with his earnings support himself in his expenses and those of his mother who is old.

loans.use: to buy products to make ice cream

loans.name: Leuluasi

texts.en: Leuluasi is a 57-year-old mother with four children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Leuluasi has requested a loan to buy a box of twist ties, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. Leuluasi became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: To buy a box of twist ties, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 34 years old and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has a family that consists of one child with his future dreams of having a modern and fully furnished family house. Moses gets a salary at the end of the month, which will help him to repay the loan facility. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand to build his residential modern home. He is a hardworking honest man but faced with the challenge of working for long hours.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, bricks and sand to build his residential modern home

loans.name: Dania Melissa

texts.es:
Dania es una mujer de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, paciente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘ovejuyo’  ubicado al costado derecho del Río Huayñajahuira, es un terreno que está lleno de edificaciones y completamente habitado de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-19 grados centígrados.
Dania es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja, viven en casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Plato paceño (choclo, habas, papas todas hervidas con queso frito y acompañado con ají), Fricasé paceño (sopa de cerdo con maíz, chuño y ají amarillo), Chairo paceño (sopa de chuño con carne de cordero y trigo), y otros, actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto en su domicilio; “inicie mi negocio con un capital económico mínimo ayudando a mi mamá y luego por la necesidad de independizarme inicie mi negocio propio…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para el bien de su familia, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Dania solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida tradicional y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dania is a 21-year-old woman, she lives with her partner and has a one-year-old son. She is enterprising, independent, patient, constant, responsible, hardworking and a good mother.

She makes a living selling traditional food in 'ovejuyo' district, in La Paz. It is located on the right side of Huayñajahuira river, an area full of buildings and completely inhabited. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures varying between 5ºC and 19ºC throughout the day.

Dania is a short woman of dark complexion and medium build, she has dark eyes and black long hair that she wears tied back. She speaks Aymara as her mother tongue and Spanish because of her job and as part of the general culture.

She shares her life with her partner, who also works, and they live in her parents house. It is a brick house with a tin roof, it has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system.

She works Monday to Sunday selling traditional foods in her house such as 'plato paceño' (corn, beans, boiled potatoes with fried cheese and chili), 'fricasé paceño' (pork soup with corn, 'chuño' and yellow pepper), 'chairo paceño' ('chuño' soup with lamb and wheat) and other dishes.

'I started helping my mom and then, with very little money, I set up my own business' she says.

She wishes to improve her business to help her family. She wants to buy tables and chairs so that she can sell food to more customers. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the year she has been independently developing her activity.

These are the reasons why Dania is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to sell traditional food and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to improve her traditional food business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is single with three children. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for 30 years. She works seven days a week. Deborah has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy local gin, local brew, crates of beer and soda. She aspires to build her own business premises. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: to buy local gin, local brew, crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida engages in the buying and selling of native hats. She is a 54-year-old widow woman with two grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been selling hats for five years already.

She has requested a loan to buy a variety of hats to resell. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more hats and deliver them to her respective customers. These will help her augment her income and be able to balance her finances. 

She hopes that she will be able to expand her livelihood to be sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of hats to resell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is single and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas and charcoal and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. She sells on a retail basis, seven days a week.

Milly's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to educate her children to the university level and also buy a plot of land. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to get more cash for transacting his M-Pesa (money transfer) business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase his earnings from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old. He is married with one child. 

He has had a dairy farm and food selling business for one year. He will be using the loan to purchase dairy cow feeds and foods such as maize, beans, rice and sorghum to sell.  He hopes this will help him make more income, open more food selling shops and improve the living standards of his family. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business to other areas, and also provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cow feeds and foods such as maize, beans, rice and sorghum to sell to help him expand, earn more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase his earnings and his supply of milk.

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
O senhor Mario é segurança numa empresa privada tem 42 anos de idade é casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 ainda menor 2 a estudarem, sustenta dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar arroz, açúcar, óleo, feijāo, sabāo, caldos e ovos para reforcar o seu negócio tem uma mini mercearia em casa. 
Diz que seu sonho é ver  o seu negócio crescer, conseguir responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes.
Principais desafios e insuficiência de fundos, saturaçāo do mercado e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassá los faz xitique  e que irá levantar mais créditos como forma de alcançar seus objectivos
texts.en:
Mario, 42, is a security guard at a private company. He is married and a father of three children, one of whom is still young and two of whom are studying. He supports two nephews who live with him in his house.

He says that he will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, broth, and eggs to strengthen his business. He has a minimarket in his home. He says that his dream is to see his business grow and to continue serving all of his clients' needs. 

His main challenges are a lack of funds, market saturation and the high cost of living. To overcome these, he saves with the "xitique" group model and will also take out more loans in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, broth, and eggs.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Senhor Ezequiel tem 38 anos de idade,  casado e pai de  filhos, vive em casa própria, trabalha como servente de mesa num restaurante, nāo sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado irá aplicar na compra de farinha, carne, ovos yogurtes, palones no país vizinho para revender no solo pátrio, como forma de aumentar a renda , visto que o salário nāo satisfáz as despezas da familia.
No futuro pretende construir aviários numa quinta que acaba de adiquirir, para iniciar a criaçāo de frangos, e suinos.
O seu desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora, e garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos até ao nίvel superior
texts.en:
Ezequiel, 38, is married and a father. He lives in his own house and works as a table server in a restaurant. He does not support any additional people.

He will use this loan to buy flour, meat, eggs, yogurt, and "palon" in a neighboring country to sell in his own country in order to raise his income, since his current salary does not cover his family's expenses.

In the future, he hopes to construct aviaries in a field which he has recently acquired in order to start raising chickens and pigs. His challenge is to pay off the loan without delays and to ensure that his children have the support to study up to the higher education level.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, eggs, yogurt, and "palon".

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells soft drinks and fruit juice. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. 

Rose gets additional income from rearing cattle. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy pineapples, watermelon, and oranges for making juice, as well as crates of soda. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a bigger fridge so as to serve more customers. 

Rose lives in rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, watermelon, and oranges for making juice, as well as crates of soda

loans.name: Luciano

texts.pt:
O senhor Luciano é militar tem 38 anos de idade casado pai de 2 filhos a frequentarem o ensino primario,  vive na casa propria e sustenta sua mae e 4 irmaos enviando.
Com este credito pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e blocos para ampliar sua casa ( mais um quarto, uma casa de banho e varanda). 
Diz que seu sonho é concluir a sua  obra para oferecer melhores condicoes de vida  a sua familia. 
 Tem comio principais desafios insuficiência de fundos e elevado custo de vida. Para ultrapassá los  tem  uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar e diz que ira levantar mais creditos como forma de alcancar seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Luciano, 38, is a soldier. He is a father of two children, who are in primary school. He lives in his own house and supports his mother and four siblings by mail.

With this loan, he plans to buy cement, sand, stone, iron, and blocks to expand his house (adding a room, a bathroom, and a porch). He says that his dream is to finish construction in order to give his family better living conditions.

His main challenges are a lack of funds and a high cost of living. In order to overcome these, he has an account where he deposits savings and he says that he will take out more loans in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, iron, and blocks to expand his house (adding a room, a bathroom and a porch).

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Senhora Maria tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais a mais nova estuda frenquentando o ensino técnico médio em contabilidade, vive em casa própria com a sua familia, e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de refrescos , cerveja, arroz, farinha, para revender  na sua mercearia.
No futuro pretende melhorar as condições de habitação, ampliar o seu negócio de modo a garantir o sustento escolar da filha até fazer o ensino superior.
O  seu  maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora para garantir mais financiamentos  como forma de realizar mais rápido os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, is married and a mother of five children. Her youngest daughter is studying a technical degree in Accounting. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, beer, rice, and flour to resell in her store. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and expand her business in order to ensure support for her daughter's studies up to the higher education level. Her greatest challenge is to pay off the loan without delays in order to guarantee more loans so that she can carry out her projects more quickly.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer, rice, and flour to resell in her store.

loans.name: Döndü

texts.en:
Döndü is married and the mother of three children.  She runs a tea shop in her neighborhood.  Her husband opened and ran the tea shop, and Döndü took over when business wasn’t going well.  With her children’s help, she was able to turn a profit.  She has been running it  for 15 years and scrambled a lot in that time, she says.  

She’ll use the loan from Maya to buy ingredients wholesale.  These ingredients will last her a few months and she’ll make more of a profit after paying up front.  She wants to expand her work in the future. She wants to make some alterations and remodel to make the tea shop nicer.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Döndü Hanım evli ve üç çocuk annesi.  Oturduğu mahallede çay ocağı işletmeciliği yapıyor.  Eşinin açıp işletemediği çağ ocağını ,işler daha da kötüye gidince Döndü Hanım işi devir alıyor.  Çocuklarının yardımları ile işletmesini zarardan kara geçiriyor.  Onbeş yıldır çay ocağının işletmesine devam ediyor.  Bu süre içerisinde çok mücadele verdiğini söylüyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile toplu malzeme alacak.  Bu malzemelerin onu birkaç ay idare edeceğini ,bu sürede de toptancıya ödeme yapmayacağından daha çok kar elde edeceğini vurguladı.  İleride İşini daha da büyütmek istiyor.  Güzel bir tadilat ve dekorasyonla güzel bir mekan yaratmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale for her tea shop; she'll make more profit after paying up front.

loans.name: Mahegabena

texts.fr: Etant mariée, Mahegabena est âgée de 52 ans et habite avec son mari et ses quatre enfants dans le quartier de Sogbossito. Mahegabena vend de la boisson locale communément appelée Tchoucoutchou. Grâce ce commerce Mahegabena trouve le bénéfice nécessaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Mahegabena s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Assiyéyé. Mahegabena demande ce prêt pour des sacs de mil afin d’avoir une marge bénéficiaire favorable au travers de son commerce.
texts.en:
Married, Mahegabena is 52 and lives with her husband and her four children in the neighborhood of Sogbossito. Mahegabena sells local brew commonly called Tchoucoutchou. Thanks to this business, Mahegabena is able to make enough income to help her husband cover family expenses. Mahegabena buys her supplies once a month at the market of Assiyéyé.

 Mahegabena is requesting this loan for sacks of millet so as to make a good profit with her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of millet.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Agus. Agus lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, about two hours from Jakarta by plane. Agus owns a stall that provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn more about how to improve his business using technology. His community sees Agus as a friendly person; that’s why it’s really easy for him to attract customers.
 
As the business grows, Agus is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agus improve his business and accordingly, his community who need access to such services.  Agus’ goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to provide an e-commerce service for his community. As seen in the photo, Agus is the one who is sitting. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Malach

texts.en:
Malach is 33 years old and married to Zipporah. They are blessed with three children ages 10, six and two years old. He has been in a welding business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

Malach has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, in order to enable him to purchase metal bars for making windows and metal doors.  He hopes this will help him buy new stock of metal bars in order to expand his business and realize more profits.

He hopes to educate his children and remain committed to his work as his business expands.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production in order to enable him to purchase metal bars for making windows and metal doors.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She has no additional family members. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

Phiona sells bunches of green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works six days per week, and has been in this business for the last four years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Brenda makes a living through a clothes retail business. Brenda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as pants, dresses, shirts, and others. She also wants to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. A loan will help her to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Brenda dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as pants, dresses, shirts, and others.

loans.name: Melsik

texts.en:
Melsik is 68 years old and lives in the village of Nerkin Hand, Syunik region. Melsik is married and he has three children, all of whom are already grown up, married, and now live in Yerevan city. Melsik’s wife also lives in Yerevan with their eldest son’s family. Melsik regularly visits his lovely grandchildren and family members. 

He spends the main part of the year in the village, taking care of his bee families. He has a lot of beehives and each season he manages to sell a lot of honey, both in his village and in Yerevan during his visits. Melsik has a higher education in the specialty field of engineering, and since a young age he has always been employed in his specialty. Since being unemployed and learning all the secrets and skills of beekeeping over the years, Melsik is now seriously engaged in it. His honey is in great demand since it is very pure, healing and tasty. 

Now, Melsik asks for this loan as he wants to buy 10 more bee families to enlarge and develop his bee keeping activities.

loans.use: to buy 10 more bee families to enlarge and develop his beekeeping activities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production sales, as well as add to his stock of cattle, through which his children will be educated.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a merchant selling mango, fresh fish and vegetables. She sells it to the locals in the community. She is a married woman with three children and a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 19 while the youngest is 14. Her husband is a fisherman. His income is a great help for the family's daily needs.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies like vegetables, fish and fuel for the motorboat. She will be able to earn more and be able to handle her finances, so she will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

She hopes that she can manage her current livelihood well, to be productive and successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, fish and fuel for her husband's motorboat.

loans.name: Tansu

texts.en:
Tansu is married with two children.  One of her children is in school, and the other is too young.  To lighten her husband’s load and contribute to the household income, she earned some money making boxes for gold.  On her sister’s advice, she began selling Tupperware (kitchen appliances, storage boxes, etc.) At first she didn’t know what she was doing and didn’t make a lot of sales. When she began doing well at it, she decided to do this job. 

She sells to her friends in the neighborhood and is happy with the work.  With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy products to sell.  In the future, she wants to earn more to raise and educate her children well.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Tansu Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuğunu biri okula gidiyor ,diğeri ise daha küçük.  Eşinin yükünü hafifletmek, ev ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için ,evinde altın kutuları yapıp ek gelir sağlıyor.  Kardeşinin önerisi ile Tupperware(mutfak gereçleri,saklama kapları v.s.) ile tanışıyor .  İlk başlarda nasıl olur diye düşünerek az ürün alıp satıyor.Satışları iyi gidince bu işi yapmaya karar veriyor.  Mahallede çevresine satış yapıyor.  İşinden memnun.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi  ile ürün alacak.  İleride daha çok kazanıp ,çocuklarını en güzel şekilde yetiştirip ,okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.
